!! _&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|+EDIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$78db&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|^]]


A shortcut to get back into the editor. On the PET keyboard, there is no
underscore, it's the left-arrow character.

~ turn this into a word that does a screencap into the last packet

```
: _   ( -- )
    scr @ edit ;
```
!!!pronounced: "back"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_back
    jsr enter
    .word scr
    .word fetch
    .word _edit
    .word exit

```

!! -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( a b -- a-b )

[[<<|2*]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0d1b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|<>]]






<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
minus
    jsr donegate
    jmp plus

```

!! -->&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|DUMP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$75a9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|ID.]]


An immediate word which loads the next screen of Forth source

!!! pronounced: "next-block"

```
: -->   ( -- )
    blk 1+!  >in off  source! ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_nextblock
    jsr enter
    .word blk
    .word oneplusstore
    .word toin
    .word off
    .word _sourcestore
    .word exit

```

!! -1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- -1 )

<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
minusone
                ; fall through to true
```

minustwo

minusthree
    jsr doconst

```

!! -NULLS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr +n1 -- addr +n2 )

[[<<|BLANK]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0e10&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|-TRAILING]]



 The character count +n1 of a text string beginning at addr
 is adjusted to exclude trailing nulls.  If +n1 is zero,
 then +n2 is also zero.  If the entire string consists of
 nulls, then +n2 is zero.

```
: -nulls   ( addr n1 -- addr n2 )
     dup 0
     ?do
         2dup + 1- c@
         0 <>
     ?leave
         1-
     loop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dashnulls
    lda #$00
    .byt $2c        ; BIT xxxx
                    ; fall through

```

!! -ROT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( a b c -- c a b )

[[<<|TUCK]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c15&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|NIP]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dashrot
    ldy stackh,x
    lda stackl,x        ; b
    pha
    jsr tuckdashrot
    pla
    jmp put             ; b -> c

```

!! -TRAILING&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr +n1 -- addr +n2 )

[[<<|-NULLS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0e13&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;47&nbsp;[[>>|CMOVE]]



 The character count +n1 of a text string beginning at addr
 is adjusted to exclude trailing spaces.  If +n1 is zero,
 then +n2 is also zero.  If the entire string consists of
 spaces, then +n2 is zero.

```
: -trailing   ( addr n1 -- addr n2 )
     dup 0
     ?do
         2dup + 1- c@
         bl <>
     ?leave
         1-
     loop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dashtrailing
    lda #$20
    sta n+2
    lda stackl,x
    sta n
    lda stackh,x
    clc
    adc tos+1
    sta n+1
    lda #>(put-1)
    pha
    lda #<(put-1)
    pha
dashtrailings
    ldy tos
dashtrailing01
    dey
    cpy #$ff
    bne dashtrailing02
    dec n+1
    lda tos+1
    beq dashtrailing03
    dec tos+1
dashtrailing02
    lda (n),y
    eor n+2
    beq dashtrailing01
dashtrailing03
    iny
    tya
    ldy tos+1
    rts
    ;jmp put

```

!! ,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( w -- )

```
_comma
    jsr enter
    .word here
    .word store
    .word two
    .word _allot
    .word exit

```

!! ,X&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|MEM]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7cd5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|,Y]]


!!!Assembler mode
Indexed X addressing mode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
asmindexx
    jsr _doasmmode
    .byt 3

```

!! ,Y&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|,X]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7cd9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|X)]]


!!!Assembler mode
Indexed Y addressing mode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
asmindexy
    jsr _doasmmode
    .byt 4

```

!! ;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|CLOSE-DEFINITION]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$713e&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|?:]]


 An immediate word which terminates a colon-definition and
 stops further compilation. Compiles the run-time `exit`

!!! pronounced: "semi"

```
: ;   ( -- )
    [compile] exit  closedefinition ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_semi
    jsr enter
    .word _compile
    .word exit
    .word _closedefinition
    .word exit

```

!! ;CODE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|(;CODE)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7caf&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|END-CODE]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_semicode
    jsr enter
    .word _qcomp
    .word _compile
    .word _psemicode
    .word _closedefinition
    .word _codefixup
    .word exit

```

!! :&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|CREATE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7104&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;27&nbsp;[[>>|CLOSE-DEFINITION]]


 A defining word executed in the form:

 `: <name> ... ;`

 Creates a word definition for `<name>` in the compilation
 vocabulary and sets compilation state true. Text from the
 input stream is subsequently compiled.  `<name>` is called
 a "colon definition".  The newly created word definition
 for `<name>` cannot be found in the dictionary until the
 corresponding `;` or `;CODE` is successfully processed.

 An error condition exists if a word is not found and cannot
 be converted to a number or if, during compilation from mass
 storage, the input stream is exhausted before encountering `;`
 or `;CODE`.  The stack is checked for balance when a `;`
 terminates the definition.

!!! pronounced: "colon"

```
: :   ( -- )
    0pairs  redefined off  ['] enter literal (create)
    !csp latest smudge ] ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_colon
    jsr enter
    .word _zeropairs
    .word redefined
    .word off                   ; turn REDEFINED off before (CREATE)
    .word pagealign
    .word plit
    .word enter
    .word _pcreate
    .word storecsp
    .word _latest
    .word smudge                ; smudge the newly minted symbol
    .word _rbracket
    .word exit

```

!! !&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n addr -- )

[[<<|C!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$09ae&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|2DROP]]



Store 16 bits of n at address.

!!! pronounced "store"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
store
    sec
    ldy #0      ; [2]
    lda stackl,x    ; [4]
    sta (tos),y ; [6]
    bcc twodrop
    lda stackh,x    ; [4]
    iny         ; [2]
    sta (tos),y ; [6]       ; MSB is stored last, this is important to EVENTS
    ; fall through
```

!! !+&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr n -- addr+2 )

[[<<|$!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1087&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|C!+]]



Stores n at addr, returns the following address

note: Does an inverted store operation!

!!! pronounced: "store-plus"

`PAD 4096 0 DO I !+ LOOP DROP`

* 109 jiffies, 11 bytes (Forth)
* 245 jiffies, 7 bytes (Sweet16)
* 65 jiffies, 25 bytes (6502)


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_storeplus
    jsr enter
    .word over
    .word store
    .word twoplus
    .word exit

;storeplus
;    lda tos
;    sta n
;    lda tos+1
;    sta n+1
;    jsr slide
;    ldy #0
;    lda n
;    sta (tos),y
;    iny
;    lda n+1
;    sta (tos),y
;    jmp twoplus

;storeplus
;    brk
;    .byt ld | TOS
;    .byt st | N0
;    .byt pull
;    .byt ld | N0
;    .byt std | TOS
;    .byt nxt

```

!! !CSP

[[<<|?CSP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7390&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|PAIRS]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
storecsp
    stx uarea+usercsp-userarea
    jmp next

```

!! ?&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- )

[[<<|D.R]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$150e&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|B/BUF]]


Fetches the value at `addr` and outputs it via [[.]]



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_question
    jsr enter
    .word fetch
    .word _dot
    .word exit

```

!! ?:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( "name1" "name2" -- )

[[<<|;]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7149&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19&nbsp;[[>>|DPSWAP]]


Immediate word that compiles its own runtime word (?:) and two branches. The first branch is the true
branch, and the second is the false branch.  One of those is executed by (?:) at runtime.

Used in the form

```
( flag ) :? this that

is equivalent to

if this else that then

: ?:   ( "name1" "name2" -- )
    ?comp  $f8 ?page [compile] (?:) ' , ' , ; immediate
```
~ fix this page management.  $f8 is overkill


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_querycolon
    jsr enter
    .word _qcomp
    .word _compile
    .word pquerycolon
    .word _tick
    .word _comma
    .word _tick
    .word _comma
    .word exit

```

!! //?<RESOLVE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr cfa family == start )

[[<<|?>RESOLVE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7411&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;21&nbsp;[[>>|DO]]


Compiles a backward branch to an address left by [[?>MARK]] or [[HERE]]

Backward branch handler used by [[LOOP]] [[+LOOP]]

Used by: [[LOOP]] [[+LOOP]] [[REPEAT]] [[AGAIN]] [[UNTIL]]

```
: ?<resolve   ( addr cfa family == start )
    drop xt, dup>r here 2- - c, r> ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qfromresolve
    jsr enter
    .word drop              ; discard PAIRS index, we are closing
    .word _xtcomma          ; compile the CFA of the backward branch
    .word duptor
    .word here
    .word twominus
    .word minus
    .word _ccomma                   ; ?<RESOLVE
    .word rfrom
    .word exit

```

!! //?>MARK//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( cfa family == start )

[[<<|CONTROL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$73f1&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|?>RESOLVE]]


Sets up a forward branch.  Compiles a forward-branching `cfa`
with an unresolved offset of `0` to be handled later by the 
matching pair-closing word.  Leaves the address of the offset
as the `start` of the control structure.

Used by: [[DO]] [[?DO]] [[IF]] [[WHILE]]

```
: ?>mark  ( cfa family == start )
    drop xt, here 0 c, ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qtomark
    jsr enter
    .word drop
    .word _xtcomma
    .word here
    .word zero
    .word _ccomma
    .word exit

```

!! //?>RESOLVE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( start == )

[[<<|?>MARK]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7400&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|?<RESOLVE]]


Resolves a forward branch created by [[?>MARK]] or [[HERE]]

Used by: [[IF]] [[WHILE]]

```
' (do) 3 control do ]
    drop xt, 0 c, here ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qtoresolve
    jsr enter
    .word here
    .word oneplus
    .word over
    .word minus
    .word swap
    .word cstore                    ; ?>RESOLVE
    .word exit

```

!! //?BRANCH//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( flag -- )

[[<<|DOPAGE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$092c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|BRANCH]]


If the flag is zero, takes the branch


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
qbranch
    lda tos
    ldy stackl,x
    sty tos
    ldy stackh,x
    inx
    ora tos+1
    sty tos+1
    bne bump
    ; fall through

```

!! //?CHAR//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( char -- addr )

[[<<|WORD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6f8f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|INTERPRET]]


Scans ahead in the input stream until `char` is found.  Moves >IN beyond
that character.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qchar
    jsr enter
    .word _word
    .word toin
    .word oneplusstore
    .word exit

```

!! //?COMP//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|?ERROR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$70db&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|COMPILE]]


Check the [[STATE]] variable to see if we are compiling, issue an
error if [[STATE]] is off ([[INTERPRET]] mode)

```
: ?comp   ( -- )
    compiling? 5 ?error ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qcomp
    ldy #5                      ; "COMPILATION ONLY"
    lda uarea+userstate-userarea
    beq qerror00
    jmp next

```

!! //?CSP//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|SAVE-FORTH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7389&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|!CSP]]


Generates an error if the data stack is unbalanced when defining
`CODE` or `:` words


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
qcsp
    ldy #4              ; DEFINITION UNFINISHED
    cpx uarea+usercsp-userarea
    bne comperror
    ; fall through
```

!! ?DO&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( == dp ) ( limit start -- )

[[<<|DO]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7430&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|LOOP]]



```
' (?do) 3 control ?do ]
    drop xt, 0 c, here ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qdo
    jsr docontrol
    .word pqdo
    .byt 3
    .word _qtomark
    .word exit

```

!! ?DUP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( 0 -- 0 | n -- n n )

[[<<|NIP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c25&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|DUP]]


 DUP if top of stack is nonzero


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
qdup
    lda tos
    ora tos+1
    beq qdup01
    ; fall through
```

!! ?ERROR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( flag -- )

[[<<|UNDEFINE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$70c7&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;20&nbsp;[[>>|?COMP]]


Aborts with the inline numbered error if the flag is true

```
does>
    c@ swap  ?: fail drop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
qerror
    lda tos
    ora tos+1
    beq qerror01
    ldy #2
    lda (ip),y
    tay
qerror00
    jmp error
qerror01
    jsr slide
    jmp bump

```

!! ?EXIT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( flag -- )

[[<<|(")]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$081f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|?STACK]]


Exits the calling word if the flag is true

```
: ?exit   ( flag -- )
    if rdrop then ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qexit
    jsr enter
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(qexit01-*+1)
    .word rdrop
qexit01
    .word exit

```

!! ?KEY&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- c )

[[<<|KEY]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$129b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|?TERMINAL]]


Get a character from the keyboard, or 0 if no key pressed


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
qkey
    stx z
    jsr GETIN
    bcs key02

```

!! ?LEAVE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( )

[[<<|LEAVE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7460&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|IF]]


Equivalent to `IF LEAVE THEN`

```
' (?leave) -3 control ?leave ]
    +/-pairs xt, ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qleave
    jsr docontrol
    .word pqleave
    .byt <(-3)
    .word plusminuspairs
    .word drop
    .word _xtcomma
    .word exit

```

!! //?MKPKTS//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( blk -- )

[[<<|MKPKTS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$16d3&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;21&nbsp;[[>>|WRAP!]]


Used by [[BLOCK]] to create empty packets.  If `blk` references a packet
higher than  [[#VMPKT]], generates new packets at the tail of the buffer
(screen or data, based on [[EDITING]])

```
: ?mkpkts   ( blk -- )
    #vmpkt @ - dup 0<
    ?: drop mkpkts ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qmkpkts
    jsr enter
    .word numvmpkt
    .word fetch
    .word minus
    .word dup
    .word zlt
    .word pquerycolon
    .word drop
    .word _mkpkts
    .word exit

```

!! //?NOPAIRS//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|0PAIRS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$73a5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|+/-PAIRS]]


Aborts compilation if any control structures are still open

```
: ?pairs   ( -- )
    [ 'pairs ] literal  3c@ or six ?error ; 
```
!!! pronounced: //"query-pairs-closed"//


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qnopairs
    jsr enter
    .word _pairs
    .word threecfetch
    .word orx
#include "page3.i65"
    .word qerror
    .byt 6                      ; UNPAIRED CONDITIONALS
    .word exit

```

!! ?PAUSE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|PAUSE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$19d9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|JIFFY@]]


Scans keyboard and if 'space' was pressed, pauses until any key
is pressed.

```
: ?pause   ( -- )
    ?key bl =
    if false pause then ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_qpause
    jsr enter
    .word qkey
    .word bl
    .word eq
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(qpause01-*+1)
    .word false
    .word _pause
qpause01
    .word exit

```

!! ?STACK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|?EXIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0829&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|SYSERR]]


Check the  data stack pointer for sanity, abort if trouble


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
qstack
    ldy #2                          ; 2 = stack full
    txa
    bmi error
    dey                             ; 1 = stack empty
    cmp uarea+usersp0-userarea
    bcc rpstore01
    ;fall through
```

!! ?TERMINAL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- flag )

[[<<|?KEY]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$12a2&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|CR]]


Returns true if the stop key was pressed


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
qterminal
    ldy #0
    lda $9b
    cmp #$ef            ; check STOP key
    bne qterminal01
    dey
qterminal01
    tya
    jmp pushya

```

!! .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- )

[[<<|U.]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$14d0&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|U.R]]




 The value of n is displayed in a free field for-
 mat with a leading minus sign if n is negative.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dot
    jsr enter
    .word _pdot             ; ( addr count )
tse
    .word type              ; ( )
    .word _space            ; ( )
    .word exit

```

asmdota

!! .R&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 w -- )

!! .S

[[<<|PETSCII]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$74e8&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;53&nbsp;[[>>|H.]]


Output the data stack

```
: .s ( ?? -- ?? )
    depth ?dup
    if
        0 do
            depth i - 1- pick  7 u.r space
        loop
    else
        ." stack empty"
    then ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dots
    jsr enter
    .word depth
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(dots02-*+1)
    .word zero
    .word pdo
    .byt <(dots04-*+1)
dots01
    .word depth
    .word i
    .word minus
    .word oneminus
    .word pick
    .word seven
    .word _udotr
    .word _space
    .word ploop
    .byt <(dots01-*+1)
dots02
    .word pdq
    .byt dots03-*-1
    .asc "STACK EMPTY"
dots03
dots04
    .word exit

```

!! '&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- cfa )

[[<<|EXISTS?]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6df8&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|SOURCE.TIB]]


Parse the next token in the input stream and search for it,
returning the CFA if successful.  Otherwise aborts with the
message "NOT FOUND"

```
: '   ( "name" -- cfa )
    exists? 0=  3 ?error ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_tick
    jsr enter
    .word _existsq
    .word zeq
#include "page3.i65"
    .word qerror
    .byt 3                      ; NOT FOUND
    .word exit

```

!! //'STREAM//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr size )

[[<<|SCAN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6f47&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|WORD]]


Calculates SOURCE offset by >IN with respect to buffer size.

```
 : 'stream   ( -- addr size )
       source   ( baseaddr size )
       dup >in @ min /string ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_tickstream
    jsr enter
    .word source
    .word dup
    .word toin
    .word fetch
    .word _min
    .word _slashstring
    .word exit

```

!! "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( text" == ) ( -- addr )

[[<<|(."")]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$724b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|".&quot;"]]


State-smart string literal.  In compile mode, encloses a string
in the dictionary.  In interpret mode, returns the address of a
string ([[PAD]])

```
: "   ( text" == ) ( -- addr )
    [ ' (") ] literal   (."")  $>pad ;
```
!!!pronounced: "quote"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_quote
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word pquote
    .word _pdqq
    .word _stringtopad
    .word exit

```

!! ".&quot;"&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( text" -- )

[[<<|"]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7258&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|ABORT"]]


Output a string

Scans ahead in the input stream for a close " character and
encloses the string in the dictionary.

```
: ."   ( text" == ) ( -- addr )
    [ ' (.") ] literal   (."")  $. ;
```
!!!pronounced: "dot-quote"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dotq
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word pdq
    .word _pdqq
    .word _stringdot
    .word exit

```

!! //(?:)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( flag -- )

[[<<|dectos]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07d5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;24&nbsp;[[>>|EXECUTE]]


The runtime of [[?:]], invokes one of the two high-level Forth words
following this instruction


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pquerycolon
    ldy #3
    lda tos
    ora tos+1                   ; evaluate the flag
    bne pquerycolon01           ; true?
    ldy #5                      ; false.
pquerycolon01
    lda (ip),y
    sta tos+1
    dey
    lda (ip),y
    sta tos
    lda #3
    jsr padjust
    ; fall through
```

!! //(?DO)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( end begin -- )

[[<<|(?LEAVE)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$095b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;2&nbsp;[[>>|(DO)]]


Performs a do-loop if end<>begin



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pqdo
    sec
    .byt $29            ; AND# to skip CLC instruction
                        ; fall through
```

!! //(?LEAVE)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( flag -- )

[[<<|BRANCH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$094d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|(?DO)]]


If flag is nonzero, exit the do loop early


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pqleave
    lda tos
    ora tos+1
    php
    jsr slide
    plp
    bne unloop
    jmp next

```

!! //(."")//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( cfa text" -- )

[[<<|\]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$722c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;31&nbsp;[[>>|"]]


common code for ." and "

```
: (."")  ( cfa -- )
    compiling?  dup>r  ?: xt, drop
    [char] " ?char swap  r>
    if
        $, rdrop
    then
    drop ;
```
~ gross.  doesn't handle paging properly


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pdqq
    jsr enter
    .word state
    .word fetch
    .word duptor
    .word pquerycolon
    .word _xtcomma
    .word drop
    .word clit
    .byt '"'
    .word _qchar
    .word rfrom
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(pdqq01-*+1)
    .word _stringcomma
    .word rdrop
pdqq01
    .word exit

```

!! //(.")//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|SYSERR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0841&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;30&nbsp;[[>>|padjust]]


Displays an inline string


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pdq
    sec
pdq01
    jsr slip        ; [.]
    ldy ip+1        ; [3]
    sty tos+1       ; [3]
    ldy ip          ; [3]
    iny             ; [2]
    iny             ; [2]
    sty tos         ; [3]
    bne pdq02       ; [3]
    inc tos+1       ; [2]
pdq02
    bcc pquote01
    lda #>(_stringdot-1)
    pha
    lda #<(_stringdot-1)
    pha
    ldy #0
    lda (tos),y             ; get length byte
    ; fall through
```

!! //(")//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|RP!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0813&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|?EXIT]]


Returns the address of a string literal in the dictionary

~ this is pretty ugly


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pquote
    clc
    bcc pdq01
pquote01
    ldy #2
    lda #3
    adc (ip),y
    jmp pad

```

!! //(#)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( +d1 -- +d2 )

[[<<|SIGN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1439&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;35&nbsp;[[>>|(DIGIT)]]


base is the current system number base, which must be between 2 and 36.
This helper primitive divides d1 by BASE, returning the quotient d2
and the remainder (as an ascii digit).  Called by '#'


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
psharp
        lda  #0         ;partial remainder
        ldy  #32        ;loop counter
psharp2
        asl  stackl,x   ;Dividend
        rol  stackh,x   ;  is gradually replaced
        rol  tos        ;  with the quotient
        rol  tos+1      ;a is gradually replaced
        rol             ;  with the remainder
        cmp  uarea+userbase-userarea       ;partial remainder < BASE?
        bcc  psharp3     ;  no: update the partial
        sbc  uarea+userbase-userarea       ;    remainder and partial
        inc  stackl,x   ;    quotient
psharp3
        dey
        bne  psharp2     ;loop 32 times
        cmp  #10
        sed
        adc  #'0'       ;adjust remainder to ASCII
        cld
        jmp  pushya     ; actually need to do a HOLD

```

!! //(+LOOP)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- )

[[<<|ENTER]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$089c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;44&nbsp;[[>>|(LOOP)]]


Add `n` to inner loop index.  If loop index exceeds loop limit,
then iterate back to (do), otherwise exit the loop.  PETTIL uses
four bytes of zero page for the inner loop index/limit, for speed

[[Posted question on comp.lang.forth|https://groups.google.com/d/msg/comp.lang.forth/V9evPkLwRoM/Khwons3O4QwJ]]


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pploop
    sec             ; [2]
    lda zi          ; [3]
    sbc zlim        ; [3]
    sta n           ; [3]
    lda zi+1        ; [3]
    sbc zlim+1      ; [3]
    eor #$80        ; [2]
    tay             ; [2]
    clc             ; [2]
    lda n           ; [3]
    adc tos         ; [3]
    tya             ; [2]
    adc tos+1       ; [3]
    php             ; [3]
    clc             ; [2]
    lda tos         ; [3]
    adc zi          ; [3]
    sta zi          ; [3]
    lda tos+1       ; [3]
    adc zi+1        ; [3]
    sta zi+1        ; [3]
    jsr slide       ; [.]
    plp             ; [4]
    bvc branch      ; [2]
    bvs unloop

```

!! //(CLIT)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|EXIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0904&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;5&nbsp;[[>>|(LIT)]]


Runtime behavior of `CLITERAL`. Pushes the single byte following IP
on the stack


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
clit
    clc
    lda #0
    beq lit01               ; bra

```

!! //(CREATE)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( cfa -- )

[[<<|FIND]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6a85&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;157&nbsp;[[>>|PASSBITS]]


* for duplicate names (same name & vocabulary)
** issues "//name// EXISTS" warning message
** sets [[REDEFINED]] user variable
* new symbol table entry
** symbol CFA links back to [[HERE]]
** compiles page-aligned `JSR cfa` at [[HERE]]
```
: (create)   ( cfa -- )
    bl word dup c@ 0=
    if 2drop exit then
    current c@ (vfind) nip
    if
        [ RVSON ] cliteral emit
        dup id.
        redefined !
        ." [RVSOFF] EXISTS"
        here
    then
    ( cfa here )
    dup bloom# >bit bloom + cbit!       \ add to bloom filter
    ( cfa here )
    symtail @  dup>r  2+ dup newest !   \ set NEWEST
    ( cfa here symtail+2 ; symtail )
    over nfalen 1+
    ( cfa here symtail+2 nfalen+1 ; symtail )

    current @ ?dup
    if
    ( cfa here symtail+2 nfalen+1 current ; symtail )
        >r  here c@ $40 or here c!
    ( cfa here symtail+2 nfalen+1+1 ; current symtail )
        r> over here + c!  1+
    ( cfa here symtail+2 nfalen+1+1 ; symtail )
    then
    ( cfa here symtail+2 nfalen+1+voc ; symtail )

    2dup +
    ( cfa here symtail+2 len+1 len+symtail+3 ; symtail )
    dup symtail ! 3 erase              \ mark new symtail
    ( cfa here symtail+2 len+1 ; symtail )
    cmove cfa,
    ( cfa ; symtail )
    here 3- r> ! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pcreate
    jsr enter
    .word bl
    .word _word
    .word dup
    .word cfetch
    .word zeq
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(pcreate03-*+1)
    .word twodrop
    .word exit
pcreate03
    .word current
    .word cfetch
    .word _pvfind
    .word nip
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(pcreate02-*+1)
    .word clit
    .byt RVSON
    .word emit
    .word dup
    .word _iddot
    .word redefined
    .word store
    .word pdq
    .byt pcreate01-*-1
    .byt RVSOFF
    .asc    " EXISTS "
pcreate01
    .word here
pcreate02
    .word dup
    .word bloomhash
    .word tobit
    .word bloom
    .word plus
    .word cbitstore
    .word symtail
    .word fetch
    .word duptor
    .word twoplus
    .word dup
    .word newest
    .word store
    .word over
    .word nfalen
    .word oneplus
    .word current
    .word fetch
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(pcreate04-*+1)
    .word tor
    .word here
    .word cfetch
    .word clit
    .byt $40
    .word orx
    .word here
    .word cstore
    .word rfrom
    .word over
    .word here
    .word plus
    .word cstore
    .word oneplus
pcreate04
    .word twodup
    .word plus
    .word dup
    .word symtail
    .word store
    .word three
    .word _erase
    .word cmove
    .word _cfacomma
    .word here
    .word threeminus
    .word rfrom
    .word store
    .word exit

```

!! //(D.)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d -- )

[[<<|(UD.)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1493&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19&nbsp;[[>>|(U.)]]

: (d.)
    dup>r  dabs  <# #s r> sign #> ;

!! //(DIGIT)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- c )

[[<<|(#)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$145c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|#]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pdigit
    lda tos
    sed
    cmp #10
    adc #'0'
    cld
    sta tos
    jmp next

```

!! //(DO)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( end begin -- )

[[<<|(?DO)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$095d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;57&nbsp;[[>>|4DROP]]


Loops from "begin" to "end"

d;m 0 8f;m 1f0 1ff;m 2160 216f;z



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pdo
    clc
    rol z           ; [5] save C flag as low bit of Z    
    ldy #2          ; [2] set up for EXIT
    lda (ip),y      ; [5] forward branch offset
    clc             ; [2]
    adc ip          ; [3]
    tay             ; [2]
    dey             ; [2]
    lda ip+1        ; [3]
    adc #0          ; [2]
    pha             ; [3]
    tya             ; [2]
    pha             ; [3]
    inc ip          ; [5] skip branch offset ~ pad?
    ror z           ; [3]
    bcc pdo01       ; [2|3] (DO) vs (?DO)
    ;sec             ; [2] tell subeq to exit with RTS
    jsr subeq       ; [.] (?DO), test loop start/limit
    bne pdo01       ; [2|3]
    inx             ; [2] loop indices are identical
    jsr slide       ; [.] 2drop
    ;lda #1
    ;jmp pad        ; instead of inc ip; jmp exit
    jmp exit        ; [3] don't iterate
pdo01
    jsr locals2
    ldy #3
pdo02
    lda zi,y
    pha
    lda tos,y
    sta zi,y
    dey
    bpl pdo02
    bne drop                ; bra

```

!! //(DOES)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|padjust]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0875&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;20&nbsp;[[>>|ENTER]]


Runtime behavior of a word built with `<BUILDS ... DOES>`

|before|<|after|<|h
|^data<br/>stack|^return<br/>stack|^data<br/>stack|^return<br/>stack|h
|||||


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dodoes
    pla             ; [4]
    tay             ; [2]
    pla             ; [4]
    sta z           ; [3]
    jsr slip        ; [.]
    pla             ; [4]
    sta tos         ; [3]
    pla             ; [4]
    sta tos+1       ; [3]
    jsr inctos      ; [.]
    jmp enter01

```

!! //(EDIT)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( scr -- )

[[<<|EDITCMD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7a60&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;49&nbsp;[[>>|EDIT]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pedit
    stx z           ; preserve Forth data stack pointer
    tsx
    stx n           ; preserve machine stack frame pointer

pedit01              ; PET screen editor forever loop
    jsr CHRIN       ; Kernel - blink the cursor, wait for a line of input, ignore it
    lda #$0d        ; don't just leave the cursor two characters past end of line
    jsr CHROUT      ; Kernel - so echo the carriage return
    jmp pedit01      ; ... do this forever

pedit02              ; this is edit's IRQ handler, enabled/disabled by _editirqtoggle
    lda $9b         ; copy of contents of PIA1 Port B for testing STOP key, etc...
    cmp #$ef        ; test STOP key
    bne pedit03
                    ; looks like someone pressed STOP. Exit the editor
                    ; but not so fast!  Are we in quotes or inserts?
    lda $cd         ; nonzero is quotes mode
    ora $dc         ; number of inserts pending
    beq pedit04
pedit03
    jmp MAINIRQ     ; not yet?  perform normal system IRQ

; if we get here, clean up from cursor wink and bail out of the IRQ
pedit04
    jsr UDTIM       ; keep the clock running even if someone leans on STOP
    ;sec            ; because f7a1 debounce loop always sets carry
    inc $a7         ; turn off cursor
    lda $a9         ; true character at cursor position
    jsr FIX_CHR     ; ROM $E606 on 40-column BASIC4 PET
    ldx n
    txs             ; reset stack frame
    ldx z           ; restore Forth stack pointer
    jmp next

```

!! (FILE)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|FILE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$179c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;25&nbsp;[[>>|(PRG-FILE)]]


Called at start of tape or disk i/o, sets up zero page variables.
Retrieves DRV# SA# and FILENAME uservariables and stores them
in zero page locations FA SA FNLEN FNADR.

Relies on [[SA#]], [[DRV#]], and [[FILENAME]] being adjacent in uarea

|zero page|<|value|set by|description|h
|^STATUS|^96|^0|rom|^i/o status byte|
|^VERCK|^9d|^0|(file)|^0=load; 1=verify|
|^TAPEID|^b4|^1|(prg-file)|^01=PRG; 02=data; 04=SEQ; 05=EOT|
|^SAL|^c7-c8|^||^start address|
|^EAL|^c9-ca|^||^end address|
|^FNLEN|^d1|^FILENAME[0]|(file)|^File name length|
|^LA|^d2|^0|(file)|^logical file #|
|^SA|^d3|^SA#|(prg-file)|Secondary address|
|^FA|^d4|^DRV#|(file)|Device number|
|^FNADR|^da-db|^FILENAME[1..]|(file)|^File name address|
|^STAL|^fb-fc|^||^start address|

|save|load|verify|open|name|address|description|h
|^?|^?|^?|^?|^FNLEN|^d1|^Length of current file name|
|^?|^?|^?|^?|^FNADR|^da-db|^File name address|
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<|<|<|
|^0|^0|^0|^0|^STATUS|^96|^Status byte ST|
|^?|^0|^1|^?|^VERCK|^9d|^Load/Verify flag (0,1)|
|^01|^?|^?|^?|^TAPEID|^b4|^Tape buffer leading char<br/>01=PRG 05=EOT|
|^?|^?|^?|^?|^EAL|^c9-ca|^Tape end address|
|^?|^?|^?|^?|^LA|^d2|^Current logical file number|
|^?|^?|^?|^?|^SA|^d3|^Current secondary address|
|^?|^?|^?|^?|^FA|^d4|^First address (device number)|
|^?|^?|^?|^?|^TAPE1|^d6|^Pointer - start of tape buffer|
|^?|^?|^?|^?|^FSBLK|^de|^Cassette read/write block count|
|^?|^?|^?|^?|^STAL|^fb-fc|^I/O start address|
|''?'' = don't care<br/>''x'' = don't initialize|<|<|<|<|<|<|f



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pfile
    brk
    .byt set | N0
    .word uarea+userfilename-userarea
    .byt ldd | N0       ; FILENAME
    .byt st | N2        ; pointer to FILENAME[0] or 0
    .byt bz , <(pfile01-*-2)
    .byt ldi | N2
pfile01
    .byt set | N1       ; N1 walks through FNLEN, LA, SA, FA on a PET
    .word FNLEN
    .byt sti | N1       ; set FNLEN ($d1)

;    .byt set | N1
;    .word LA
    .byt sub | ACC      ; 0
    .byt sti | N1       ; set LA ($d2)

;    .byt set | N1
;    .word SA
    .byt ldd | N0       ; get SA#
    .byt sti | N1       ; set SA ($d3)

;    .byt set | N1
;    .word FA
    .byt ldd | N0       ; DRV#
    .byt sti | N1       ; set FA ($d4)

    .byt set | N1
    .word FNADR
    .byt ld | N2
    .byt std | N1       ; set FNADR ($da)
    .byt nxt

```

!! //(FORGET)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( cfa -- )

[[<<|PASS2]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6c51&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;152&nbsp;[[>>|REHASH]]


Rebuilds the symbol table at [[SYMTAB]]

!!!Symbol table entry
|field| size| offset|h
|cfa| 2| -2|
|flags+length| 1| `NFA` 0|
|name| length| +1|
|vocid| 1| +length+1|
A ''//clone//'' is a symbol which has the

* same length,
* same name
* no vocabulary ([[FORTH]]) or same vocabulary
as another symbol in the dictionary, but with each
`clone` having a different `cfa`.  When a word is redefined,
the more recent definition replaces the original, so [[FORGET]]
will reverse that process.  The `smudge` flag bit ($80) is
the key.

Smudge is set between ''[[:]]'' and ''[[;]]'' during a word's
creation. If there is an error during compilation, [[UNDEFINE]]
cleans up the partial (smudged) definition in the symbol table
and also moves [[DP]] back to where it started.  There should
only ever be one symbol at a time that is smudged during word
creation.

The other reason a word is smudged is when it is redefined.
When ''[[;]]'' closes the definition, if there is a previous
active definition ([[REDEFINED]] is non-zero) then it will be
smudged, and the new definition becomes active.  There should
only ever be one active `clone` (the most recent) at a time.

As [[FORGET]] sorts through the symbol table, when it finds a
smudged symbol, that is how it knows it found a `clone`.  Since
PASS1 processes Pearson-hashed symbols in [[SYMTAB]] first,
then [[SYMNEW]] symbols, the first clone found will also be
the original definition of the word.  This order corresponds
to the chronological order in which symbols are added.  At this
point, PASS1 collects all the other clones and smudges them.
When no more clones can be found, the last `clone` is unsmudged,
making it the active one.

```
: (forget)   ( cfa -- )
    1- newdp !
    passbits 4 erase
    >syms pad  over 2+
    begin
        dup nfalen ?dup
    while
        >bit passbits + cbit!
        nfa+
    repeat  drop

( nfa targ )
    32 1 do
        over
        i >bit passbits + cbit@
( nfa targ+ nfa+ flag )
        ?:  pass1 drop
( nfa targ+ )
    loop nip 3 erase
( )
    automem
( )
    symtab @
    pad 2+ >syms
( nfa targ )
    16 0 do
        2dup symtab @ i 2* + ! pass2
    loop
    nip dup 3 erase dup symnew ! symtail !
    newdp @ 1+ dp ! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pforget
    jsr enter
    .word oneminus
    .word newdp
    .word store
    .word passbits
    .word four
    .word _erase
    .word _tosyms
    .word _pad
    .word over
    .word twoplus
pforget01
    .word dup
    .word nfalen
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(pforget02-*+1)
    .word tobit
    .word passbits
    .word plus
    .word cbitstore
    .word nfaplus
    .word branch
    .byt <(pforget01-*+1)
pforget02
    .word drop
    .word bl
    .word one
    .word pdo
    .byt <(pforget04-*+1)
pforget03
    .word over
    .word i
    .word tobit
    .word passbits
    .word plus
    .word cbitfetch
    .word pquerycolon
    .word pass1
    .word drop
    .word ploop
    .byt <(pforget03-*+1)
pforget04
    .word nip
    .word dup
    .word three
    .word _erase
    .word _automem
    .word bloom
    .word eight
    .word _erase
    .word _pad
    .word _tosyms
    .word clit
    .byt 16
    .word zero
    .word pdo
    .byt <(pforget06-*+1)
pforget05
    .word twodup
    .word symtab
    .word fetch
    .word i
    .word twostar
    .word plus
    .word store
    .word pass2
    .word ploop
    .byt <(pforget05-*+1)
pforget06
    .word nip
    .word dup
    .word dup
    .word symnew
    .word store
    .word symtail
    .word store
    .word three
    .word _erase
    .word newdp
    .word fetch
    .word oneplus
    .word dp
    .word store
    .word exit

```

!! //(LIT)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|(CLIT)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0909&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;21&nbsp;[[>>|DOPAGE]]


Runtime behavior of LITERAL, puts a number "n" on the stack



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
plit
    sec
    ldy #3
    lda (ip),y
lit01
    tay
    jsr slip
    sty tos+1
    ldy #2
    lda (ip),y
    sta tos
    .byt $29                ; AND # to skip CLC instruction
bump
    clc
bump01
    lda #3                  ; ip+3 or ip+4 depending on Carry
    ; fall through
```

!! //(LOADVERIFY)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|SAVE-BUFFERS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$17f0&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;42&nbsp;[[>>|LOAD-BUFFERS]]


Load or compare a batch of packets from tape to [[VMBUF]]

```
: (loadverify)   ( flag -- )
    [ VERCK ] literal c!
    (prg-file) (readhead)
    blkbuf dup (casbuf) 1+ dup>r
    2@ - - r> 2! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_ploadverify
    jsr enter
    .word clit
    .byt VERCK
    .word cstore
    .word _pprgfile
    .word preadhead
    .word _blkbuf
    .word dup
    .word casbuf
    .word oneplus
    .word duptor
    .word twofetch
    .word minus
    .word minus
    .word rfrom
    .word twostore
    .word preaddata
    .word _scr0
    .word _numvmpktstore
    .word exit

```

!! //(LOOP)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|(+LOOP)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$08c8&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|UNLOOP]]


Compiled by [[LOOP]], this is the runtime routine to increment
the inner loop index `zi`.  If loop index exceeds loop limit
`zlim`, iterate back to (do), otherwise exit the loop.

PETTIL uses four bytes of [[zero page|PETTIL Zero page memory map]] for the inner loop
index/limit (`zi` `zlim`), for speed


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
ploop
    inc zi
    bne ploop01
    inc zi+1
ploop01
    lda zi
    eor zlim
    bne branch
    lda zi+1
    eor zlim+1
    bne branch
    ;fall through
```

!! //(PRG-FILE)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|(FILE)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$17b5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|(VMBUF)]]


Turn off SA# and set up for PRG file tape i/o

* sets SA# = 0
* sets TAPEID = 1
* invoke [[(FILE)]]
** copy `SA#` to SA
** copy `DRV#` to FA
** copy `FILENAME` to FNADR, FNLEN
** set TAPEID to $01 (PRG)
** set TAPE1 to point to CAS1BUF (or possibly CAS2BUF on a real PET)

```
: (prg-file)   ( -- )
    sa# off  1 TAPEID c!  (file) ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pprgfile
    jsr enter
    .word sanum
    .word off
    .word one
    .word clit          ; ~ can remove this if using $f619
    .byt TAPEID
    .word cstore
    .word pfile
    .word exit

```

!! //(SEEK)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( searchname vocid modeflag startnfa -- nfa xfa flag )

[[<<|NAME>]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$69bb&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;88&nbsp;[[>>|(VFIND)]]


Called by [[(VFIND)]] for each dictionary segment search, e.g.
after this session:

```
VOCABULARY LATIN  OK
VOCABULARY GERMAN  OK
VOCABULARY SPANISH  OK
VOCABULARY FRENCH  OK
VOCABULARY RUSSIAN  OK
FORTH ASSEMBLER FRENCH LATIN  OK
VSTACK 5 DUMP 664E 02 05 01 00 00 OK
```
For each dictionary lookup, `(SEEK)` would be called eight times
in this sequence:

# //unsorted// [[SYMNEW]] of //02// `LATIN`
# //hashed// [[SYMTAB]] of //02// `LATIN`
# //unsorted// [[SYMNEW]] of //05// `FRENCH`
# //hashed// [[SYMTAB]] of //05// `FRENCH`
# //unsorted// [[SYMNEW]] of //01// `ASSEMBLER`
# //hashed// [[SYMTAB]] of //01// `ASSEMBLER`
# //unsorted// [[SYMNEW]] of //00// `FORTH`
# //hashed// [[SYMTAB]] of //00// `FORTH`
```
test case
    : fred   ." yaba daba doo" ;  ok
    vocabulary french  ok
    french definitions  ok
    : fred   ." ooh la la" ;
    fred ooh la la ok
    vocabulary german  ok
    : wilma  ." oui oui" ;
    german definitions  ok
    : fred   ." ja ja yabadoo" ;
    fred ja ja yabadoo ok
    french fred ooh la la ok
    german fred ja ja yabadoo ok
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pseek
    ;ldy #6
    jsr locals6                 ; TOS = startnfa; N0 = searchname
                                ; N1 = vocid; N2 = modeflag (unsorted?)
    sty n+8
    sty n+9                     ; set result = FALSE
    jsr nfalen01
    beq pseek06                 ; end of list?
    lda (n),y
    and #$1f
    ldy n+2
    beq pseek00
    ldy #0
    ora #bit6                   ; set vocab bit
pseek00
    sta (n),y
    and #$1f
    tay
    iny
    lda n+2
    sta (n),y
pseek01
    jsr symcomp
    beq pseek04                 ; vocab/length/name match?
    iny
    beq pseek06                 ; reached end of list?
    lda n+4
    bne pseek02                 ; unsorted list? next!
    tay
    lda (n),y
    and #$1f
    cmp n+13
    bcc pseek06
pseek02
    jsr nfaplus01               ; next!
    bne pseek01                 ; bra
pseek04                         ; winner!
    lda n+12
    and #bit5                   ; immediate?
    beq pseek04b
    tya
    iny
    bne pseek04c
pseek04b
    dey
    tya
pseek04c
    sta n+8
    sty n+9
    brk
    .byt popd | TOS
    .byt ldd | TOS

;    lda (tos),y
;    asl
;    asl
;    asl
;    tya
;    rol
;    sec
;    rol                         ; wind up with 3 or 1
;    sta n+8
;    brk
;    .byt popd | TOS             ; get the CFA
;    .byt ldd | TOS              ; reget the CFA and fix TOS
;    .byt dcr | N4               ; return -1 (not immediate)
;    .byt dcr | N4               ; return -1 (not immediate)
pseek05
    .byt push
    .byt ld | N4                ; return status flag
    .byt push
    .byt nxt
pseek06                         ; loser...
    brk
    .byt ld | N0                ; return NFA FALSE
    .byt st | TOS
    .byt br , <(pseek05-*-2)

```

!! //(SOURCE)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

!! //(UPD1)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( from to howmany char -- )

[[<<|BLOCK]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$18bd&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;30&nbsp;[[>>|(UPD2)]]


Reorganize the stack from some raw, disorganized pointers and
values.  Returns enough to open up a 1024 byte hole in the
VM buffer and trim trailing blanks/nulls from the source buffer,
along with a couple values that are required later.

( src srcbufsiz pkt vmbuf maxbufsiz 0 )

||^data|^editing<br/>screen|<|h
|TOS|0|<|<|
|N0|blkbuf|vidram|src|
|N1|b/buf|b/scr|srcbufsiz|
|N2|pkt|<|dst|
|N3|pktsize|<||
|N4|vmbuf|<|bottom|
|N5|b/buf|<|maxbufsiz|
( bottom pkt floor / src dest src srcbufsiz / vmbuf vmbuf-b/buf pkt-vmbuf )


d;m 0;m 1f0 1ff;m 4ed0 4eff;m 52c0 532f;z



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pupd1
    ;ldy #10
    jsr locals10
    brk
    .byt ldd | N1           ; vmbuf @
    .byt st | N5            ; save for later
    .byt sub | N2           ; vmbuf-1024
    .byt add | TOS          ; vmbuf-1024+size
    .byt dcr | ACC
    .byt dcr | ACC          ; vmbuf-1024+size-2
    .byt st | N6            ; save for later
    ; things we'll need for CMOVE+
    .byt st | TOS           ; =bottom
    .byt ld | N4            ; pkt
    .byt push               ; =pkt
    .byt sub | N2           ; pkt-1024
    .byt st | N7            ; save for later
    .byt push               ; =floor
    ; things we'll need for RLENCODE
    .byt push               ; =dest
    .byt ld | N0            ; blkbuf|vidram
    .byt push               ; =src
    .byt ld | N3            ; b/buf|b/scr
    .byt push               ; =srcbufsiz
    ; things we'll need for CMOVE
    .byt ld | N5
    .byt push               ; =from
    .byt ld | N6
    .byt push               ; =bottom
    .byt ld | N7
    .byt sub | N6
    .byt push               ; =howmany
    .byt nxt

```

!! //(UPD2)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( source floor actualsize wrapd 'scrpkt -- )

[[<<|(UPD1)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$18db&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;38&nbsp;[[>>|(UPD3)]]


Sets up the linewrap bits in the output buffer (if needed) and
gets ready for RLENCODE and squeezing out unused space

||^data|^editing<br/>screen|<|h
|TOS|'scrpkt|<|<|
|N0|floor|<|<|
|N1|blkbuf|vidram|src|
|N2|b/buf|b/scr|srcbufsiz|
|N3|wrapdlo|<|<|
|N4|wrapdhi|<|<|

need 3C@ and 3C! for linewrap



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pupd2
    ;ldy #10
    jsr locals10
    lda n+7                         ; N3+1
    sta n+12                        ; N6
    brk
    .byt ldd | TOS                  ; isscr?
    .byt st | N5                    ; save for later
    .byt bz , <(pupd2b-*-2)
    .byt ldd | TOS                  ; editing?
    .byt bnz , <(pupd2a-*-2)
    .byt ldd | N1
    .byt std | N0
    .byt ldi | N1
    .byt sti | N0                   ; use linewrap from blkbuf
    .byt br , <(pupd2b-*-2)
pupd2a
    .byt ld | N4
    .byt sti | N0
    .byt ld | N6
    .byt sti | N0
    .byt ld | N3
    .byt sti | N0
;    .byt ld | N3
;    .byt sti | N0
;    .byt ld | N6
;    .byt sti | N0
;    .byt ld | N4
;    .byt sti | N0                   ; write linewrap to output
pupd2b
    ; setup for RLENCODE
    .byt ld | N1                    ; from
    .byt st | TOS
    .byt ld | N0                    ; to
    .byt push
    ; setup for -TRAILING or -NULLS
    .byt ld | N1                    ; source
    .byt push
    .byt ld | N2                    ; actual size
    .byt push
    .byt ld | N5                    ; isscr?
    .byt push
    .byt nxt

```

!! //(UPD3)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( )

[[<<|(UPD2)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1901&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;28&nbsp;[[>>|UPDATE]]



||^data|^editing<br/>screen|<|h
|TOS|0|<|<|
|N0|blkbuf|vidram|src|
|N1|b/buf|b/scr|srcbufsiz|
|N2|pkt|<|dst|
|N3|vmbuf|<|bottom|
|N4|b/buf|<|maxbufsiz|

( bottom targend-1 pkt-targend )
+move #vmpkt! ;



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pupd3
    lda tos+1                   ; SCRPKT flag bit to Carry
    ora stackh,x                ; UNCOMPRESSED? flag
    and #$c0
    sta tos+1
    ;ldy #8
    jsr locals8
    sty tos                     ; low byte of packet flags
    brk
    .byt ld | N2
    .byt sub | N1
    .byt add | TOS
    .byt st | N3                ; packet header
    .byt ldd | N3               ; +2
    .byt ld | N2
    .byt st | TOS
    .byt ld | N0
    .byt sub | TOS
    .byt dcr | TOS              ; =targend-1
    .byt push                   ; =pkt-targend
    .byt ld | N3
    .byt std | N0
    .byt nxt

```

!! //(VFIND)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( name vocid -- nfa xfa flag )

[[<<|(SEEK)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6a13&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;54&nbsp;[[>>|FIND]]


Trial search within a vocabulary, used by FIND and (CREATE)

~ this code could stand some tightening up, better commenting

```
: (vfind)   ( name vocid -- nfa xfa flag )
    2dup 2>r  true symnew @ 2+ (seek)
    ?dup 0=
    if
( name name )
        2drop 2r@ false third pearson# 2* symtab @ + @ 2+ (seek)
    then
    rdrop rdrop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pvfind
    jsr enter
    .word twodup
    .word twotor
    .word true
    .word symnew
    .word fetch
    .word twoplus
    .word pseek
    .word qdup
    .word zeq
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(pvfind01-*+1)
    .word twodrop
    .word tworfetch
    .word false
    .word third
    .word pearsonhash
    .word twostar
    .word symtab
    .word fetch
    .word plus
    .word fetch
    .word twoplus
    .word pseek
pvfind01
    .word rdrop
    .word rdrop
    .word exit

```

!! //(VMBUF)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- from to )

[[<<|(PRG-FILE)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$17c7&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|CASBUF]]


Returns the end and start of the virtual memory buffer

```
: (vmbuf)   ( -- vmbuf blkbuf )
    vmbuf @  blkbuf ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pvmbuf
    jsr enter
    .word vmbuf
    .word fetch
    .word _blkbuf
    .word exit

```

!! //(VOCAB)//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|DEDUPVOCAB]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$72f8&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;28&nbsp;[[>>|VDROP]]


The business end of a word defined by [[VOCABULARY]].  Gets the
vocid from the vocabulary and prepends it to [[VSTACK]]

```
: (vocab)   ( -- )
    vstack dup 1+ 8  cmove>
    r@ 1+ c@ vstack c! dedupvocab ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dovocab
    jsr enter
    .word _caller
    .word vstack
    .word dup
    .word oneplus
    .word eight
    .word cmovegt
    .word cfetch
    .word vstack
    .word cstore
    .word dedupvocab
    .word exit

```

!! {'}&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( == ) ( -- n )

[[<<|.(]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7292&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|IMMEDIATE]]

into the dictionary as a [[literal|LITERAL]].  Forces compilation of
immediate words

!! @&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- 16b )

[[<<|C@]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$09d0&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;16&nbsp;[[>>|DOCONST]]


Leave the 16 bit contents of address.

!!! pronounced:"fetch"
  16b is the value at addr.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
fetch
    sec
    ldy #0
fetch0a
    lda (tos),y
    bcc put
                        ; out; YA = (tos),Y+1 (tos),Y
                        ; in; Y = offset
                        ; C = clear
                        ; A = low byte
fetchya
    pha
    iny
    lda (tos),y
    tay
    pla
    bcs put         ; bra
    rts

```

!! @+&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- addr+2 w )

[[<<|C@+]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c6b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|CBIT!]]


Fetches word `w` at `addr`, increments addr by 2

!!!pronounced: "c-fetch-plus"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
fetchplus
    ldy #1
fetchplus01
    lda (tos),y
    pha
    dey
    bpl fetchplus01
    jsr inctos
    jsr inctos
    jmp rfrom

```

!! @LIN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|LIN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0741&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|#LIN]]


!!!User variable
Used by [[INTERPRET]] to hold the address within the block buffer of the
current line.  It begins at [[BLKBUF]]+3 and goes up in increments of 40 or
80 until LIN reaches 25


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
atlin
    jsr uservar

```

!! @SWAP!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr1 addr2 -- )

[[<<|C@SWAP!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$19aa&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|PAUSE]]


Exchanges the contents of two variables.

```
: @swap!   ( a b -- )
    2dup c@swap!
    1+ 1 +under c@swap! ;
2dup 2>r
( a b ; b a )
@ swap @
( @b @a ; b a )
r> ! r> ! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_fetchswapstore
    jsr enter
    .word twodup
    .word cfetchswapstore
    .word oneplus
    .word one
    .word plusunder
    .word cfetchswapstore
    .word exit

```

!! *&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n1*n2 )

[[<<|M*/]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0fbb&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|/MOD]]



 multiply two signed words


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
star
    jsr mult
    jmp drop

```

!! */&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 n3 -- n4 )

[[<<|*/MOD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0fef&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|PICK]]



 n1 is first multiplied by n2 producing an inter-
 mediate 32-bit result.  n4 is the floor of the
 quotient of the intermediate 32-bit result
 divided by the divisor n3.  The product of n1
 times n2 is maintained as an intermediate 32-
 bit result for greater precision than the other-
 wise equivalent sequence n1 n2 * n3 / .  An
 error condition results if the divisor is zero
 or if the quotient falls outside the range
 {-32,768...32,767}.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
starslash
    jsr dostarslashmod
    ;       lda stack,x
    ;       sta stack+2,x
    ;       lda stack+1,x
    ;       sta stack+3,x
    jmp drop

```

!! */MOD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 n3 -- n4 n5 )

[[<<|MOD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0fde&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|*/]]



 n1 is first multiplied by n2 producing an inter-
 mediate 32 bit result.  n4 is the remainder and
 n5 is the floor of the quotient of the inter-
 mediate 32-bit result divided by the divisor
 n3.  A 32-bit intermediate product is used for
 */ .  n4 has the same sign as n3 or is zero.
 An error condition results if the divisor is
 zero or if the quotient falls outside of the
 range {-32,768...32,767}.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
starslashmod
    jsr dostarslashmod
    jmp next
dostarslashmod
    ;       lda stack+1,x
    pha
    ;       lda stack,x
    pha
    inx
    inx
    jsr mult
    dex
    dex
    pla
    ;       sta stack,x
    pla
    ;       sta stack+1,x
;    jmp domslash

```

!! /&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n3 )

[[<<|/MOD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0fd2&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|MOD]]



 n3 is the floor of the quotient of n1 divided
 by the divisor n2.  An error condition results
 if the divisor is zero or if the quotient falls
 outside the range {-32,768 ... 32,767}.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
slash
    jsr doslashmod
    ;       lda stack,x
    ;       sta stack+2,x
    ;       lda stack+1,x
    ;       sta stack+3,x
    jmp drop

```

!! /MOD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n3 n4 )

[[<<|*]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0fc1&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|/]]



 n3 is the remainder and n4 the floor of the
 quotient of n1 divided by the divisor n2.  n3
 has the same sign as n2 or is zero.  An error
 condition results if the divisor is zero or if
 the quotient falls outside the range {-32,768
 ... 32,676}.
~todo: should probably use ud/mod and then set signs
~todo: division/modulo/multiplication words are kind of a mess


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
slashmod
    jsr doslashmod
    jmp next
doslashmod
    ;       lda stack+1,x
    pha
    ;       lda stack,x
    pha
    ;       lda stack+3,x
    bpl doslashmod01
    dey
doslashmod01
    ;       sty stack,x
    ;       sty stack+1,x
    dex
    dex
    pla
    ;       sta stack,x
    pla
    ;       sta stack+1,x
    ldy #0
;    jmp domslash

```

!! /STRING&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr1 u1 n -- addr2 u2 )

[[<<|TYPE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$133d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|$.]]


Adjust the character string at c-addr1 by n characters. The resulting
character string, specified by c-addr2 u2, begins at c-addr1 plus n
characters and is u1 minus n characters long.

!!!pronounced: "slash-string"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```

    jsr enter
    .word duptor
    .word minus
    .word rfrom
    .word plusunder
    .word exit

```

sharps01

!! #VMPKT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|VMBUF]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0719&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|SCRPKT]]


!!!User variable
Number of virtual memory packets

```
numvmpkt

!! #VMPKT!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|SCR0]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1710&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;33&nbsp;[[>>|EMPTY-BUFFERS]]


Reset virtual memory user variables for `LOAD-BUFFERS` or `EMPTY-BUFFERS`

~ It should also validate flags and max-lengths, error out on corrupt VMBUF

```
: #vmpkt!   ( -- )
\    scr off  blk off  ( ~ why? )
    #vmpkt off  blkbuf 2-
    begin
        @ ?dup
    while
        #vmpkt 1+!
        -
    repeat
    vmbuf ! ;

```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_numvmpktstore
    jsr enter
    .word numvmpkt
    .word off
    .word _blkbuf
    .word twominus
numvmpktstore01
    .word _pktsize
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(numvmpktstore02-*+1)
    .word numvmpkt
    .word oneplusstore
    .word minus
    .word branch
    .byt <(numvmpktstore01-*+1)
numvmpktstore02
    .word vmbuf
    .word store
    .word exit

```

!! #VOC&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|SYMNEW]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6848&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|NEWEST]]


!!!User variable

defined on the system.  Defining a new vocabulary increases

!! ^&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|_]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$78e6&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;34&nbsp;[[>>|EDITTOPSCR]]


Captures the contents (including linewrap) of the display into
an editor packet, appended to the end of the [[VMBUF]] area and
enters the editor.

```
: ^   ( -- )
    #vmpkt @  scr ! editing on vidram scrpkt !  0 mkpkts  update _ ;
```
!!!pronounced: "capture"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_caret
    jsr enter
    .word numvmpkt
    .word fetch
    .word scr
    .word store
    .word editing
    .word on
    .word vidram
    .word scrpkt
    .word store
    .word zero
    .word _mkpkts
    .word _update
    .word _back
    .word exit

```

!! +&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- sum )

[[<<|OFF]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0bba&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|ABS]]


Leave the sum of n1+n2

!!! pronounced: "plus"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
plus
    clc
    lda tos
    adc stackl,x
    sta tos
    lda tos+1
    adc stackh,x
    sta tos+1
    inx
plus01
    jmp next

```

!! +!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n addr -- )

[[<<|slip]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c3b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19&nbsp;[[>>|TOGGLE]]


Add "n" to the value at "addr"

!!! pronounced: "plus-store"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
plusstore
    ldy #0
    clc
    lda stackl,x
    adc (tos),y
    sta (tos),y
    iny
    lda stackh,x
    adc (tos),y
    sta (tos),y
    jmp twodrop

```

!! //+/-PAIRS//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( family -- family )

[[<<|?NOPAIRS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$73b3&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;34&nbsp;[[>>|METHOD]]


Increments or decrements the pair counter for the (signed) value
passed in `family`.  The absolute value of `family` is returned,
so that words like [[LEAVE]] [[?LEAVE]] [[ELSE]] and [[WHILE]]
can decrement and increment the [[PAIRS]] counter as a check that
the structure is open.  Words that open ([[DO]] [[?DO]] [[IF]]
[[BEGIN]]) or close ([[LOOP]] [[+LOOP]] [[THEN]] [[UNTIL]] [[AGAIN]]
[[REPEAT]]) the structure will [[DROP]] this returned value to 
maintain [[PAIRS]] balance.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
plusminuspairs
    stx z
    ldx tos
    bpl pluspairs
    dex
    txa
    eor #$ff
    sta tos
    tax
    dec pairs-1,x
    dec pairs-1,x
pluspairs
    inc pairs-1,x
    bmi pairs03
    ldx z
    jmp next
pairs03
    ldy #6              ; UNPAIRED CONDITIONALS
comperror
    jmp error

```

!! //+EDIT//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- )

[[<<|>EDIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$78ce&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|_]]



Save current editor screen in packet buffer, edit the screen
`n` screens away from the current [[SCR]]

```
: +edit   ( n -- )
    scr @ + >edit ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_plusedit
    jsr enter
    .word scr
    .word fetch
    .word plus
    .word _toedit
    .word exit

```

!! +LOOP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( == ) ( increment -- )

[[<<|LOOP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7446&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|LEAVE]]



Immediate word, compiles runtime code to terminate a loop that
steps by an arbitrary value on the stack, terminating when the
loop index goes past the limit.

[[Posted question on comp.lang.forth|https://groups.google.com/d/msg/comp.lang.forth/V9evPkLwRoM/Khwons3O4QwJ]]

```
' (loop) -3 control loop ]
    ?<resolve ?>resolve ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_plusloop
    jsr docontrol
    .word pploop
    .byt <(-3)
    .word _qfromresolve
    .word _qtoresolve
    .word exit

```

!! +MOVE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( start end delta -- )

[[<<|MOVE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0eb4&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;33&nbsp;[[>>|HERE]]



 Move a block of memory between start and end (inclusive) to
 a new address calculated by adding the signed delta to start

```
 for example, x = (5 of each letter)     AAAAABBBBBCCCCCDDDDD
 after  x 8 + x 11 + -7 +move, x becomes ABBCCBBBBBCCCCCDDDDD
 vidram dup 3+ 3+ 12 +move

: +move   ( start end delta -- )
    ?dup
    if
        >r over - 1+
        over r> + swap move
    else
        2drop
    then ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_plusmove
    jsr enter
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(plusmove01-*+1)
    .word tor
    .word over
    .word minus
    .word oneplus               ; ( from howmany ) ( R; delta )
    .word over
    .word rfrom
    .word plus
    .word swap                  ; ( from to howmany )
    .word _move
    .word branch
    .byt <(plusmove02-*+1)
plusmove01
    .word twodrop
plusmove02
    .word exit

```

!! +ORIGIN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 -- n2 )

[[<<|USER]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6831&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|CURRENT]]


Returns the address "n2" in the user variable area offset by
"n1" bytes from the start


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_plusorigin
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word userarea
    .word plus
    .word exit

```

!! +UNDER&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 n3 -- n1+n3 n2 )

[[<<|UNDER]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0da7&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;16&nbsp;[[>>|3C@]]



 Add the top of stack to item underneath the second on stack



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
plusunder
    clc
    lda tos
    adc stackl+1,x
    sta stackl+1,x
    lda tos+1
    adc stackh+1,x
    sta stackh+1,x
    jmp drop

```

!! <&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- flag )

[[<<|U<]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0d49&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;22&nbsp;[[>>|>]]


Perform a signed comparison and return `true` if `n1` is less
than `n2`



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
lt
    jsr cmp16
sgntst
    bvc lt01
    eor #bit7
lt01
    bpl cmpout02
    bmi cmpout01

cmp16
    ldy #0
    lda stackl,x
    cmp tos
    lda stackh,x
    sbc tos+1
subeq99
    rts

```

!! <#&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|NUMBER]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$140e&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|#>]]






<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_ltsharp
    jsr enter
    .word _pad              ; ( pad )
    .word hld               ; ( pad hld )
    .word store             ; ( )
    .word exit

```

!! <>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- flag )

[[<<|-]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0d21&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;5&nbsp;[[>>|=]]


Leave a true flag if "n1" does not equal "n2".


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
ne
    clc
    ldy #$ff                    ; assume inequality
    bne ne01                    ; bra

```

!! <BUILDS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( == ; "name" -- )

[[<<|BISHWHET]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$71a2&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;29&nbsp;[[>>|CONSTANT]]


 A defining word executed in the form

 `<BUILDS <name> ... DOES> ... ;`

Creates a dictionary entry for <name>.  After <name> is
created, the next available dictionary location is the first
byte of <name>'s parameter field.  When <name> is
subsequently executed, the address of the first byte of
<name>'s parameter field is left on the stack.  CREATE does
not allocate space in <name>'s parameter field.
<br/>
The compile-time portion of the word between `<BUILDS ... DOES>`
is added to the [[transient dictionary|TDICT]] to conserve
space in core.  Run-time behavior shared by child words is
added to the core dictionary.

```
: <builds   ( == ; "name" -- )
    ?comp  0pairs dp tdp latest bishwhet cmove 
    [compile] plit , [compile] (create)
    ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_builds
    jsr enter
    .word _qcomp
    .word _zeropairs
    .word dp
    .word tdp
    .word _latest
    .word bishwhet
    .word cmove
    .word _compile
    .word plit
    .word _comma
    .word _compile
    .word _pcreate
    .word exit

```

!! =&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- flag )

[[<<|<>]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0d26&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;1&nbsp;[[>>|subeq]]


Leave a true flag if "n1" does is equal to "n2".


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
eq
    clc
    ;not a subroutine
```

!! >&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- flag )

[[<<|<]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0d5f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|ROT]]



 V is the exclusive or of the carrys out of bits 6 and 7 - Bogax


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
gt
    ldy #0
    lda tos
    cmp stackl,x
    lda tos+1
    sbc stackh,x
    jmp sgntst

```

!! >=&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|0<]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7c6b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|VS]]


```
90 cconstant >= ( assembler test for greater or equal zero )
                  ( >= is only correct after sub, or cmp, )
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
asmge
    jsr docconst
    .byt $90

```

!! >BIT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- mask offset )

[[<<|DEPTH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$105a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;30&nbsp;[[>>|$!]]


transform an integer into a bitmask and offset, suitable for
addressing a bloom filter or other bit field

mask = 2^(n%8)

offset = n/8

```
: >bit   ( n -- mask offset )
        dup 7 and power2 + c@
        swap 2/ 2/ 2/ ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
tobit
    dex
    lda tos
    and #7
    tay
    lda power2,y
    sta stackl,x
    lda #0
    sta stackh,x
    lsr tos+1
    ror tos
    lsr tos+1
    ror tos
    lsr tos+1
    ror tos             ; /8
    jmp next

```

!! //>EDIT//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( scr -- )

[[<<|EDITNOWRAP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$78bf&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|+EDIT]]



 Save current editor screen in packet buffer
 Set `toscr` as the current [[SCR]] and edit it

```
: >edit   ( scr -- )
    update 0 max block drop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_toedit
    jsr enter
    .word _update
    .word zero
    .word _max
    .word _block
    .word drop
    .word exit

```

!! >IN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|#LIN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0749&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|SPAN]]


The address of a user variable which contains the present
character offset within the input stream.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
toin
    jsr uservar
    .byt usertoin-userarea

```

!! >NAME&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( cfa -- nfa|0 )

[[<<|SMUDGECLONE16]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6988&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;45&nbsp;[[>>|NAME>]]


Returns the Name Field Address (`nfa`) of a given word, or 0
if the provided Code Field Address (`cfa`) wasn't found in the
symbol table.

~ This should honor the Smudge bit

```
: >name   ( cfa -- nfa )
     >syms 2+
 ( cfa nfa )
     begin
 ( cfa nfa )
         dup>r
 ( cfa nfa ; nfa )
         name>  over <>
         r@ nfalen and
 ( cfa flag ; nfa )
     while
         r> nfa+
     until
     r> nip dup nfalen 0<> and ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_toname
    jsr enter
    .word _tosyms
    .word twoplus
toname01
    .word duptor
    .word namefrom
    .word over
    .word ne
    .word rfetch
    .word nfalen
    .word andx
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(toname02-*+1)
    .word rfrom
    .word nfaplus
    .word branch
    .byt <(toname01-*+1)
toname02
    .word drop
    .word rfetch
    .word rfrom
    .word nfalen
    .word zne
    .word andx
    .word exit

```

!! //>NAME.L10//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( cfa -- )

[[<<|ID.L]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$75ed&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|6SPACES]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_tonamedotl10
    jsr enter
    .word _toname
    .word clit
    .byt 10
    .word _iddotl
    .word exit

```

!! >PKT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- packet )

[[<<|PKT.SIZE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$15f5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;29&nbsp;[[>>|PKT.INFO]]


Return the packet address of block N

```
: >pkt   ( n -- packet )
    blkbuf 2-
    begin
        over
    while
        pktsize
        - -1 +under
    repeat
    nip ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_topkt
    jsr enter
    .word _blkbuf
    .word twominus
topktb01
    .word over
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(topktb02-*+1)
    .word _pktsize
    .word minus
    .word minusone
    .word plusunder
    .word branch
    .byt <(topktb01-*+1)
topktb02
    .word nip
    .word exit

```

!! >R&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- ) ( R; -- n )

[[<<|2>R]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0b73&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;2&nbsp;[[>>|DUP>R]]


Move the top element of the data stack to the return stack

!!! pronounced: "to-r"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
tor
    sec
    .byt $29    ; AND #
                ; fall through
```

!! >SYMS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|TDP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6868&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|VSTACK]]


returns the address of the symbol portion of the symbol table


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_tosyms
    jsr enter
    .word symtab
    .word fetch
    .word bl    ; 32
    .word plus
    .word exit

```

!! $,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- )

[[<<|LATEST]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$71fd&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|$.>PAD]]


Enclose a quoted string in the dictionary

~ doesn't handle page boundaries
