!! ABORT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|QUIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$702b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|HERELSB]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_abort
    jsr enter
    .word spstore
    .word _forth
    .word _definitions
    .word _quit

```







!! ABORT"&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( flag -- ) ( -- ; compiling )

[[<<|".&quot;"]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7265&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|{]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_abortq
    jsr enter
    .word _dotq
    .word _compile
    .word _abort
    .word exit

```







!!PETTIL
documentation generated 2017-02-06

!!![[Personal Electronics Transactor Threaded Interpreted Language|http://pettil.tumblr.com]]
!!![[(A Forth-like language for my venerable Commodore PET 2001N)|http://github.com/chitselb/pettil]]
<<<
!!!ven-er-a-ble (adj.)
 3a : calling forth respect through age, character and attainments &lt;a venerable jazz musician&gt;; broadly : conveying an impression of aged goodness and benevolence &lt;encouraged by the venerable doctor's head-nodding&gt;
<<< Merriam Webster Dictionary
!!Origins
Back in 1977, my high school had a few tiny (4K & 8K; cassette tape storage
and BASIC) Wang 2200 computers.  I was instantly hooked.  Two years later, my 
senior year, I changed high schools.  There was a TRS-80 Model I (with Level 2 
BASIC!).  The staff at Delta College in Saginaw permitted me to use the DEC
PDP-11, and I had a TI-59 programmable calculator.  I was on that like ducks on bugs.

Also that year, I bought a PET 2001-16N.  Originally it came from Newman Computer
Exchange in Ann Arbor, MI.  I bought it second-hand from a friend for $1250.  I
later upgraded it to BASIC4 and 32K.  The photo on the 
[[project tumblr blog|http://pettil.tumblr.com]] 
is that very same PET, serial number 700251.

In 1981 I worked at ~ComputerLand Tysons Corner for several months, just
prior to and after the introduction of the original IBM PC model 5150. While 
working at ~ComputerLand I picked up a copy of R.G. Loeliger's book, "Threaded 
Interpretive Languages." Along with how to bootstrap Forth on a Z-80, that book 
taught me two other things:

# That I could probably write my own Forth.
# Forth doesn't need to conform exactly to specific standards, as long as it is understandable by other Forth programmers.

I was very interested in the idea of Forth being a self-compiled language,
in other words, "Forth is written in Forth."  Also intriguing was the promise
of far greater speed than BASIC could hope to attain.  I had an idea for a
videogame, and I needed something better.

For a time (1984-1985) I worked as a Forth programmer on MMSForth for the
TRS-80&nbsp;Model&nbsp;4.  During the late '80s I explored and coded quite a bit in Blazin'
Forth on the Commodore 64.

I have spared no effort to bring you this Forth for the Commodore PET.  The 
Forth-83 standard forms the basis of PETTIL, with some slight deviations along 
the way.  In it, I have tried to embrace the Commodore PET hardware and
ROM environment in as many ways as I could think of.  The [[PETTIL screen editor|Editor Commands]]
will feel very much like the PET BASIC editor, because that's exactly what it 
is.  You get a typical Forth development environment with interpreter, 
compiler, editor and assembler.  These are some of the things that make PETTIL 
unique:

!! Features
* Split data stack on zero page
* Direct threaded model
* 15 clock cycles [[NEXT|Inner Interpreter]] routine
* [[Split data stack|Split Data Stack]] on zero page
* Virtual memory on cassette tape
* Most nucleus words hand-coded as primitives
* Built-in 6502 assembler features Woz's SWEET-16
* Source code editor leverages the PET's screen editor
* PETSCII graphic characters may be used as word names
* Tweaks and optimizations everywhere to save clocks and bytes
* Small core dictionary, designed for target application development
* Symbol table and development environment not required at runtime
* Bloom filter and Pearson hash to speed dictionary searches and compilation







Here's a word or two about word.  Word is a painfully overloaded word in Forth.  
It can mean a Forth routine (e.g. "CMOVE is a word that copies memory") or 16 
bits of data (e.g. "Push a word on the data stack") or a blank delimited 
sequence of characters (e.g. "The word WORD parses a word from the input 
stream").  I'm really very sorry about that.  If you can't make out which 
meaning of word from context, try rereading that passage several times.  Word!








!! ABS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- u )

[[<<|+]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0bcb&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|NEGATE]]


Leave the absolute value of n as u.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
abs
    bit tos+1
    bpl plus01
    ;fall through
```







!! ADC,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|TYA,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d4d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|AND,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a ADC opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
iadc
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $60
    .word $1c6e

```







!! AGAIN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( )

[[<<|UNTIL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$74ba&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|REPEAT]]


synonym for REPEAT

```
' branch -1 control again
    ] ?<resolve drop ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_again
    ; fall through
    jsr docontrol
    .word branch
    .byt <(-1)
    .word _qfromresolve
    .word drop
    .word exit

```







!! AGAIN,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|ELSE,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7c27&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|WHILE,]]


```
: again,   1 ?pairs jmp, ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_asmagain
    jsr enter
    .word one
;    .word _qpairs
    .word ijmp
    .word exit

```







!! ALLOT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- )

[[<<|HERELSB]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$703c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|,]]


Allocate space in the dictionary



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_allot
    jsr enter
    .word dp
    .word plusstore
    .word exit

```







!! //Aloha//

[[<<|slide]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$077f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|Sweet16 toggle]]


Flips back and forth between BASIC and PETTIL modes.
performs swapzp, toggleirq and togglesw16



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
aloha
    cld                         ; clear decimal mode
    jsr CLRCHN                  ; restore default I/O channels
    jsr CLALL                   ; close all open files
aloha2
    jsr swapzp                  ; swap bottom of zero page with zpbuf
;    jsr toggleirq               ; set the IRQ vector
; fall through                  ; set the BRK vector
```







!! AND&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n1&n2 )

[[<<|UM/MOD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0b36&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|OR]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
andx
    lda tos+1
    and stackh,x
    tay
    lda tos
    and stackl,x
    inx
    jmp put

```







!! AND,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|ADC,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d53&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|CMP,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a AND opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
iand
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $20
    .word $1c6e

```







!! ARGS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( ? n -- n )

[[<<|40*]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1a8c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|TEST]]


Peels n arguments off the stack and stores them in the `N` area


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
args
    lda tos
    asl
    tay
    jsr locals
    jmp drop

```







!! ASL,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|STA,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d7d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|DEC,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a ASL opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
iasl
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $01
    .word $0d0d

```







!! //ASMINDEX//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|LOCALS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7b12&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;32&nbsp;[[>>|MODE]]


!!!Assembler constant
Table of addressing modes


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
asmindex
    .byt $09,$09,$05,$15,$15,$01,$11,$80
    .byt $09,$80,$0d,$1d,$19,$80,$80,$80
    .byt $80,$00,$04,$14,$14,$80,$80,$80
    .byt $80,$80,$0c,$1c,$1c,$80,$80,$2c

```







!! ASSEMBLER&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|P]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7ad5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|Z]]


Sets context to the ASSEMBLER vocabulary


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
assembler
    jsr dovocab
    .byt 1                  ; vocabulary identifier

```







!! //AUTOMEM//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( lastpad -- )

[[<<|PASSBITS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6b29&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;85&nbsp;[[>>|YIN16]]


Automatically move symbol table and vmbuf to someplace that leaves
at least 512 bytes for symbol table growth

The `lastpad` address points to the null byte at the end of the
sorted-by-size symbol table copy at pad

```
: automem   ( addr -- )
    pad - tdict @ swap - $ff00 and $200 -
( newsymtab -- )
    dup symtab @ -  swap symtab !
( delta -- )
    #vmpkt @
    if
        vmbuf @
        symtab @
        third
        +move
        vmbuf over +!
    else
        drop blkbuf
        2- dup off vmbuf !
    then ;

```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_automem
    jsr enter
    .word _pad
    .word minus
    .word tdict
    .word fetch
    .word swap
    .word minus
    .word plit
    .word $ff00
    .word andx
    .word plit
    .word $200
    .word minus
    .word dup
    .word symtab
    .word fetch
    .word minus
    .word swap
    .word symtab
    .word store
    .word numvmpkt
    .word fetch
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(automem01-*+1)
    .word vmbuf
    .word fetch
    .word symtab
    .word fetch
    .word third
    .word _plusmove
    .word vmbuf
    .word over
    .word plusstore
    .word branch
    .byt <(automem02-*+1)
automem01
    .word drop
    .word _blkbuf
    .word twominus
    .word dup
    .word off
    .word vmbuf
    .word store
automem02
    .word exit

```







!! B/BUF&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- 1024 )

[[<<|?]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1517&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;5&nbsp;[[>>|B/SCR]]


!!!Constant
bytes per buffer = 1024


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
bperbuf
    jsr doconst
    .word 1024

```







!! B/SCR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- 1000 )

[[<<|B/BUF]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$151c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;5&nbsp;[[>>|CAS2BUF]]


!!!Constant
bytes per screen.  Not what it usually means in other Forths,
(not blocks per screen = 1)


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
bperscr
    jsr doconst
    .word 1000

```







!! //bannermsg//

[[<<|HOT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1b62&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19614&nbsp;[[>>|LAUNCH]]


The message of the day.  In pre-beta, I like to put a "this day
in history" sort of note on the git commits, which appears at
startup in the welcome banner.  This message does not occupy
any precious RAM after startup completes.

The size of this word is large because the next thing after it
is [[LAUNCH]] in the transient dictionary.  Adding the sizes of
[[bannermsg]]+[[HOT]]+[[COLD]] together will accurately reflect the
available RAM for the symbol table, virtual memory buffers, and
user code.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
bannermsg
    .byt (there-*-1)            ; length of bannermsg
    .asc    CLR,"FORTH FOR THE COMMODORE PET 2001",CR
    .asc    "HTTP:","/","/GITHUB.COM/CHITSELB/PETTIL",CR
    .asc    "VERSION ALPHA 2017-02-06",CR
    .asc    "1959 JACK KILBY OF TEXAS INSTRUMENTS",CR
    .asc    "     APPLIES FOR THE FIRST PATENT ON",CR
    .asc    "     THE INTEGRATED CIRCUIT",CR
            ;123456789.123456789.123456789.123456789.
there
```







!! BASE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|TDICT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0729&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|DPL]]


!!!User variable
current system number base.  Resets to decimal (base 10) on ABORT


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
base
    jsr uservar
    .byt userbase-userarea

```







!! //BASIC bootstrap//

address:&nbsp;$03ff&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|Zero page buffer and NEXT routine]]


PETTIL loads as a BASIC program consisting of one line,
`10 SYS1037` to kick off the cold start routine


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
petbasic
    .word basic                 ; this will be the load address
    .word basend
    .word 10
    .byt $9e                    ; SYS token
    .asc "1037",0
basend
    .word 0
pettillaunch
    jmp cold
```







!! BEGIN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( )

[[<<|THEN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7494&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|WHILE]]



```
0 1 control begin
    ] 2drop here 1- ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_begin
    jsr docontrol
    .word 0
    .byt 1
    .word twodrop
    .word here
    .word oneminus
    .word exit

```







!! BEGIN,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|M/CPU]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7bb8&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|UNTIL,]]


```
: begin,   here 1 ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_asmbegin
    jsr enter
    .word here
    .word one
    .word exit

```







!! BETWEEN?&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( x a b -- flag )

[[<<|inctos]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$10a9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;24&nbsp;[[>>|D+]]



 returns true iff a < x < b, unsigned



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
betweenq
    inx
    jsr cmp16
    dex
;    ldy #0
;    lda stackl+1,x
;    cmp tos
;    lda stackh+1,x
;    sbc tos+1
    bcs betweenq01
    lda stackl,x
    cmp stackl+1,x
    lda stackh,x
    sbc stackh+1,x
    bcs betweenq01
    dey
betweenq01
    inx
    inx
    tya
    jmp put

```







!! //BISHWHET//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( dp tdp latest -- a a c b-a )

[[<<|DOES>]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7189&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;25&nbsp;[[>>|<BUILDS]]


helper word for `<BUILDS` in compile state

```
core                    tdict             symnew
----+----+---           ----+----*-       ----.-+-------
    ^A   ^B                 ^C   ^D           ^E^F
A = @E          B = @DP         C = @TDP        X = b-a
DP = C+X        TDP = A         E = C           [C..D] = [A..B]
0000  00 01 d7 63  76 06 86 06  00 00 05 50  00 01 07 70
            latest dp    tdp
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
bishwhet
    jsr locals4
    brk
    .byt popd | TOS
    .byt st | N2        ; A
    .byt ldd | N0       ; @dp
    .byt popd | N0      ; reget B
    .byt sub | N2       ; size
    .byt st | N3        ; B-A
    .byt ldd | N1       ; @tdp
    .byt popd | N1      ; reget C
    .byt st | N4
    .byt std | TOS      ; set latest E = C
    .byt add | N3
    .byt std | N0       ; set DP = C+X
    .byt ld | N2
    .byt std | N1
    .byt st | TOS       ; ( a )
    .byt push           ; ( a a )
    .byt ld | N4
    .byt push           ; ( a a c )
    .byt ld | N3
    .byt push           ; ( a a c b-a )
    .byt nxt

```







!! BIT,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

address:&nbsp;$7dd1&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a BIT opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
ibit
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $20
    .word $0484


;" -----------------------
;"
;" : m/cpu  create c, , does>
;"     dup 1+ @ 80 and  if 10 mode +! then over
;"     ff00 and upmode upmode  if mem cr latest id.
;"     abort" has incorrect address mode" then c@ mode c@
;"     index + c@ + c,  mode c@ 7 and if mode x@
;"     0f and 7 < if c, else , then then mem ;
;"
;"   1c6e 60 m/cpu adc,  1c6e 20 m/cpu and,  1c6e c0 m/cpu cmp,
;"   1c6e 40 m/cpu eor,  1c6e a0 m/cpu lda,  1c6e 00 m/cpu ora,
;"   1c6e e0 m/cpu sbc,  1c6c 80 m/cpu sta,  0d0d 01 m/cpu asl,
;"   0c0c c1 m/cpu dec,  0c0c e1 m/cpu inc,  0d0d 41 m/cpu lsr,
;"   0d0d 21 m/cpu rol,  0d0d 61 m/cpu ror,  0414 81 m/cpu stx,
;"   0486 e0 m/cpu cpx,  0486 c0 m/cpu cpy,  1496 a2 m/cpu ldx,
;"   0c8e a0 m/cpu ldy,  048c 80 m/cpu sty,  0480 14 m/cpu jsr,
;"   8480 40 m/cpu jmp,  0484 20 m/cpu bit,
;"



```







!! BL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|FORTY]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0cb2&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|5]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
bl
    lda #' '
    .byt $2c            ; BIT abs instruction
```







!! BLANK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr howmany -- )

[[<<|ERASE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0e07&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|-NULLS]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_blank
    jsr enter
    .word bl
    .word fill
    .word exit

```







!! BLK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|HLD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0735&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|SCR]]


!!!User variable
The address of a variable containing the number of the mass
storage block being interpreted as the input stream.  If the
value of BLK is zero the input stream is taken from the text
input buffer.  {{0..the number of blocks available -1}}


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
blk
    jsr uservar
    .byt userblk-userarea

```







!! BLKBUF&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|CAS2BUF]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1526&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;21&nbsp;[[>>|WRAP^]]


Returns the address of the 1K virtual memory block buffer.

There is only a single 1K fixed block buffer on the system, and
all data and screen packets are retrieved from the packet buffer
through it.

Copying a block to a different block can be achieved by using [[PAD]] as
temporary storage.  When [[REHASH]] rebuilds the symbol
table, it performs [[automatic memory allocation|AUTOMEM]]
and may move `BLKBUF` (and its contents) to a new location.

!!! pronounced: "b-l-k-buff"

```
: blkbuf   ( -- addr )
    symtab @  ?: symtab memsiz  @ b/buf - ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_blkbuf
    jsr enter
    .word symtab
    .word fetch
    .word pquerycolon
    .word symtab
    .word memsiz
    .word fetch
    .word bperbuf
    .word minus
    .word exit

```







!! BLOCK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( blk -- buf )

[[<<|SRCTARG]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1865&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;88&nbsp;[[>>|(UPD1)]]


Retrieves and decompresses a screen or data block from the [[VMBUF]]
[[region|PETTIL system memory map]]. This is PETTIL's top of the food
chain for reading packets, the antonym of [[UPDATE]] (which writes
packets).

The table below summarizes how `BLOCK` functions based on whether the
user is in the editor or not, and whether the packet is screen or data.

|^[[EDITING?]] |<|packet# sets [[SCR]]<br>returns [[VIDRAM]]|
|>|^ [[SCRPKT?]]|[[VIDRAM]] initialized to spaces<br>linewrap stored to zero page<br>write 1000-byte packet to [[VIDRAM]]|
|>|^ &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not [[SCRPKT?]]|[[VIDRAM]] initialized to nulls<br>zero page linewrap table set to all 40-column<br>displays first 1000 characters of data block|
||<|<|
|^not [[EDITING?]] |<|packet# sets [[BLK]]<br>returns [[BLKBUF]]|
|>|^ [[SCRPKT?]]|[[BLKBUF]] initialized to spaces<br>linewrap stored in first three bytes of [[BLKBUF]]<br>followed by 1000-bytes of screencodes|
|>|^ not [[SCRPKT?]]|[[BLKBUF]] initialized to nulls<br>1024 bytes of data expanded to [[BLKBUF]]|

```
: block
    dup ?mkpkts     \ create packets if they don't exist yet
    dup pkt.info    \ ( blk floor len uncompressed? )
    rot srctarg 3dup nip
    b/buf swap fill 2drop 2>r r@ scrpkt?
    if              \ ( blk len uncompressed? floor
                    \ vidram|blkbuf scrpkt?
                    \ R; vidram|blkbuf scr|blk )
        drop rot 3- -rot 3+ dup 3- 3c@ editing?
        if
            wrap! r@
        else
            r@ 3c! r@ 3+
        then
    then
    2swap  ?: cmove rldecode
    2r> -rot ! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_block
    jsr enter
    .word dup
   .word _qmkpkts
    .word dup
    .word pktinfo
    .word rot
    .word _srctarg
    .word _threedup
    .word nip
    .word bperbuf
    .word swap
    .word fill
    .word twodrop
    .word twotor
    .word rfetch
    .word isscrq
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(block02-*+1)
    .word drop
    .word rot
    .word threeminus
    .word dashrot
    .word threeplus
    .word dup
    .word threeminus
    .word threecfetch
    .word editingq
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(block01-*+1)
    .word wrapstore
    .word rfetch
    .word branch
    .byt <(block02-*+1)
block01
    .word rfetch
    .word threecstore
    .word rfetch
    .word threeplus
block02
    .word twoswap
    .word pquerycolon
    .word cmove
    .word rldecode
    .word tworfrom
    .word dashrot
    .word store
    .word exit

```







!! //BLOOM//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|PEARSON#]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6933&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19&nbsp;[[>>|BLOOM#]]


The 64-bit Bloom filter used by the core dictionary.  The hash
is designed to filter out most tokens containing digits


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
bloom
    jsr docreate
    .word 0,0,0,0               ; 64 bits, used by hash2 (bloom filter)
pearson                         ; pearson hash table
    ; these numbers were generated by the pearson.rb Ruby script which
    ; generates random hashes and selects the set that best balances
    ; a list of Forth words
    .byt 243, 178, 217, 2, 54, 84, 189, 60

```







!! //BLOOM#//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- n )

[[<<|BLOOM]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6946&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|BLOOMHASH01]]


Forth wrapper around Bloom hash function


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
bloomhash
    jsr bloomhash01             ; A=bloom#; Y=0
    jmp put

```







!! //BLOOMHASH01//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- n )

[[<<|BLOOM#]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$694c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;34&nbsp;[[>>|UNSMUDGE]]


The dictionary Bloom filter tries to answer the question,
'is this word a number or does it contain numbers?'
returning zero (no digits present) or the sum (mod64)
of each digits in this word plus how many digits.  If
any digit is present, BLOOMHASH will not return zero.

This is expected to sparsely populate the 64-bit wide
bloom filter field, allowing FIND to bypass the symbol
table search if the bit is turned off.

Calculate the bloom filter hash between 0..63.  Use >BIT
and CBIT! or CBIT@ to do something useful with the result.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
bloomhash01
    jsr nfalen01
    sty 2*R11
    sty 2*R11+1
    tay
bloomhash02
    lda (tos),y                 ;[5]
    clc                         ;[2]
    adc #$FF-('9')              ;[2]
    adc #'9'-'0'+1              ;[2]
    bcc bloomhash03             ;[3] carry is set only for digits
    adc 2*R11                   ;[3] anything with digits is nonzero
    and #(8*(pearson-(bloom+3)))-1   ;[2] keep it within the filter bits
    sta 2*R11                   ;[3]
    bne bloomhash03             ; never return 0 if digits are present
    ldy #1                      ; if total of digits hits some multiple
    tya                         ; of 64, returns a nonzero value
bloomhash03
    dey
    bne bloomhash02
    lda 2*R11
    rts

```







!! //BRANCH//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|?BRANCH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$093b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|(?LEAVE)]]


Compiles an unconditional branch operation. When used in the form:
[[COMPILE]] [[BRANCH]] , an unconditional branch operation is compiled.
A one-byte signed offset follows the pointer to `BRANCH`.  These branch
offset values are typically generated with [[<RESOLVE]] or [[>MARK]] .

`IP` points to address of `BRANCH`
(`IP`)+2 = the offset to `IP`,  calculated the same as for 6502 branches.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
branch
    ldy #2          ; [2]
    lda (ip),y      ; [5]
    bpl branch01    ; [2|3]
    dec ip+1        ; [5]
branch01
    sec             ; [2]
    adc ip          ; [3]
branch04
    tay             ; [2]
branch05
    lda ip+1        ; [3]
    adc #0          ; [2]
    bcc toforth      ; [3] bra /18/

```







!! BRK,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7ce9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|CLC,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a BRK opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
ibrk
    jsr _docpu
    .byt $00

```







!! C,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( b -- )

[[<<|,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7052&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|CFA,]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

_ccomma
    jsr enter
    .word here
    .word cstore
    .word one
    .word _allot
    .word exit

```







!! C!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( 8b addr -- )

[[<<|PUSHYA]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$09ac&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;2&nbsp;[[>>|!]]


 The least-significant 8 bits of 16b are stored into the byte
 at addr.

!!! pronounced: "c-store"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cstore
    clc
    .byt $29            ; AND #

```







!! C!+&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr c -- addr+1 )

[[<<|!+]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1092&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|1+]]


The least-significant 8 bits of c are stored into the byte
at addr, and addr is incremented by one

!!!pronounced: "c-store-plus"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cstoreplus
    ldy tos
    jsr slide
    tya
    ldy #0
    sta (tos),y
    ; fall through
```







!! C@&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- 8b )

[[<<|SP@]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$09ce&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;2&nbsp;[[>>|@]]



!!! pronounced: "c-fetch"
 8b is the contents of the byte at addr.

`cfetch01` code is also reused by CCONSTANT CONSTANT


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cfetch
    clc
    .byt $29        ; AND #
    ; fall through
```







!! C@+&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- addr+1 c )

[[<<|COUNT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c61&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|@+]]


Fetches the byte at addr, increments addr

!!!pronounced: "c-fetch-plus"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cfetchplus
    ldy #0
    lda (tos),y
    jsr inctos
    jmp pushya

```







!! C@SWAP!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr1 addr2 -- )

[[<<|CMDOFF]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$199a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;16&nbsp;[[>>|@SWAP!]]


Exchange the bytes at `addr1` and `addr2`



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cfetchswapstore
    ;ldy #2
    jsr locals2
    lda (n),y
    pha
    lda (tos),y
    sta (n),y
    pla
    sta (tos),y
    jmp drop

```







!! CALLER&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|J]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0a24&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|DOCREATE]]


Used by the business end of defining words to retrieve the address of the child
word from the return stack.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_caller
    jsr enter
    .word tworfrom
    .word rfrom
    .word dashrot
    .word twotor
    .word oneplus
    .word exit

```







!! CAS2BUF&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- $033a )

[[<<|B/SCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1521&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;5&nbsp;[[>>|BLKBUF]]


!!!Constant
base address of cassette buffer #2, used (for now) as a line buffer
to unpack screens


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cas2buf
    jsr doconst
    .word CAS2BUF

```







!! CASBUF&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- 027a|033a )

[[<<|(VMBUF)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$17d2&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|SAVE-BUFFERS]]


Returns the tape buffer address for most recently accessed
device `FA ($d4)`

```
: casbuf   ( -- 027a|033a )
    [ SETCASBUF ] call  [ TAPE1 ] cliteral @ ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
casbuf
    brk
    .byt ext
    .word SETCASBUF
    .byt set | N0
    .word TAPE1
    .byt ldd | N0
    .byt push
    .byt nxt

```







!! CBIT!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( mask addr -- )

[[<<|@+]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c7c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|CBIT@]]



 turn on the mask bits in the byte at address

!!! pronounced: "c-bit-store"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cbitstore
    ldy #0
    lda (tos),y
    ora stackl,x
    sta (tos),y
    jmp twodrop

```







!! CBIT@&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( mask addr -- flag )

[[<<|CBIT!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c87&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|TIB]]



 test the mask bits in the byte at address



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cbitfetch
    ldy #0
    lda (tos),y
    and stackl,x
    inx
    jmp put

```







!! CCONSTANT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( "name" ; c == ) ( -- c )

[[<<|CONSTANT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$71cc&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|2CONSTANT]]



create an 8-bit constant

```
: cconstant   ( "name" ; c == ) ( -- c )
    doconst (create) c, ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_cconstant
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word docconst
    .word _pcreate
    .word _ccomma
    .word exit

```







!! //CFA,//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- )

[[<<|C,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$705f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|NEXTPAGE]]


Set the code field of a new definition, taking page alignment
into account.  The address is the creator word's CFA, e.g. [[:]]
or [[VARIABLE]]

```
: cfa,   ( xt -- )
    bl c, , ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_cfacomma
    jsr enter
    .word bl                    ; JSR instruction
    .word _ccomma
    .word _comma
    .word exit

```







!! CLC,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|BRK,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7ced&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|CLD,]]

iclc

    .byt $18

!! CLD,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|CLC,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7cf1&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|CLI,]]

icld

!! CLI,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|CLD,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7cf5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|CLV,]]

compiles a CLI opcode

```
icli
    jsr _docpu

```







!! //CLOSE-DEFINITION//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|:]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$711f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;31&nbsp;[[>>|;]]


Terminates `:` and `CODE` definitions by unsmudging the header
and resetting `REDEFINED`.  Used by `;` `;CODE` and `END-CODE`

```
: close-definition   ( -- )
    ?csp  latest unsmudge  redefined dup @ dup
    ?: smudge drop  off  [ ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_closedefinition
    jsr enter
    .word _qnopairs
    .word qcsp
    .word _latest
    .word unsmudge
    .word redefined
    .word dup
    .word fetch
    .word dup
    .word pquerycolon
    .word smudge
    .word drop
    .word off
    .word _lbracket
    .word exit

```







!! CLRSCR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|INFO]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$76dc&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|FLIPSCR]]


Clear the screen

```
_clrscr
    jsr enter
    .word clit
    .byt CLR
    .word emit
    .word exit

```







!! CLV,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

iclv

!! CMDOFF&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|XYZZY]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1990&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|C@SWAP!]]


Restore default I/O channels


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cmdoff
    stx z
    jsr CLRCHN
cmdoff01
    ldx z
    jmp next

```







!! CMOVE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( from to howmany -- )

[[<<|-TRAILING]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0e42&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;2&nbsp;[[>>|CMOVE>]]




"~ see http://6502.org/source/general/memory_move.html


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cmove
    sec
    .byt $29
    ; fall through
```







!! CMOVE>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( from to howmany -- )

[[<<|CMOVE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0e44&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;91&nbsp;[[>>|MOVE]]


 Move the u bytes beginning at address addr1 to
 addr2.  The move begins by moving the byte at
 (addr1 plus u minus 1) to (addr2 plus u minus 1)
 and proceeds to successively lower addresses
 for u bytes.  If u is zero nothing is moved.
 Useful for sliding a string towards higher addresses.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cmovegt
    clc
    jsr locals4
    lda #>(drop-1)
    pha
    lda #<(drop-1)
    pha
    bcs cmoves
cmovegts
    stx z
    ldx tos+1
    clc
    txa
    adc n+1
    sta n+1
    clc
    txa
    adc n+3
    sta n+3
    inx
    ldy tos
    beq cmovegt03
    dey
    beq cmovegt02
cmovegt01
    lda (n),y
    sta (n+2),y
    dey
    bne cmovegt01
cmovegt02
    lda (n),y
    sta (n+2),y
cmovegt03
    dey
    dec n+1
    dec n+3
    dex
    bne cmovegt01
    ldx z
    rts
    ;jmp drop

cmoves
    clc
    ldy #0          ; locals returns Y=0 C=0
    stx z       ; stash the data stack pointer
    ldx #0          ; X,Y=0
cmove01
    dec tos+1
    bpl cmove02     ; do a whole page
    ldx tos         ; last page
    beq cmove03     ; none at all?
    sec             ; exit after this iteration
cmove02
    lda (n),y
    sta (n+2),y
    iny
    dex
    bne cmove02
    inc n+1
    inc n+3
    bcc cmove01
cmove03
    ldx z       ; revive the data stack pointer
    rts
    ;jmp drop    ; [37]

```







!! CMP,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|AND,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d59&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|EOR,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a CMP opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
icmp
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $c0
    .word $1c6e

```







!! CODE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( "name" -- )

```
_code
    jsr enter
    .word _codesetup
    .word _codefixup
    .word exit

!! //CODE-FIXUP//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|CODE-SETUP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7c88&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|CODE]]


Adjusts `LATEST` symbol to behave as a new assembler definition

```
_codefixup
    jsr enter
    .word hex
    .word storecsp
    .word assembler
    .word asmmem
    .word exit

!! //CODE-SETUP//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( "name" -- )

[[<<|VS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7c73&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;21&nbsp;[[>>|CODE-FIXUP]]


Creates a symbol table header for a new assembler definition


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_codesetup
    jsr enter
    .word redefined
    .word off                   ; turn REDEFINED off before (CREATE)
    .word here
    .word _pcreate
    .word minusthree
    .word _allot
    .word _latest
    .word smudge
    .word exit

```







!! COFF&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- )

[[<<|3ERASE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0ba4&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|ON]]


Store 0 char at `addr`


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
coff
    ldy #0
    beq off00

```







!! //COLD//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|WARM]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1ae6&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;48&nbsp;[[>>|HOT]]


One-time only (then disappear) system bootstrap initialization.
Runs once after "pettil.obj" loads, to prepare a development
environment.  The size of COLD doesn't really matter.  As
the final word in the core dictionary, COLD will FORGET
itself and its address becomes the value of FENCE.
It's a little hairy, I hope my comments will explain.

!!The pieces at load time
```
* 0400-040F   BASIC bootstrap (10 SYS 1037)
* 0410-       Core dictionary
              (about 6K of code)
* WARM        last permanent word in core dictionary
              <--FENCE -->
* HERE        COLD  initialize Forth
              HOT   more initialization in high-level Forth
              bannermsg

* there       2-byte load address of transient dictionary
              2-byte size of transient dictionary
* LAUNCH      first word in Transient dictionary
              Transient dictionary
              (about 5K of code}

              Symbol table
              (about 2K of headers)
* ($C9)       end of program
```
!!!COLD tasks

* change the [[pettillaunch|BASIC bootstrap]] vector from [[COLD]] to [[WARM]]
* set [[MEMSIZ]] from BASIC $34-35
* set [[SYMTAB]] as an offset from [[MEMSIZ]]
* set [[TDICT]] as the load address + 2 of part 2 (found at 'there')
* display a [[banner|bannermsg]]
* set STARTUP uservariable to [[LAUNCH]]
* move transient dictionary to [[TDICT]]
* move symbol table to [[SYMTAB]]
* set [[FENCE]]
* call [[WARM]] to put us in Forth mode

There is no knowledge in the core dictionary (at the bottom of memory)
of what is in the transient dictionary or where it resides.  To kick
things off upstairs, WARM starts Forth, then executes the word LAUNCH
in the upper dictionary, via the STARTUP uservariable.  The requirement
is that the first thing in tdict must be the executable CFA of LAUNCH
That's where we will pick things up.

Transient dictionary and symbols are built separately
as ~PETTIL-TDICT.OBJ and PETTIL.SYM.

The true load address of `pettil-tdict.obj` is offset by -2.
That's because there are two bytes stuffed in the front (the file size)
which are not part of the [[TDICT]] code.  It's done this way so
the cold start can figure out where the transient dictionary ends
and where the symbol table begins.  ($C9) in zero page tells the
cold start the last address in the file load, which is the end of the
symbol table.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cold
    nop                         ; make it easy to find here
    nop
    nop
    nop
    lda #<(bannermsg+1)         ; display a banner
    sta TEMPF1
    lda #>(bannermsg+1)
    sta TEMPF1+1
    ldy #0
cold01
    lda (TEMPF1),y
    jsr CHROUT
    iny
    cpy bannermsg
    bne cold01

    lda #<warm                  ; Overwrite the BASIC hook
    sta pettillaunch+1          ; change +1037 JMP COLD to +1037 JMP WARM
    lda #>warm                  ; for reentry
    sta pettillaunch+2

    lda MEMSIZ                  ; set top of memory address
    sta usermemsiz
    lda MEMSIZ+1
    sta usermemsiz+1

    jmp cold2warm               ; start Forth, run HOT next

```







!! //COMPILE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

!! //CONTROL//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr == dp ) ( -- )

[[<<|METHOD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$73e0&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|?>MARK]]


Runtime behavior of control words

```
does>
    ?comp  @+ swap c@+ family swap method ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
docontrol
    jsr dodoes
    .word _qcomp
    .word fetchplus
    .word swap
    .word cfetchplus
    .word plusminuspairs
    .word swap
    .word _method           ; transfers control to child word

```







* dest indicates a backward branch
* orig indicates a forward branch

||Compile|<|Runtime|<|definition|h
||before|after|before|after||h
|^IF|^.|^orig|^flag|^.|^: if<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;0 0 compile ?branch<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;?>mark 8 ;|
|^THEN|^orig|^.|^.|^.|^: then<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;?comp abs 8 ?pairs<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;?>resolve ?>resolve ;|
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^IF|^.|^orig|^flag|^.||
|^ELSE|^orig1|^orig2|^.|^.|^: else<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8 ?pairs<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;compile branch<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;swap ?>mark ?>resolve<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;0 -8 ;|
|^THEN|^orig|^.|^.|^.||
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^BEGIN|^.|^dest|^.|^.|^: begin<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;?<mark 4 ;|
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^BEGIN|^.|^dest|^.|^.||
|^UNTIL|^dest|^.|^flag|^.|^: until<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4 ?pairs  compile ?branch<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;?<resolve ;|
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^BEGIN|^.|^dest|^.|^.||
|^WHILE|^dest|^orig dest|^flag|^.||
|^REPEAT|^orig dest|^.|^.|^.|^: repeat again ;|
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h




|^DO|^.|^dest|^w1 w2|^.|^: do<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;$fb ?page<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;compile (do)<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;?<mark 3 ;|
|^LOOP/+LOOP|^dest|^.|^.|^.|^: loop<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3 ?pairs  $fb ?page<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;compile (loop)  ?<resolve ;|
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^DO|^.|^dest|^w1 w2|^.||
|^LEAVE|^.|^orig|^.|^.|^: leave<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;compile (leave)<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3 add>mark ;|
|^LOOP/+LOOP|^dest|^.|^.|^.||
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^DO|^.|^dest|^w1 w2|^.||
|^?LEAVE|^.|^orig2|^flag|^.|^: ?leave<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;compile (?leave)<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3 add>mark ;|
|^LOOP/+LOOP|^dest|^.|^.|^.||
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^?DO|^.|^dest orig1|^w1 w2|^.|^: ?do<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;$fb ?page<br/>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;compile (?do)  0 ?>mark  ?<mark drop swap 3 ;|
|^LOOP/+LOOP|^dest|^.|^.|^.||
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^?DO|^.|^dest orig1|^w1 w2|^.||
|^LOOP/+LOOP|^dest|^.|^.|^.||
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^?DO|^.|^dest orig1|^w1 w2|^.||
|^LEAVE|^.|^orig2|^.|^.||
|^LOOP/+LOOP|^dest|^.|^.|^.||
|^&nbsp;|<|<|<|<||h
|^?DO|^.|^dest orig1|^w1 w2|^.||
|^?LEAVE|^.|^orig2|^flag|^.||
|^LOOP/+LOOP|^dest|^.|^.|^.||







!! //Core includes//

[[<<|User Area]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$06d6&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;0&nbsp;[[>>|USERVAR]]


These are the source files included in [[PETTIL-CORE]].  The
other place to modify when adding/removing source files is
`xap.rb`


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
corebase
#print *
#include "core-user.a65"
#print *
#include "core-subroutines.a65"
#print *
#include "core-inner.a65"
#print *
#include "core-nucleus.a65"
#print *
#include "core-double.a65"
#print *
#include "core-io.a65"
#print *
#include "core-vm.a65"
#print *
#include "core-extra.a65"
#print *
;#include "../../mmm/src/mmm-nucleus.a65"
;#print *

```







!! COUNT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr1 -- addr2 n1 )

[[<<|TOGGLE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c61&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;0&nbsp;[[>>|C@+]]


Leaves the address, addr2 and the character count +n of text
beginning at addr1.  addr2 is addr1+1 and n1 is the length of
the counted string at addr1.  The byte at addr1 contains the
byte count +n.  Range of +n is {0...255}.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
count
    ; synonym for C@+, fall through
```

!! CR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|?TERMINAL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$12af&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;27&nbsp;[[>>|EXPECT]]


Output a carriage return


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
cr
    jmp crvector
crvector
    lda #$0d
    jsr CHROUT
    lda #0
    sta uarea+usernumout-userarea
    sta uarea+usernumout-userarea+1
    inc uarea+usernumline-userarea
    bne cr01
    inc uarea+usernumline-userarea+1
cr01
    jmp next

```







!! CREATE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( "name" -- )

[[<<|COMPILE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$70f6&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|:]]


 A defining word executed in the form

     `CREATE <name>`

     Creates a dictionary entry for <name>.  After <name> is
     created, the next available dictionary location is the first
     byte of <name>'s parameter field.  When <name> is
     subsequently executed, the address of the first byte of
     <name>'s parameter field is left on the stack.  CREATE does
     not allocate space in <name>'s parameter field.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_create
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word docreate
    .word _pcreate
    .word exit

```







!! CS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( "name" -- )

[[<<|NOT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7c5f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|0=]]


```
90 cconstant cs ( assembler test for carry set )
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_asmcs
    jsr docconst
    .byt $90

```







!! CSP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|STATE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6858&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|NEWDP]]


!!!User variable
User variable used to store the current stack pointer, used by
the compiler to check for balance.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
csp
    jsr uservar
    .byt usercsp-userarea

```







!! CURRENT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|+ORIGIN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$683c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|FENCE]]


!!!User variable
The vocabulary id of the compilation vocabulary, where new definitions
are added.  [[DEFINITIONS]] sets this to the first entry in [[VSTACK]]


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
current
    jsr uservar
    .byt usercurrent-userarea

```







!! CURRNAME&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|(READDATA)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1772&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;25&nbsp;[[>>|FILE]]


Current filename

todo: All parameter and no code, maybe a string variable?


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
currname
    .byt (currname01-*-1)
    .asc "PETTILPACKETS",
currname01
    .asc              "           "
        ;"@0:full16characters,s,w "
        ; 123456789.123456789.1234

```







!! D-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d1 d2 -- d1-d2 )

[[<<|2!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$11bb&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|D0=]]


Subtract "d2" from "d1" leaving the result on the stack


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dminus
    jsr dodnegate
    jmp dplus

```

_ddotr
    jsr enter

rjustify
    .word rfrom

    .word minus
    .word _spaces
    .word type
    .word exit

!! D+&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d1 d2 -- d1+d2 )

[[<<|BETWEEN?]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$10c1&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;29&nbsp;[[>>|D<]]


Add two double precision numbers


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dplus
    clc
    lda stackl,x
    adc stackl+2,x
    sta stackl+2,x
    lda stackh,x
    adc stackh+2,x
    sta stackh+2,x
    lda tos
    adc stackl+1,x
    pha
    lda tos+1
    adc stackh+1,x
    tay
    pla
    inx
    inx
    jmp put            ; [29]

```







!! D<&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d1 d2 -- flag )

[[<<|D+]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$10de&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;39&nbsp;[[>>|DNEGATE]]


Compare two doubles.  True if d1 < d2


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dlt
    ldy #0          ; false
    jsr dcmp
    bvc dlt01
    eor #$80
dlt01
    bpl dlt02
    dey             ; true
dlt02
    sty tos
    sty tos+1
    inx
    inx
    inx
    jmp next
dcmp
    lda stackl+2,x
    cmp stackl,x
    lda stackh+2,x
    sbc stackh,x
    lda stackl+1,x
    sbc tos
    lda stackh+1,x
    sbc tos+1
    rts

```







!! D=&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( hi2 lo2 hi1 lo1 -- flag )

[[<<|D0=]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$11d0&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;34&nbsp;[[>>|DU<]]


Leaves true if the two doubles are equal


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
deq
    ldy #0
    lda tos
    eor stackl+1,x
    bne deq01
    lda tos+1
    eor stackh+1,x
    bne deq01
    lda stackl,x
    eor stackl+2,x
    bne deq01
    lda stackh,x
    eor stackh+2,x
    bne deq01
deq02
    dey
deq01
    inx
    inx
dzeq01
    inx
    tya
    jmp put

```







!! D>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d1 d2 -- flag )

[[<<|D2*]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$120f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|DMIN]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dgt
    jsr enter
    .word twoswap
    .word dlt
    .word exit

```







!! D0=&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d -- flag )

[[<<|D-]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$11c1&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|D=]]


Leave true if the double "d" is zero


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dzeq
    ldy #0
    lda tos
    ora tos+1
    ora stackl,x
    ora stackh,x
    bne dzeq01
    dey
    bmi dzeq01

```







!! D2*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d -- d*2 )

[[<<|D2/]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1204&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|D>]]


Multiply the double "d" by 2


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dtwostar
    asl stackl,x
    rol stackh,x
    rol tos
    rol tos+1
    jmp next

```







!! D2/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d -- d/2 )

[[<<|DU<]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$11f9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|D2*]]


Divides double "d" by 2, unsigned


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dtwoslash
    lsr stackh,x
    ror stackl,x
    ror tos+1
    ror tos
    jmp next

```







!! DABS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d -- +d )

[[<<|DNEGATE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$111b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|2DUP]]

<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dabs
    lda tos+1
    bpl dabs01
    jmp dnegate
dabs01
    jmp next

```







!! DEC,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|ASL,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d83&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|INC,]]


!!!Assembler instruction

!! DECIMAL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|HEX]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0802&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;8&nbsp;[[>>|RP!]]


Sets the system number base to decimal


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
decimal
    lda #10
    sta uarea+userbase-userarea
    jmp next

```







!! //DECODE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr-1 --  [ [arghi] arglo] opcode n )

[[<<|INSTR,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7b62&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;75&nbsp;[[>>|M/CPU]]


Adjusts the addressing mode
determines the instruction
encloses the instruction and 0, 1 or 2 bytes of operand


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
decode
    brk
    .byt ldi | TOS      ; n+0=opcode base
    .byt st | N0
    .byt ldd | TOS
    .byt st | N1        ; n+2=modes.lsb n+3=modes.msb
    .byt sub | ACC
    .byt push
    .byt push           ; TOS=0; 2OS=0; 3OS=junk; [4OS=arg]
    .byt rtn
                        ; y = 0..3  instruction group
                        ;  0 | 1  right side (odd) is 16-bit
                        ; ---+--- left side is 8-bit
                        ;  2 | 3  bottom half has $8x modes.lsb
decode00
    ldy #2              ; assume bottom half
    sty tos             ; assume 16-bit
    lda n+2             ; the lsb of the modes, please
    bmi decode01        ; $8x? (group 2,3)
    ldy #0
    lsr
    bcc decode02
    sty tos
    inx                 ; .A mode, no arguments
    bne decode05        ; bra (quadrant 0)
decode01
    asl
    beq decode03        ; JMP or JSR? 16-bit (quadrant 3)
decode02
    lda stackh+2,x
    beq decode04        ; 8-bit?
decode03
    lda stackl+2,x
    sta stackl+1,x
    lda stackh+2,x
    sta stackl+2,x      ; TOS=0; 2OS=junk; 3OS=arg16.lo; 4OS=arg16.hi
    iny
    bne decode05
decode04
    dec tos             ; left side, 1 argument
    inx                 ; TOS=0; 2OS=junk; 3OS=arg8
decode05
    tya
    asl
    asl
    asl
    ;clc
    ora asmmode+3
    tay
    lda asmindex,y
    bpl decode06
    lda #11                 ; "BAD ADDRESSING MODE"
    jmp error
decode06
    adc n
    sta stackl,x
    inc tos
decode07
    jmp next

```







!! //dectos//

[[<<|tos2minus]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07cc&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|(?:)]]


decrement TOS


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dectos
    lda tos
    bne dectos01
    dec tos+1
dectos01
    dec tos
    rts
```







!!!Dedicated to those heroes of mine I share a first name with

* Charles Henry Hitselberger - my dad, for teaching me to play chess
* Charles Allan Williams - my grandfather, for showing me how to tinker
* Charles Henry Hitselberger - my son, for tolerating me
* Michael Andrew Hitselberger - my son, even though he isn't a Charles, for being as jazzed as I was when we turned on the PET after 25 years.
* Chuck Peddle - creator of the 6502 and the Commodore PET
* Charles Moore - creator of Forth
* Charles M. Schultz - creator of Peanuts
* Charlie Brown - for teaching me how to read







!! //DEDUPVOCAB//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|VOCABULARY]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$72dd&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;27&nbsp;[[>>|(VOCAB)]]


remove duplicates from [[VSTACK]]


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dedupvocab
    ldy #4              ; start after JSR DOVOCAB and new vocid
dovocab02
    lda vstack,y
    beq dovocab04       ; all done when we hit FORTH vocab
    eor vstack+3        ; compare to new vocid
    beq dovocab03       ; this vocabulary is a duplicate?
    iny
    bne dovocab02       ; bra
dovocab03
    iny
    lda vstack,y
    sta vstack-1,y
    bne dovocab03
dovocab04
    jmp next

```

[[<<|FORTH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$688b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|NFALEN01]]


Sets the compilation vocabulary by copying the first vocabulary in
the [[VSTACK]] search order to [[CURRENT]].


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_definitions
    jsr enter
    .word vstack
    .word cfetch
    .word current
    .word store
    .word exit

```







!! DEPTH&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|R2D2]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1051&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|>BIT]]


Returns the depth of the data stack


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
depth
    txa
    eor #$ff
    sec
    adc #<bos
    jmp push0a

```

idex

!!Tables illustrating the head and body of a word

!!Dictionary Entry
!!!Head (symbol)
<table class="fixed"><col width="10%"/><col width="10%"/><col width="10%"/><col width="10%"/><col width="10%"/><col width="10%"/><col width="10%"/><col width="10%"/><col width="20%"/>
<tr><td>7</td><td>6</td><td>5</td><td>4</td><td>3</td><td>2</td><td>1</td><td>0</td><td>offset</td></tr>
<tr valign="top"><td colspan="8"  align="center">Code Field Address <b>(CFA)</b></td><td colspan="1" align="right">-2</td></tr>
<tr><td>I</td><td>V</td><td>S</td><td colspan="5" align="center">length</td><td align="center"><b>(NFA)</b></td></tr>
<tr><td colspan="8" align="center">name[1]</td><td align="right">+1</td></tr>
<tr><td colspan="8" align="center">.</td><td align="center">.</td></tr>
<tr><td colspan="8" align="center">.</td><td align="center">.</td></tr>
<tr><td colspan="8" align="center">.</td><td align="center">.</td></tr>
<tr><td colspan="8" align="center">name[length]</td><td align="right">+length</td></tr>
<tr><td colspan="8" align="center">vocid (when V=1)</td><td align="right">+length+1</td></tr>
</table>

|flag|purpose|mask|h
| I |immediate|$80|
| V |vocabulary|$40|
| S |smudged|$20|

!!!Body (code)

|Secondary|<|h
|JSR ENTER|<b>(CFA)</b>|
|<i>word</i>|<|
|<i>word</i>|<|
|...|<|
|EXIT|<|
||<|
|Primitive|<|h
|lda tos|<b>(CFA)</b>|
|sta n|<|
|...|<|
|jmp next|<|







!! DIGIT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( char base -- digit true | false )

[[<<|$.]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1353&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;28&nbsp;[[>>|HOLD]]



 Converts a single character to a digit using the current number
 base.  A flag on TOS indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
todo: possible to code golf this down with BCD tricks?
"http://www.6502.org/tutorials/decimal_mode.html


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
digit
    ldy #$ff        ; assume success
    lda stackl,x    ; get the character
    sec
    sbc #'0'
    bcc digit02     ; char was < '0'? not a digit, fail
    cmp #10
    bcc digit01     ; digit is in the range 00-09
    sbc #7          ; no? alphabet adjust 'A' --> $0a
digit01
    cmp tos         ; compare to current number base
    bcs digit02     ; not in current number base? fail
    sta stackl,x    ; digit in the current number base
    .byt $2c        ; BIT xxyy, skip the next two bytes
digit02
    iny             ; fail, set flag to 0
    inx             ; drop the stack
    tya             ; ya = flag word $0000 or $ffff
    jmp put         ; next!

```







!! DLIT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d == ) ( -- d )

[[<<|LITERAL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7356&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|LOAD]]


Compiles a double into the dictionary as a numeric literal
!!!pronounced: d-lit


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dlit
    jsr enter
    .word swap
    .word _literal
    .word _literal
    .word exit

```







!! DMAX&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d1 d2 -- d3 )

[[<<|DMIN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$122a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|2@]]


Returns the larger of two doubles, signed


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dmax
    jsr enter
    .word twoover
    .word twoover
    .word dlt
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(dmax01-*+1)
    .word twoswap
dmax01
    .word twodrop
    .word exit

```







!! DMIN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d1 d2 -- d3 )

[[<<|D>]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1218&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|DMAX]]


Returns d1 or d2, whichever is smaller (signed)


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dmin
    jsr enter
    .word twoover
    .word twoover
    .word _dgt
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(dmin01-*+1)
    .word twoswap
dmin01
    .word twodrop
    .word exit

```







!! DNEGATE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d -- -d )

[[<<|D<]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1105&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;22&nbsp;[[>>|DABS]]


Negate the double on the stack


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dnegate
    lda #>(next-1)
    pha
    lda #<(next-1)
    pha
dodnegate
    sec
    lda #0
    sbc stackl,x
    sta stackl,x
    lda #0
    sbc stackh,x
    sta stackh,x
    jmp neg2

```







!! DO&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( == dp ) ( limit start -- )

[[<<|?<RESOLVE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7426&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|?DO]]



```
' (do) 3 control do ]
    drop ?>mark ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_do
    jsr docontrol
    .word pdo
    .byt 3
    .word _qtomark
    .word exit

```







!! //DO2CONST//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- d )

[[<<|DOCCONST]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$09f4&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;34&nbsp;[[>>|R@]]


Runtime behavior of words defined by 2CONSTANT


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dotwoconst
    jsr slip
    dex
    pla
    sta n
    pla
    sta n+1
    ldy #5
    lda (n),y
    sta tos+1
    dey
    lda (n),y
    sta tos
    dey
    lda (n),y
    sta stackh,x
    dey
    lda (n),y
    sta stackl,x
    jmp next

```







!! //doasmmode//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|MODE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7b37&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|docpu]]

Set the addressing mode

_doasmmode

    .word cfetch

    .word exit

!! //DOCCONST//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|DOCONST]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$09e2&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|DO2CONST]]


Runtime behavior of a word defined by CCONSTANT


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
docconst
    clc
    jsr slip
    pla
    sta tos
    pla
    sta tos+1
    ldy #1
    lda (tos),y
    bcc push0a
    bcs fetchya            ; bra

```







!! //DOCONST//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- c )

[[<<|@]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$09e0&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;2&nbsp;[[>>|DOCCONST]]


Runtime behavior of a word defined by CONSTANT


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
doconst
    sec
    .byt $29                ; AND # to skip the CLC
```







!! //docpu//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|doasmmode]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7b44&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|INSTR,]]


!!!Assembler mode
Indirect addressing mode

_docpu
    jsr enter
    .word _caller
    .word cfetch
    .word one
    .word _instrcomma
    .word exit

!! //DOCREATE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|CALLER]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0a33&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|FAIL]]


The business end of words created by CREATE, returns the address
of the calling word plus 1

docreate
    jsr slip
    pla

!! DOES>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|DPSWAP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7167&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;34&nbsp;[[>>|BISHWHET]]


Terminates the compile-time (parent) code of a `<BUILDS ... DOES> ...`
definition in the transient dictionary and begins compilation of the
commonly shared run-time (child) code into the core dictionary

```
: does>
    ?comp  0pairs [compile] exit dp @ tdp @ > if dpswap then
    ['] dodoes cfa, ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_does
    jsr enter
    .word _qcomp
    .word _zeropairs
    .word _compile
    .word exit
    .word dp
    .word fetch
    .word tdp
    .word fetch
    .word gt
#include "page3.i65"
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(does01-*+1)
    .word _dpswap
does01
    .word plit
    .word dodoes
    .word _cfacomma
    .word exit

```







!! //DOPAGE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|(LIT)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$091e&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|?BRANCH]]


Page boundary crossing is handled by the compiler inserting 'page'
when the DP gets to $xxFD or $xxFE.  IP = $xxFF is never supposed
to occur, and indicates an error in the compiler.

pad is also used by LITERAL, string, and other words which
contain inline arguments to offset IP at runtime

It is important that callers to `pad` set Carry

```
pad
    adc ip          ; pass A = offset added to IP
    bcs branch02    ; check for page boundary crossing
    cmp #$ff
    bne branch03    ; check for xxFF at end of page
page
    lda #0
    beq branch02    ; bra
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pad
    adc ip
    tay
    iny
    beq branch05
    bne branch04
page
    inc ip+1
    ldy #0
    beq exit03      ; bra

```







!! //DOTAPEIO//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|RESTORE-FORTH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1752&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|(SAVEPRG)]]


Perform a ROM call framed between calls to [[Aloha]]. This is
needed in particular for tape I/O, which might error out to a
Commodore BASIC `ready.` prompt.

Like [[EXECUTE]] and the Sweet-16 interpreter, this word
uses the machine stack ($0100-$01ff) and RTS trick to transfer
control from one subroutine to the next, so that code executes
in this order:

```
stashforth
RTS
caller's ROM routine
RTS
restoreforth
EXIT
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dotapeio
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word restoreforth-1
    .word _caller
    .word fetch
    .word oneminus
    .word twotor
    .word stashforth

```







!! DP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|RP0]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$06f5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|MEMSIZ]]


Dictionary pointer


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dp
    jsr uservar
    .byt userdp-userarea

```







!! DPL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|BASE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$072d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|HLD]]


!!!User variable
User variable containing the number of digits following the
decimal in numeric input conversion


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dpl
    jsr uservar
    .byt userdpl-userarea

```







!! DPSWAP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|?:]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$715c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|DOES>]]


Switches the transient dictionary pointer [[TDP]] with the core
dictionary pointer [[DP]]

```
: dpswap   ( -- )
    dp tdp @swap! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dpswap
    jsr enter
    .word dp
    .word tdp
    .word _fetchswapstore
    .word exit

```







!! DROP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- )

[[<<|2DROP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$09bd&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|SP@]]


Discard the top item on the stack


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
drop
    ldy stackh,x
    lda stackl,x
    inx
put
    sty tos+1
    sta tos
    jmp next

```







!! //DROPLIT//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d == ) ( -- n )

[[<<|2VARIABLE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$732f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;8&nbsp;[[>>|LITERAL]]


Compiles the least significant 16 bits of a double into the dictionary as
a numeric literal

!!!pronounced: drop-lit


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_droplit
    jsr enter
    .word drop
    .word branch
    .byt <(literal00-*+1)

```







!! DRV#&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|SA#]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$070d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|FILENAME]]


!!!User variable
User variable that holds the device # used by [[SAVE-BUFFERS]]
[[LOAD-BUFFERS]] STOP-S STOP-V and STOP-L in the editor

!!!pronounced: "drive-num"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
drvnum
    jsr uservar
    .byt userdrvnum-userarea

```







!! DU<&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( d1 d2 -- flag )

[[<<|D=]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$11f2&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|D2/]]


Performs an unsigned compare of two doubles and leaves true if "d1" < "d2"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dult
    jsr dcmp
    bcs deq01
    bcc deq02

```







!! DUMP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr size -- )

[[<<|XLATE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7558&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;81&nbsp;[[>>|-->]]


Dumps a region of memory as lines of eight bytes each

```
: dump   ( addr size -- )
    0
    ?do
        #out @ 0=
        if
            dup msb h.
            dup lsb h.
        then
        c@+ space h.
        #out @ 25 >
        if
            space 18 emit
            dup 8 - under
            do i c@ xlate emit loop cr
        then
        ?terminal  if leave then
    loop
    drop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_dump
    jsr enter
    .word zero
#include "page3.i65"
    .word pqdo
    .byt <(dump06-*+1)
dump01
    .word numout
    .word fetch
    .word zeq
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(dump02-*+1)
    .word dup
    .word _fourhdot
dump02
    .word cfetchplus
    .word _space
    .word _hdot
    .word numout
    .word fetch
    .word clit
    .byt 25
    .word gt
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(dump05-*+1)
    .word _space
    .word clit
    .byt RVSON
    .word emit
    .word dup
    .word eight
    .word minus
    .word under
    .word pdo
    .byt <(dump04-*+1)
dump03
    .word i
    .word cfetch
    .word xlate
    .word emit
    .word ploop
    .byt <(dump03-*+1)
dump04
    .word cr
dump05
    .word qterminal
    .word pqleave
    .word ploop
    .byt <(dump01-*+1)
dump06
    .word drop
    .word exit

```







!! DUP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- n n )

[[<<|?DUP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c2b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|slip]]


Duplicate the value on the stack.

!!! pronounced: "dupe"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
dup
    lda #>(next-1)
    pha
    lda #<(next-1)
    pha
    ; fall through
```







!! DUP>R&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- n ) ( R; -- n )

[[<<|>R]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0b75&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|RSWAP]]


Copy the top of the data stack to the return stack

!!! pronounced: "dupe to-r"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
duptor
    clc
    lda tos+1
    pha
    lda tos
    pha
    bcc not1
    jmp drop

```







!! EDIT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( scr -- )

[[<<|(EDIT)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7a91&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;24&nbsp;[[>>|LIST]]


PETTIL's editor leverages the wonderful ROM screen editor
on the PET, using the `STOP` key as a substitute for escape,
not present on early PET keyboards.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_edit
    jsr enter
    .word _editinit
edit00              ; reentry to editor here
    .word plit
    .word (MAINIRQ^pedit02)
    .word irqcaret   ; enable STOP key trap
    .word pedit
    .word plit
    .word (MAINIRQ^pedit02)
    .word irqcaret        ; disable STOP key trap, also does CLI
    .word _editcmd  ; get and perform editor command
    .word branch
    .byt <(edit00-*+1)      ; AGAIN
;    .word exit

```







!! //EDITCMD//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|$INDEX]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7a3a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;38&nbsp;[[>>|(EDIT)]]



 get a key and perform that command



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editcmd
    jsr enter
    .word editmenu              ; ( editmenu )
    .word flipscr
    .word key                   ; ( editmenu char )
    .word flipscr
    .word dolindex              ; ( index|0 )
    .word qdup                  ; ( index index | 0 )
    .word qbranch               ; IF
    .byt <(editcmd01-*+1)
    .word twostar               ; ( 2*index )
    .word editmenu              ; ( 2*index editmenu )
    .word dup                   ; ( 2*index editmenu editmenu )
    .word cfetch                ; ( 2*index editmenu #items )
    .word plus                  ; ( 2*index editmenu+#items )
    .word plus                  ; ( 2*index+editmenu+#items )
    .word oneminus              ; ( 2*index+editmenu+#items-1 )
    .word fetch                 ; ( editcmdcfa )
    .word execute               ; ( )
editcmd01                       ; THEN
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITCOPY//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|LOGLINE+]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$77dc&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;42&nbsp;[[>>|EDITDEL]]


STOP-C Copy Line

Appends a copy of the current logical screen line to the paste buffer

```
: editcopy
   paste logline lineinfo
   (>paste) cmove 2drop ;
: editcopy   ( -- )
    logline lineinfo >r paste @  r@ cmove
    paste r@ +!
    pwrap 2@ r> 40/mod nip wrap+ pwrap 2! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editcopy
    jsr enter
    .word logline
    .word lineinfo
    .word tor
    .word paste
    .word fetch
    .word rfetch
    .word cmove
    .word rfetch
    .word paste
    .word plusstore
    .word pwrap
    .word twofetch
    .word rfrom
    .word wrapplus
    .word drop
    .word pwrap
    .word twostore
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITDEL//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITCOPY]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7806&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;58&nbsp;[[>>|EDITPASTE]]


STOP-D Delete Line

Append the current logical screen line and delete it from the
screen

```
: editdel   ( -- )
    editcopy  logline dup lineinfo >r >r
    logline+ ?dup
    if
        lineinfo drop r> 33768 third -
        2dup + >r cmove
    then
    r> r@ blank logline r> wraproll ;

: editdel   ( -- )
    editcopy logline dup lineinfo >r >r
    logline+ lineinfo drop r> 33768 third -
    2dup + >r cmove r> r@ blank logline r> wraproll ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editdel
    jsr enter
    .word _editcopy             ; ( )
    .word logline
    .word dup
    .word lineinfo
    .word tor
    .word tor
    .word loglineplus
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(editdel01-*+1)
    .word lineinfo
    .word drop
    .word rfrom
    .word plit
    .word VIDRAM+1000
    .word third
    .word minus
    .word twodup
    .word plus
    .word tor
    .word cmove
editdel01
    .word rfrom
    .word rfetch
    .word _blank
    .word logline
    .word rfrom
    .word wraproll
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITDELSCR//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITRESTORE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$796c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;0&nbsp;[[>>|SCRDEL]]



 delete the current screen.  restore from next, then prev, then blank

~ write this


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
editdelscr
;    jsr enter
;    .word exit

```







!! //EDITINDEX//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITQUIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7934&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;0&nbsp;[[>>|EDITSAVE]]



 STOP-I   Present an index screen and let the user select one to edit
