!! //EDITINFO//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITINSSCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$79a4&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19&nbsp;[[>>|EDITINIT]]


Show the user an info screen


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editinfo
    jsr enter
    .word _update
    .word _clrscr
    .word _info
    .word true
    .word _pause
    .word _clrscr
    .word _editrestore
    .word exit

```







!! EDITING&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|SCRPKT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0721&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|TDICT]]


!!!User variable
If `EDITING`

* [[BLOCK]] will generate new [[screen packets|PETTIL packet map]]
* [[VIDRAM]] buffer is used by [[BLOCK]] and [[UPDATE]]
* screen packets are displayed and updated
* data packets are displayed but not updated

If not `EDITING`

* [[BLOCK]] will generate new [[data packets|PETTIL packet map]]
* [[BLKBUF]] buffer is used by [[BLOCK]] and [[UPDATE]]
* [[screen and data packets|PETTIL packet map]] are updated


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
editing
    jsr uservar
    .byt userediting-userarea

```







!! EDITING?&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- flag )

[[<<|PKT.INFO]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$163b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|ISSCR?]]


Retrieves the EDITING user variable

```
: editing?
    editing @ ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
editingq
    lda uarea+userediting-userarea
    ldy uarea+userediting-userarea+1
    jmp pushya

```







!! //EDITINIT//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( scr -- )

[[<<|EDITINFO]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$79b7&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|EDITSPACE]]



 prepare before we drop into the editor infinite loop

```
: editinit   ( scr -- )
     scr@ editzilch ;

```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editinit
    jsr enter
    .word editing
    .word on
    .word _block
    .word drop
    .word _editzilch
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITINSSCR//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|SCRDEL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$796c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;56&nbsp;[[>>|EDITINFO]]



 insert a new, blank screen

~ still a little goofy when inserting multiple screens


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editinsscr
    jsr enter
    .word _update
    .word vmbuf
    .word fetch
    .word scr
    .word fetch
    .word _topkt
    .word duptor
    .word oneplus
    .word plit
    .word -5
    .word dup
    .word vmbuf
    .word plusstore
    .word _plusmove
    .word plit
    .word editinsscr01
    .word rfrom
    .word threeminus
    .word five
    .word cmove
    .word numvmpkt
    .word oneplusstore
    .word _editrestore
    .word exit
editinsscr01
    .byt $ff, $ff, $ff, $05, $80

```







!! //EDITLOAD//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITSAVE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7941&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|EDITVERIFY]]



 STOP-L   Load a group of buffers from a PRG file



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editload
    jsr enter
    .word _clrscr
    .word _loadbuffers
    .word scr
    .word off
    .word _editrestore
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITMENU//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|EDITSPACE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$79ec&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;58&nbsp;[[>>|$INDEX]]



 returns the address of a counted string of menu commands



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
editmenu
     jsr docreate
     .byt editmenu01-*-1        ; number of menu items = 16
     .asc "QISLVZRDCP ?"         ; command keys
     .byt DELETE, INSERT, HOME, CLR, CRSRDOWN, CRSRUP
editmenu01
     .word _editquit             ; CFA of corresponding Forth word
     .word editindex            ; 01
     .word _editsave            ; 02
     .word _editload            ; 03
     .word editverify           ; 04
     .word _editzilch           ; 05
     .word _editrestore         ; 06
     .word _editdel             ; 07
     .word _editcopy            ; 08
     .word _editpaste           ; 09
     .word _editspace           ; 0a
     .word _editinfo            ; 0b
     .word editdelscr           ; 0c
     .word _editinsscr          ; 0d
     .word _edittopscr          ; 0e
     .word _editnowrap          ; 0f
     .word _editnextscr         ; 10
     .word _editprevscr         ; 11

```







!! //EDITNEXTSCR//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITTOPSCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7911&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|EDITPREVSCR]]


restore from the next screen or append a blank one

```
: editnextscr   ( -- )
    1 +edit ;

```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editnextscr
    jsr enter
    .word one
    .word _plusedit
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITNOWRAP//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITZILCH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$78a5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;26&nbsp;[[>>|>EDIT]]



 reset the linewrap table and force this block to be a screen
 even if it was a data packet



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editnowrap
    stx z
    ldx #24
editnowrap01
    asl $e0,x
    sec
    ror $e0,x
    dex
    bpl editnowrap01
    inx
    stx uarea+userscrpkt-userarea
    ldx #$80
    stx uarea+userscrpkt-userarea+1
    ldx z
    jmp exit

```







!!Invoking the editor
First, either load a [[packetspace]] with [[LOAD-BUFFERS]] , or create a new 
one and start with an empty screen. 

[[EMPTY-BUFFERS]] [[3]] [[EDIT]]

This creates packets 0, 1, 2 and 3 as screens in a brand new packet space, and 
brings up screen 3.

!!Editor command summary

|key|description|<|h
|* STOP-Q|Quit the editor|!*|
|* STOP-I|Index screen|<|
|* STOP-S|Save buffers|!*|
|* STOP-L|Load buffers|<|
|* STOP-V|Verify buffers|<|
|* STOP-Z|Zilch paste buffer|<|
|* STOP-R|Restore buffer from last update|<|
|* STOP-D|Delete line|<|
|* STOP-C|Copy line|<|
|* STOP-P|Paste buffer insert|<|
|* STOP-DEL|Delete screen|<|
|* STOP-INS|Insert screen|!*|
|* STOP-HOME|Go to first screen|!*|
|* STOP-CLR|Clear read-only bit, reset linewrap|<|
|* STOP-DN|Next screen|!*|
|* STOP-UP|Prev screen|!*|
||command [[updates|UPDATE]] the current<br>screen in the packet buffer|!*|f







!! //EDITPASTE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITDEL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7840&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;84&nbsp;[[>>|EDITZILCH]]



STOP-P

Insert the paste buffer above the current logical line

```
: editpaste   ( -- )
    paste @  logline
    dup lineinfo drop over eos third - cmove
    pwrap 2@ logline
    begin
        dup>r
        lineinfo nip
        wrap+ drop
        r> logline+ dup 0=
    until drop
    logline wrap^ 2swap
    wrap* wrap!
    pad logline lineinfo eos over - cmove
    paste ! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editpaste
    jsr enter
    .word paste
    .word fetch
    .word logline
    .word lineinfo
    .word drop
    .word over
    .word plit
    .word VIDRAM+1000
    .word third
    .word minus
    .word cmove
    .word pwrap
    .word twofetch
    .word logline
editpaste01
    .word duptor
    .word lineinfo
    .word nip
    .word wrapplus
    .word drop
    .word rfrom
    .word loglineplus
    .word qdup
    .word zeq
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(editpaste01-*+1)
    .word logline
    .word wrapabove
    .word wrapstar
    .word wrapstore
    .word _pad
    .word logline
    .word lineinfo
    .word drop
    .word plit
    .word VIDRAM+1000
    .word over
    .word minus
    .word cmove
    .word paste
    .word store
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITPREVSCR//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITNEXTSCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$791a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|EDITQUIT]]



 restore from the previous screen or insert a blank one

```
: editprevscr   ( -- )
    -1 +edit ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

_editprevscr
    jsr enter
    .word minusone
    .word _plusedit
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITQUIT//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITPREVSCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7923&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|EDITINDEX]]


STOP-Q   Quit the editor


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editquit
    jsr enter
    .word _update
    .word editing
    .word off
    .word rdrop         ; discard returns
    .word rdrop
    .word rdrop
    .word exit          ; exiting from EDIT

```







!! //EDITRESTORE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITVERIFY]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$795f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|EDITDELSCR]]

_editrestore
    jsr enter
    .word scr
    .word fetch
    .word _block
    .word drop
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITSAVE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

_editsave

!! //EDITSPACE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITINIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$79c6&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;38&nbsp;[[>>|EDITMENU]]



scan for shifted spaces

```
: editspace   ( -- )
     vidram b/scr + vidram
     do
       i c@ $60 =
       if $e0 i c! then
    loop ;

```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editspace
    jsr enter
    .word vidram
    .word bperscr
    .word plus
    .word vidram
    .word pdo
    .byt <(editspace03-*+1)
editspace01
    .word i
    .word cfetch
    .word clit
    .byt $60
    .word eq
    .word qbranch               ; IF
    .byt <(editspace02-*+1)
    .word clit
    .byte $e0
    .word i
    .word cstore
editspace02
    .word ploop
    .byt <(editspace01-*+1)
editspace03
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITTOPSCR//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|^]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7908&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|EDITNEXTSCR]]



 from the top (first) screen

_edittopscr
    jsr enter
    .word zero
    .word _toedit
    .word exit

```







!! //EDITVERIFY//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

editverify
    jsr enter

    .word exit

!! //EDITZILCH//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EDITPASTE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7894&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|EDITNOWRAP]]



 STOP-Z   Zilch the paste buffer

```
: editzilch   ( -- )
     pad paste !  pwrap 4 erase ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_editzilch
    jsr enter
    .word _pad
    .word paste
    .word store
    .word pwrap
    .word four
    .word _erase
    .word exit

```







!! EIGHTY&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- 80 )

[[<<|6]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0cac&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|FORTY]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
eighty
    lda #80
    .byt $2c            ; BIT abs instruction
```







!! ELSE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( == )

[[<<|IF]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7478&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;16&nbsp;[[>>|THEN]]



```
' ?branch -2 control else ]
    +/-pairs ?>mark ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_else
    jsr docontrol
    .word branch
    .byt <(-2)
    .word plusminuspairs
    .word _qtomark
    .word swap
    .word _qtoresolve
    .word exit

```







!! ELSE,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|THEN,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7c08&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;31&nbsp;[[>>|AGAIN,]]


```
: else,   3 ?pairs here 1+   1 jmp,
    swap here over 1+ - swap c! -3 ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_asmelse
    jsr enter
    .word three
;    .word _qpairs
    .word here
    .word oneplus
    .word one
    .word ijmp
    .word swap
    .word here
    .word over
    .word oneplus
    .word minus
    .word swap
    .word cstore
    .word minusthree
    .word exit

```







!! EMIT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( c -- )

[[<<|2R@]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$127c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19&nbsp;[[>>|KEY]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
emit
    jmp emitvector
emitvector
    inc uarea+usernumout-userarea
    bne emit01
    inc uarea+usernumout-userarea+1
emit01
    lda tos
    jsr CHROUT
    jmp drop

```







!! EMPTY-BUFFERS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|#VMPKT!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1731&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|STASH-FORTH]]


Unassign all virtual memory.  UPDATEed blocks are not written
to mass storage.

```
: empty-buffers   ( -- )
    blkbuf 2-  dup vmbuf !  off  blk off  scr off  #vmpkt! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_emptybuffers
    jsr enter
    .word _blkbuf
    .word twominus
    .word off
    .word _scr0
    .word _numvmpktstore
    .word exit

```







!! END-CODE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( "name" -- )

[[<<|;CODE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7cbe&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|.A]]


Remove [[ASSEMBLER]] vocabulary from VSTACK.  Does this by
(re)invoking the [[ASSEMBLER]] vocabulary to make it the
first one in [[VSTACK]], then sliding the rest of [[VSTACK]]
backward to overwrite it.

```
: end-code   ( -- )
    close-definition assembler vdrop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_endcode
    jsr enter
    .word _closedefinition
    .word assembler             ; force assembler to front
    .word _vdrop                ; and drop it
    .word exit

```







!! //ENTER//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|(DOES)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0889&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19&nbsp;[[>>|(+LOOP)]]


The business end of colon definition words, pushes the current
IP on the return stack and executes the word following it


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
enter
    pla             ; [4]
    tay             ; [2]
    pla             ; [4]
    sta z           ; [3]
enter01
    lda ip+1        ; [3]
    pha             ; [3]
    lda ip          ; [3]
    pha             ; [3]
    lda z           ; [3]
    iny
    bne toforth     ; [3] bra
yikes
    sec
    bcs exit01


```







!! //EOL?.SCR//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- flag )

[[<<|REFILL.SCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6ea9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;30&nbsp;[[>>|SOURCE.SCR]]


Leaves true when, while parsing a screen, the cursor is at the end of
a line.  This test triggers a refill event.

```
: eol?.scr   ( -- flag )
    #lin @  >in @  over min  =
    lin @ 25 < and ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_eolqscr
    jsr enter
    .word numlin
    .word fetch
    .word toin
    .word fetch
    .word over
    .word _min
    .word eq
    .word lin
    .word fetch
    .word clit
    .byt 25
    .word lt
    .word andx
    .word exit

```







!! EOR,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|CMP,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d5f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|LDA,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a EOR opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
ieor
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $40
    .word $1c6e

```







!! ERASE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr howmany -- )

[[<<|FILL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0dfe&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|BLANK]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_erase
    jsr enter
    .word zero
    .word fill
    .word exit

```







!! //Error messages//

[[<<|FORGET]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6d09&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;220&nbsp;[[>>|EXISTS?]]


PETTIL system messages, output by [[FAIL]]


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
errptr
    .word msg01,msg02,msg03,msg04,msg05,msg06,msg07,msg08
    .word msg09,msg10,msg11

msg01
    .byt msg02-*-1
    .asc "STACK UNDERFLOW"
msg02
    .byt msg03-*-1
    .asc "STACK OVERFLOW"
msg03
    .byt msg04-*-1
    .asc "NOT FOUND"
msg04
    .byt msg05-*-1
    .asc "DEFINITION UNFINISHED"
msg05
    .byt msg06-*-1
    .asc "COMPILATION ONLY"
msg06
    .byt msg07-*-1
    .asc "UNPAIRED CONDITIONALS"
msg07
    .byt msg08-*-1
    .asc "CAN'T FORGET BELOW FENCE"
msg08
    .byt msg09-*-1
    .asc "BLOCK OUT OF RANGE"
msg09
    .byt msg10-*-1
    .asc " MISSING"
msg10
    .byt msg11-*-1
    .byt "CORRUPT VIRTUAL MEMORY"
msg11
    .byt msg12-*-1
    .byt "BAD ADDRESSING MODE"
msg12

```







!! EXECUTE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( cfa -- )

[[<<|(?:)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07ed&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|SP!]]


Executes the word whose code field address is on the stack.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
execute
    lda tos+1       ; [3]
    pha             ; [4]
    lda tos         ; [3]
    pha             ; [4]
    jsr slide       ; [a lot]   (slide always clears Z flag)
    php             ; [4]
    rti             ; [7]

```







!! //EXISTS?//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr flag )

[[<<|Error messages]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6de5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19&nbsp;[[>>|']]


parses the next token in the input stream.  Returns either the
address of the (unfound) token at HERE and a 0, or the code
field address of the word and -1 for normal, +1 for immediate
words

```
: exists?
   bl word dup c@ ?: find 0 ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_existsq
    jsr enter
    .word bl
    .word _word
    .word dup
    .word cfetch
    .word pquerycolon
    .word _find
    .word zero
    .word exit

```







!! //EXIT//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|UNLOOP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$08e3&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;33&nbsp;[[>>|(CLIT)]]


The runtime behavior of ;
Exits a colon definition, unnesting to the next higher level of
the return stack



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
exit
    lda #2          ; [2]
exit04
    sta ip          ; [3]
    pla             ; [4]
    clc             ; [2]
    adc ip          ; [3]
    tay             ; [2]
    pla             ; [4]
exit01
    adc #0          ; [2] = [12]
                    ; >FORTH -- Jump up to high-level Forth from inline 6502
                    ; pass AY = address
toforth
    sta ip+1        ; [3]
exit03
    sty ip          ; [3]
    jmp nexto       ; [3]


padxyzzy
    clc
    adc ip
    tay
    iny
    bne pad01xyzzy
    sec
pad01xyzzy
    lda ip+1
    adc #0          ; cross page boundary
    bcc toforth      ; bra

```







!! EXPECT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr +n -- )

[[<<|CR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$12ca&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;38&nbsp;[[>>|IRQ^]]


Stores up to +n characters into memory beginning at addr.
Receive characters and store each into memory.
The transfer begins at addr proceeding towards
higher addresses one byte per character until
either "return" is received or until +n characters have been transfered.  No more than +n
characters will be stored.  The "return" is not
stored into memory.  No characters are received
or transfered if +n is zero.  All characters
actually received and stored into memory will
be displayed, with the "return" displaying as a
space.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
expect
    jmp expectvector
expectvector
    ;ldy #2
    jsr locals2
    stx z
    dey
    ;ldy #$ff
expect01
    iny
    cpy tos
    bcs expect02
    jsr CHRIN
    cmp #$0d
    beq expect02
    sta (n),y
    bne expect01
expect02
    lda #0
    sty uarea+userspan-userarea
    sta uarea+userspan-userarea+1
    ldx z
    jmp drop

```







!! FAIL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( error -- )

[[<<|DOCREATE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0a3f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;44&nbsp;[[>>|UM*]]


Outputs an [[error message|Error messages]], then [[ABORT]]

```
: fail   ( err# -- )
    warning @ ?dup
    if
        swap 2* + @ count type
    else
        . ."?ERR"
    then
    startup @ execute ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_fail
    jsr enter
    .word warning
    .word fetch
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(fail01-*+1)
    .word swap
    .word twostar
    .word plus
    .word twominus
    .word fetch
    .word count
    .word type
    .word branch
    .byt <(fail03-*+1)
fail01
    .word _dot
    .word pdq
    .byt (fail02-*-1)
    .asc "?ERR"
fail02
fail03
    .word startup
    .word fetch
    .word execute
```







!! FALSE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- 0 )

[[<<|0]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0ccc&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|0=]]


Put a 0 (false flag) on the stack


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
false
    lda #0
    beq true01

```







!! FENCE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|CURRENT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6840&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|SYMNEW]]


!!!User variable
Returns the address of the user variable FENCE which defines
the lower limit of FORGET


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
fence
    jsr uservar
    .byt userfence-userarea

```







!! FILE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( filename device secondary -- )

[[<<|CURRNAME]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$178b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|(FILE)]]


Set up parameters for file i/o

```
: file
    sa# ! drv# ! filename ! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_file
    jsr enter
    .word sanum
    .word store
    .word drvnum
    .word store
    .word filename
    .word store
    .word exit

```







!! FILENAME&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|DRV#]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0711&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|VMBUF]]


!!!User variable
User variable that holds the address of a counted string which is
the filename that will be used on the next [[SAVE-BUFFERS]]
[[LOAD-BUFFERS]] or STOP-S STOP-V STOP-L in the editor


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
filename
    jsr uservar
    .byt userfilename-userarea

```







!! FILL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr howmany value -- )

[[<<|3C!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0ddf&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;31&nbsp;[[>>|ERASE]]




 howmany has an upper limit of 32K bytes



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
fill
    ;ldy #4
    jsr locals4      ; addr -> N0; howmany -> N1
    lda #>(drop-1)
    pha
    lda #<(drop-1)
    pha
fills
    clc
    ;ldy #0
    lda tos
fill01
    dec n+3
    bpl fill02
    sec             ; fill a partial page then exit
    ldy n+2
    beq fill03      ; nothing to do?
fill02
    dey
    sta (n),y
    bne fill02
    inc n+1
    bcc fill01
fill03
    rts
    ;jmp drop

```







!! //FIND//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr1 -- addr2 flag )

[[<<|(VFIND)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6a49&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;60&nbsp;[[>>|(CREATE)]]


addr1 is the address of a counted string, which is the word to look
up in the dictionary.

if not found, addr2 is the original addr1, and flag = 0
if found, addr2 is the code field address of the word,
and flag = -1 for normal words, +1 for immediate words

! outer interpreter

name is the address of a counted string we are searching for.
fflag is the find mode.  False means NFAs are sorted, True means check them all
nfa is the first nfa in the hash list

vocid identifies which vocabulary to search.  Vocabularies may be
nested.  FIND walks up the CONTEXT tree and leaves a set of hashed
NFAs (with the vocid appended to the name before hashing) on the stack.
The final vocabulary searched will be core, and (FIND) will exit afterward.

  0 = corelist

  1 = assembler

  2+ = vocabularies added by the user

(FIND) first searches all unsorted names beginning at SYMTAIL, without regard
to name length.  If it fails to find the word there,
it tries the hash list, which is sorted in ascending size
order.  Vocabularies are searched first, beginning with CONTEXT and chaining
up until core (0) is reached.  The vocid is appended to the word when
searching that vocabulary.  Only one symbol within a vocabulary may be
active (unsmudged) at a time.  Smudged words are ignored.  The same symbol
may be active within more than one vocabulary.

 returns
       ( cfa -1 ) found normal word
       ( cfa 1 ) found immediate word
       ( name 0 ) not in dictionary

```
: find ( name -- xfa flag )
    dup bloom# >bit bloom + cbit@
    if
        >r  vstack
 ( vstack ; name )
        begin
            c@+ r@ over
 ( vptr vocid name vocid ; name )
            (vfind)
 ( vptr vocid nfa xfa found? ; name )
            ?dup
            if
                rdrop 2>r 3drop 2r> exit
            then
            2drop 0=
        until
        drop r>
    then
    false ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_find
    jsr enter
    .word dup
    .word bloomhash
    .word tobit
    .word bloom
    .word plus
    .word cbitfetch
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(find04-*+1)
    .word tor
    .word vstack
find01
    .word cfetchplus
    .word rfetch
    .word over
    .word _pvfind
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(find03-*+1)
    .word rdrop
    .word twotor
    .word threedrop
    .word tworfrom
    .word exit
find03
    .word twodrop
    .word zeq
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(find01-*+1)
    .word drop
    .word rfrom
find04
    .word false
    .word exit

```







!! FLIPSCR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|CLRSCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$76e6&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;40&nbsp;[[>>|WRAP]]



 invert the entire screen



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
flipscr
    ldy #0
flipscr01
    lda VIDRAM,y            ; [4]
    eor #$80                ; [2]
    sta VIDRAM,y            ; [5]
    lda VIDRAM+$100,y
    eor #$80
    sta VIDRAM+$100,y
    lda VIDRAM+$200,y
    eor #$80
    sta VIDRAM+$200,y
    lda VIDRAM+$300,y
    eor #$80
    sta VIDRAM+$300,y
    iny                     ; [2]
    bne flipscr01           ; [3] 49 * 256 = 12544 clocks
    jmp next

```







!! FORGET&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|REHASH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6cf2&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;23&nbsp;[[>>|Error messages]]


checks FENCE, moves DP, sorts symbol table

```
: forget   ( "name" -- )
    '  dup  fence @  u<  7 ?error
    (rehash) ;

no FORGET

-rw-r--r-- 1 chitselb chitselb 6189 Jun  5 22:07 ./tmp/pettil-core.obj
-rw-r--r-- 1 chitselb chitselb 4027 Jun  5 22:07 ./tmp/pettil-tdict.obj
-rw-r--r-- 1 chitselb chitselb 2286 Jun  5 22:07 ./tmp/pettil.sym
-rw-r--r-- 1 chitselb chitselb 12502 Jun  5 22:07 ./tmp/pettil.obj


old FORGET

-rw-r--r-- 1 chitselb chitselb 6189 Jun  5 22:09 ./tmp/pettil-core.obj
-rw-r--r-- 1 chitselb chitselb 4650 Jun  5 22:09 ./tmp/pettil-tdict.obj
-rw-r--r-- 1 chitselb chitselb 2407 Jun  5 22:09 ./tmp/pettil.sym
-rw-r--r-- 1 chitselb chitselb 13246 Jun  5 22:09 ./tmp/pettil.obj

1254
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_forget
    jsr enter
    .word _tick
    .word dup
    .word fence
    .word fetch
    .word ult
    .word qerror
    .byt 7                      ; CAN'T FORGET BELOW FENCE
    .word _pforget
    .word exit

#print (*-_tosyms)
```







!! FORTH&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|VSTACK]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6882&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|DEFINITIONS]]


Reset the vocabulary order.  Equivalent to `ONLY FORTH` in ANS Forth


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_forth
    jsr enter
    .word vstack
    .word off
    .word exit

```







!! FORTY&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- 40 )

[[<<|EIGHTY]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0caf&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|BL]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
forty
    lda #40
    .byt $2c            ; BIT abs instruction
```







[[SP0]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[RP0]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[MEMSIZ]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SYMTAB]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SYMTAIL]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[STARTUP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SA#]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DRV#]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[FILENAME]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[VMBUF]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[#VMPKT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SCRPKT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[EDITING]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[TDICT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[BASE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DPL]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[HLD]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[BLK]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SCR]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[LIN]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[@LIN]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[#LIN]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[>IN]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SPAN]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[#TIB]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[#OUT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[#LINE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[WARNING]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[EXECUTE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SP!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[HEX]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DECIMAL]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[RP!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[?EXIT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[?STACK]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[4DROP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[3DROP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[I]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[C!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2DROP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DROP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SP@]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[C@]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[@]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[R@]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[J]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[CALLER]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[FAIL]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[UM*]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[UD/MOD]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[UM/MOD]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[AND]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[OR]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[XOR]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[NOT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2>R]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[>R]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DUP>R]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[RSWAP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[RDROP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[0>]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[3ERASE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[COFF]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[ON]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[OFF]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[+]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[ABS]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[NEGATE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[OVER]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SWAP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[TUCK]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[-ROT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[NIP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[?DUP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DUP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[+!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[TOGGLE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[COUNT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[C@+]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[@+]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[CBIT!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[CBIT@]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[TIB]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[-3]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[-2]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[9]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[8]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[7]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[6]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[EIGHTY]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[FORTY]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[BL]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[5]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[4]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[3]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[1]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[-1]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[TRUE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[0]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[FALSE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[0=]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[0<]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[0<>]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[1-]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[3-]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2-]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2+]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[3+]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2/]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2*]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[-]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[<>]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[=]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[U<]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[<]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[>]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[ROT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[THIRD]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[3DUP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[UNDER]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[+UNDER]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[3C@]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[3C!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[FILL]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[ERASE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[BLANK]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[-NULLS]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[-TRAILING]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[CMOVE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[CMOVE>]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[MOVE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[+MOVE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[HERE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[PAD]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[S>D]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[SGN]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[RANDU]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[RND]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[RANDOM]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[1+!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[1-!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[MIN]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[MAX]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[M*]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[M*/]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[*]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[/MOD]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[/]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[MOD]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[*/MOD]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[*/]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[PICK]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[ROLL]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[R>]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[R2D2]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DEPTH]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[>BIT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[$!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[!+]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[C!+]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[1+]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[BETWEEN?]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[D+]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[D<]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DNEGATE]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DABS]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2DUP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2OVER]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2ROT]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2SWAP]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[2!]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[D-]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[D0=]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[D=]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[DU<]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[D2/]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; [[D2*]] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 






!! H.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( c -- )

[[<<|.S]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$751d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;29&nbsp;[[>>|4H.]]


Prints out a number as an unsigned hexadecimal byte
```
: h.   ( c -- )
    base @ hex swap
    0 <# # # #> type
    base ! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_hdot
    jsr enter
    .word base
    .word fetch
    .word hex
    .word swap
    .word zero
    .word _ltsharp
    .word _sharp
    .word _sharp
    .word _sharpgt
    .word type
    .word base
    .word store
    .word exit

```

!! HERE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|+MOVE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0ed5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|PAD]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
here
    lda uarea+userdp-userarea
    ldy uarea+userdp-userarea+1
    jmp pushya

```







!! //HERELSB//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- c )

[[<<|ABORT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7036&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|ALLOT]]


 Returns the least significant byte of DP


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
herelsb
    lda uarea+userdp-userarea
    jmp push0a

```







!! HEX&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|SP!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07ff&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|DECIMAL]]


Sets the system number base to hexadecimal


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
hex
    lda #$10
    .byt $2c            ; BIT addr to skip next two bytes
    ; fall through
```







!! HLD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|DPL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0731&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|BLK]]


!!!User variable


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
hld
    jsr uservar
    .byt userhld-userarea

```







!! HOLD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( char -- )

[[<<|DIGIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$136f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|NUMBER]]




 Inserts  character into a pictured numeric out-
 put string.
 char is inserted into a pictured numeric output
 string.  Typically used between  <#  and  #> .


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_hold
    jsr enter
    .word minusone
    .word hld
    .word plusstore
    .word hld
    .word fetch
    .word cstore
    .word exit

```







!! //HOT//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|COLD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1b16&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;76&nbsp;[[>>|bannermsg]]


[[COLD]] does enough to kickstart Forth, then HOT is next.

* sets [[TDICT]] and [[SYMTAB]] user variables
* copy the transient dictionary to [[TDICT]]
* copy the symbols to [[SYMTAB]]+32
* [[EMPTYBUFFERS]]
* execute [[LAUNCH]] (first word at the first address in [[TDICT]])


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_hot
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word there
    .word dup
    .word four
    .word plusunder
    .word fetch
    .word twoplus
    .word dup
    .word tdict
    .word store
    .word dup
    .word plit
    .word 4096
    .word minus
    .word symtab
    .word store
    .word over
    .word twominus
    .word fetch
    .word third
    .word over
    .word plus
    .word symtab
    .word fetch
    .word bl
    .word plus
#include "page3.i65"
    .word clit
    .byt EAL
    .word fetch
    .word third
    .word minus
    .word cmove
    .word cmove
    .word _emptybuffers
    .word tdict
    .word fetch
    .word execute               ; launch

```







!! I&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- index )

[[<<|3DROP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$099a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|PUSHYA]]


Push the inner loop index of a DO LOOP to the stack


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
i
    ldy zi+1
    lda zi
    ; fall through
```







!! ID.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- )

[[<<|-->]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$75b8&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|ID.L]]


Displays the name of a word

```
: id.   ( nfa -- )
    1+ dup 1- nfalen type ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_iddot
    jsr enter
    .word oneplus

    .word oneminus

    .word exit

!! //ID.L//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa w -- )

!! //inctos//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- n+1 )

!! INFO&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|WORDS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7637&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;165&nbsp;[[>>|CLRSCR]]


Displays info on various editor and memory system variables

```
: info   ( -- )
    info05 c@ 0
    do
        i ?: 6spaces next
        i 2* 1+ info05 + @ dup
        >name.l10 execute
        @ 4h.
    loop
    cr ['] vstack >name id. 3 spaces
    vstack 10 0
    do
        c@+ space h.
    loop
    drop cr 
    ['] filename >name.l10
    filename @ dup 4h. space dup c@ h.
    space $. cr 
    ['] startup >name.l10
    startup @ >name.l10 ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_info
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word info05
    .word cfetch
    .word zero
    .word pdo
    .byt <(info02-*+1)
info01
    .word i
    .word pquerycolon
    .word _sixspaces
    .word next
    .word i
    .word twostar
    .word oneplus
    .word plit
    .word info05
    .word plus
    .word fetch
    .word dup
    .word _tonamedotl10
    .word execute
    .word fetch
    .word _fourhdot
    .word ploop
    .byt <(info01-*+1)
info02
    .word cr
    .word plit
    .word vstack
    .word _toname
    .word _iddot
    .word three
    .word _spaces
    .word vstack
#include "page3.i65"
    .word clit
    .byt 10
    .word zero
    .word pdo
    .byt <(info04-*+1)
info03
    .word cfetchplus
    .word _space
    .word _hdot
    .word ploop
    .byt <(info03-*+1)
info04
    .word drop
    .word cr
    .word plit
    .word filename
    .word _tonamedotl10
    .word filename
    .word fetch
    .word dup
    .word _fourhdot
    .word _space
    .word dup
    .word cfetch
    .word _hdot
    .word _space
    .word _stringdot
    .word cr
    .word plit
    .word startup
    .word _tonamedotl10
    .word startup
    .word fetch
    .word _tonamedotl10
    .word exit

info05
    .byt (info06-info05-1)/2
    .word base
    .word numvmpkt
    .word scr
    .word blk
    .word editing
    .word scrpkt
    .word dp
    .word vmbuf
    .word symtab
    .word symnew
    .word symtail
    .word tdict
    .word tdp
    .word memsiz
    .word numvoc
    .word current
    .word drvnum
    .word sanum
info06
```







`NEXT ENTER EXIT EXECUTE`

Here are the classical implementation of both the 
[[direct-threaded|http://www.forthfreak.net/index.cgi?DirectThreadedCodePseudoCode]] 
and [[indirect-threaded|http://www.forthfreak.net/index.cgi?IndirectThreadedCodePseudoCode]] 
inner interpreter.

```
Direct                         Indirect
NEXT:                          NEXT:
    [IP]+ -> W                     [IP+] -> W
    W+    -> PC                    [W]+  -> PC

NEST:                          NEST:
    IP    -> -[RP]                 IP    -> -[RP]
    W     -> IP                    W     -> IP
    NEXT                           NEXT

UNNEST:                        UNNEST:
    [RP]+ -> IP                    [RP]+ -> IP
    NEXT                           NEXT
```

PETTIL takes a few left turns from the classic indirect-threaded model, but it 
runs fast. Props to M. Anton Ertl on comp.lang.forth for the design idea and 
to others on the Forth board at [[6502.org|http://forum.6502.org/viewforum.php?f=9]] for tweaks.  
After reading Brad Rodriguez' excellent 
[["Moving Forth"|http://www.bradrodriguez.com/papers/moving1.htm]] paper, I 
chose the direct-threaded model for PETTIL, due to its greater efficiency and  
for its novelty.

NEXT is the heart and soul of a Forth interpreter.  It executes more than any 
other routine, so let's optimize.

```
classic                        pettil
NEXT:                          NEXT:
    [IP]+ -> W                     +IP
    W+    -> PC                    [IP]   -> PC
```
15 cycles.  Not bad.  You might have some questions.

''Q'' Where did "W" go?  

''A'' When Obama took office, W retired and moved back to Texas.  In this 
implementation of NEXT, the W exists only in a fleeting and transient way 
on the 6502 address buss during the indirect JMP.  Or somewhere.  But it's 
not in the code. There actually is a W in the code, but I called it `W1` to 
conserve my sanity.  Have you ever tried googling the letter "E"?  Take a 
look inside the code at  the word [[EXECUTE]] to see where I needed it.  

''Q'' What about paging?

''A'' In 6502-land, a page is 256 bytes of memory and there are 256 of them 
in the 16-bit (64K) address space.  The bottom two pages are special, the 
zero page and the stack page.  Unless all your code fits inside 256 bytes, 
at some point it will be necesary for the instruction pointer (IP) to cross 
a page boundary.  PETTIL does "paging by hand."  The compiler is responsible 
to insert a call to the paging primitive at the top of each page of memory.  
It takes a few clock cycles but they aren't spent every time through NEXT.  
This technique increases compiler complexity.

[[The elephant in the room|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elephant_in_the_room]]
 is the [[JMP ($xxFF) bug|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MOS_Technology_6502#Bugs_and_quirks]]

Here's more detail on code paging in PETTIL

''1) A very short, very fast NEXT that works within the confines of a page''

```
next
    inc ip                  ; 5
    inc ip                  ; 5
;ip = *+1
    jmp ($cafe)             ; 5

                            ;15 cycles total
```

''2) code for IP to cross a page boundary ("paging by hand" strategy)''

```
pad
    clc                     ; pass A = offset added to IP
    adc ip
    bcs pagen               ; check for page boundary crossing
    cmp #$ff
    bne pado                ; check for xxFF at end of page
page
    lda #0
pagen
    inc ip+1                ; cross the page
pado
    sta ip
    jmp nexto
```

''3) The compiler must ensure that a word within a colon definition never straddles a page boundary''

Within the compiler, instead of `,` (the Forth word "comma"),  PETTIL uses the words 

`,XT` (which could be pronounced either "comma-~X-T" or "compile execution token") to insert page-aligned tokens

`,CFA` (pronounced "comma-~C-F-A" or "compile code field address") which lays down a page-aligned three-byte JSR call at the start of a word.







!! //INSTR,//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( [ operand ... ] opcode 0|1|2|3 -- )

[[<<|docpu]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7b51&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|DECODE]]


encloses the instruction and 0, 1 or 2 bytes of operand


```
 : instr,
    0 do
        c,
    loop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_instrcomma
    jsr enter
    .word zero
    .word pdo
    .byt <(instrcomma02-*+1)
instrcomma01
    .word _ccomma
    .word ploop
    .byt <(instrcomma01-*+1)
instrcomma02
    .word asmmem
    .word exit

```







!! INTERPRET&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|?CHAR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6f9a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;81&nbsp;[[>>|QUERY]]


The Forth interpreter loop

consistent eager-loaded approach
TIB source comes already loaded from QUIT
BLK source comes already loaded from BLOCK
SCR source will eager-load each line from the block buffer, already loaded by BLOCK

```
create jumptable  next ,   dlit ,  drop ,  droplit ,
                \ double  double,  single    single,
: interpret   ( -- )
    begin
        ?stack                  \ make sure things are okay
        bl word   ( addr )      \ eager-load for screens is done by SOURCE
        dup c@    ( addr len )  \ WORD returns zero-length when SOURCE is exhausted
    while
        find ?dup
        if        ( cfa findflag )
            \               find -1    find +1
            \             ____________________
            \ state -1   | compile     execute
            \ state 0    | execute     execute
            state @ <>  ?: execute ,xt
        else      ( here )
            number
            jumptable  dpl @ 0< 2*  state @ + 2* -
            @ execute
        then
    repeat
    drop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_interpret
    jsr enter
interpret01
    .word qstack
    .word bl
    .word _word
    .word dup
    .word cfetch
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(interpret04-*+1)
    .word _find
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(interpret02-*+1)
    .word state
    .word fetch
    .word ne
    .word pquerycolon
    .word execute
    .word _xtcomma
    .word branch
    .byt <(interpret03-*+1)
interpret02
    .word _number
    .word plit
    .word interpret06           ; case table
    .word dpl
    .word fetch
    .word zlt
    .word twostar
    .word state
    .word fetch
    .word plus
    .word twostar
    .word minus
    .word fetch
    .word execute
interpret03
    .word branch
    .byt <(interpret01-*+1)
interpret04
    .word drop
    .word exit

interpret06
    .word next
    .word _dlit
    .word drop
    .word _droplit

```

!! //IRQ toggle//

[[<<|Sweet16 toggle]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$079a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|locals10]]


Toggle the IRQ vector between two targets based on an XOR constant


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
toggleirq
    sei
    ldy #2
toggleirq01
    lda tos-1,y
    eor CINV-1,y
    sta CINV-1,y
    dey
    bne toggleirq01
    cli
    rts

```







!! IRQ^&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( eormask -- )

[[<<|EXPECT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$12f0&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|SPACE]]

```
irqcaret
    jsr toggleirq
    jmp drop

```







!! ISSCR?&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- flag )

[[<<|EDITING?]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1644&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|PKT+]]


Retrieves the [[SCRPKT]] user variable, which describes whether the current
packet type is screen (true) or data (false)

```
: isscr?   ( -- flag )
    scrpkt @ ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
isscrq
    lda uarea+userscrpkt-userarea
    ldy uarea+userscrpkt-userarea+1
    jmp pushya

```







!! J&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- index )

[[<<|R@]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0a16&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|CALLER]]


Push the outer loop index of a DO LOOP to the stack (alias for [[R@]])


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
j
    stx z       ; [3]
    tsx         ; [2]
    ldy $0102,x ; [4]
    lda $0101,x ; [4]
    ldx z       ; [3]
    jmp pushya ; [14|15]

```

!! JIFFY@&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- d )

[[<<|?PAUSE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$19eb&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|JIFFIES]]


The number of jiffies since powerup or midnight as a double

```
: jiffy@   ( -- TIME.hi TIME.lo )
    !irq [ TIME ] cliteral 3c@ !irq ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
jiffyfetch
    sei
    lda TIME+1
    pha
    lda TIME+2
    pha
    lda #0
    pha
    lda TIME
    pha
    cli
    jmp tworfrom

```

key
    stx z

!! LATEST&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- nfa )

[[<<|VARIABLE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$71f3&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|$,]]


Leaves the name field address of the top-most word in the
symbol table.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_latest
    jsr enter
    .word newest
    .word fetch
    .word exit

```







!! //LAUNCH//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|bannermsg]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6800&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;41&nbsp;[[>>|USER]]


This word must be the very first thing in the transient
dictionary.  pettil-core has no knowledge of anything in this
upper section, so LAUNCH must establish the linkage between
the two dictionaries.  It does this by running FORGET to
discard the word [[COLD]] which rebuilds the symbol table

```
: launch   ( -- )
   [ errptr ] literal   warning !
   1 #voc !
   [ endofile ] literal  tdp !
   [ ' abort ] literal  startup !
   [ ' cold ] (forget)  abort ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
launch
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word errptr                ; We got here from COLD. Do the things
    .word warning               ; input stream for the next word, because
    .word store
    .word one
    .word numvoc
    .word store
    .word plit
    .word endofile              ; end of transient dictionary
    .word tdp
    .word store
    .word plit
    .word _abort
    .word startup
    .word store
    .word plit
    .word cold
    .word _pforget
    .word _abort

```







!! LDA,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|EOR,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d65&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|ORA,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a LDA opcode

    .byt $a0
    .word $1c6e

!! LEAVE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|+LOOP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7452&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|?LEAVE]]



```
' unloop -3 control leave ]
    +/-pairs xt, ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_leave
    jsr docontrol
    .word unloop
    .byt <(-3)
    .word plusminuspairs
    .word drop
    .word _xtcomma
    .word exit

```







!! LIN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|SCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$073d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|@LIN]]


!!!User variable
Used by INTERPRET to keep track of the current line of the
current BLK being interpreted.  LIN starts at 0 and increments
by 1 or 2 according to the linewrap bits, until it exceeds 24.
At that point (going off the bottom of the screen), LIN is set
to -1


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
lin
    jsr uservar
    .byt userlin-userarea

```







!! //LINEINFO//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( logline -- addr 40|80 )

[[<<|WRAPROLL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7794&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;33&nbsp;[[>>|LOGLINE]]



Returns the start address and length of the logical line.
 `logline` is a physical screen line that is assumed to
 point to the upper physical line if the line is 80 columns.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
lineinfo
    stx z
    ldx tos
    lda WRAPLO,x
    sta tos
    lda LDTB1,x
    sta tos+1
    lda #40
    cpx #24
    beq lineinfo01
    ldy LDTB1+1,x
    bmi lineinfo01
    asl                     ; 80 char
lineinfo01
    ldx z
    jmp push0a

lineinfob
    stx z
    ldx tos

```







!!Physical lines
The 40-column PET's video memory from $8000-$83E7 is 1000 bytes arranged in 25 
physical lines of 40 columns each.

!!Logical lines
Linewrap is stored in the [[msb|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Most_significant_bit]] 
of the 25-byte table from $E0-$F8. Each byte in this table is mapped to a physical 
line on the screen.   The two [[lsb|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Least_significant_bit]] 
bits in this table indicate which memory page ($80xx-$83xx) the left column of each 
physical line resides in.  Low-order bytes of left-column screen addresses are in
ROM at SCRLINLO ($~E65B on my BASIC 4.0 ROM PET)

* A "1" value signifies a "start" line of a logical line that is either 40 or 80 columns.  
* A "0" value signifies a "continuation" line of an 80-column logical line.
* More than one continuation line is an invalid condition
* The first physical line (0) is always a start line

!!Editor implementation notes
PETTIL distinguishes between "screen" and "data" blocks.  A screen block consists 
of 1000 bytes of screen codes and 24 bits of associated linewrap information.

The editor keeps track of linewrap when lines are appended to the paste buffer,
when the buffer is pasted back to the screen, and when screens are packed and
unpacked to/from the packet buffer.  Two variables, `WRAP` and `PWRAP` hold double
values of linewrap bits for the screen and paste buffer, respectively.








!! LIST&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( scr -- )

[[<<|EDIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7aa9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|L]]


List the specified screen and set [[SCR]]


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_list
    jsr enter
    .word editing
    .word on
    .word _block
    .word editing
    .word off
    .word exit

```







!! LITERAL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n == ) ( -- n )

[[<<|DROPLIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7337&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;31&nbsp;[[>>|DLIT]]


Enclose `n` into the dictionary.  At runtime, leaves `n` on the
stack.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_literal
    jsr enter
literal00
    .word dup
    .word plit
    .word 256
    .word ult
#include "page3.i65"
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(literal01-*+1)
    .word _compile
    .word clit
    .word _ccomma
#include "page3.i65"
    .word branch
    .byt <(literal02-*+1)
literal01
    .word _compile
    .word plit
    .word _comma
literal02
    .word exit

```







!! LOAD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( u -- )

[[<<|DLIT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7361&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;40&nbsp;[[>>|SAVE-FORTH]]



 The contents of >IN and BLK , which locate the current input
 stream, are saved.  The input stream is then redirected to
 the beginning of screen u by setting >IN to zero and BLK to
 u.  The screen is then interpreted.  If interpretation from
 screen u is not terminated explicitly it will be terminated
 when the input stream is exhausted and then the contents of
 >IN and BLK will be restored.  An error condition exists if
 u is zero.  See  >IN  BLK  BLOCK

```
: load   ( scr -- )
    ?dup
    if
        blk @  >in @ 2>r
        blk !  source! interpret
        r> >in !  r> blk !  source!
    then ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_load
    jsr enter
    .word qdup
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(load01-*+1)
    .word blk
    .word fetch
    .word toin
    .word fetch
    .word twotor
    .word blk
    .word store
    .word _sourcestore
    .word _interpret
    .word tworfrom
    .word toin
    .word store
    .word blk
    .word store
    .word _sourcestore
load01
    .word exit

```







!! LOAD-BUFFERS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|(LOADVERIFY)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$181a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|VERIFY-BUFFERS]]


Load a batch of packets from the file to [[VMBUF]]

called by STOP-L in the editor

```
: load-buffers   ( -- )
    0 (loadverify) ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_loadbuffers
    jsr enter
    .word zero              ; LOAD
    .word _ploadverify
    .word exit

```







!! LOCALS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|PUSHYA]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7b0d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;5&nbsp;[[>>|ASMINDEX]]


!!!Assembler constant
Address of LOCALS routine


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
asmlocals
    jsr doconst
    .word locals

```







!! //locals//

[[<<|locals2]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07b9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;16&nbsp;[[>>|tos2minus]]


Pops cells from the split stack to N area, working backwards.
Used for setting up primitives that consume multiple arguments

Input

* Y = how many words *2 to pop from the stack

Returns

* Y = 0
* TOS unchanged
* Z flag set
* C flag unchanged

|^Y|R1<br>TOS|R2<br>N0|R3<br>N1|R4<br>N2|R5<br>N3|R6<br>N4|R7<br>N5|R8<br>N6|R9<br>N7|R10<br>N8|h
|1|TOS|2OS|||||||||
|2|TOS|3OS|2OS||||||||
|3|TOS|4OS|3OS|2OS|||||||
|4|TOS|5OS|4OS|3OS|2OS||||||
|5|TOS|6OS|5OS|4OS|3OS|2OS|||||
|6|TOS|7OS|6OS|5OS|4OS|3OS|2OS||||
|7|TOS|8OS|7OS|6OS|5OS|4OS|3OS|2OS|||
|8|TOS|9OS|8OS|7OS|6OS|5OS|4OS|3OS|2OS||
|9|TOS|10OS|9OS|8OS|7OS|6OS|5OS|4OS|3OS|2OS|
|>|>|>|>|>|>|>| stack area and N area order is inverted |<|<|<|f


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
locals
    lda stackh,x        ; [4]
    dey                 ; [2]
    sta n,y             ; [5]
    lda stackl,x        ; [4]
    inx                 ; [2]
    dey                 ; [2]
    sta n,y             ; [5]
    bne locals          ; [3]
                        ; [-1] on last iteration
    rts                 ; [6]               [17]+[27y]

```







!! //locals10//

[[<<|IRQ toggle]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07ab&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|locals8]]


Sets up five locals in the N area



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
locals10
    ldy #10
    .byt $2c                ; BIT abs instruction
    ; fall through
```







!! //locals2//

[[<<|locals4]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07b7&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;2&nbsp;[[>>|locals]]


Sets up one local in the N area



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
locals2
    ldy #2
    ; fall through
```







!! //locals4//

[[<<|locals6]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07b4&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|locals2]]


Sets up two locals in the N area



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
locals4
    ldy #4
    .byt $2c                ; BIT abs instruction
    ; fall through
```







!! //locals6//

[[<<|locals8]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07b1&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|locals4]]


Sets up three locals in the N area



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
locals6
    ldy #6
    .byt $2c                ; BIT abs instruction
    ; fall through
```







!! //locals8//

[[<<|locals10]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$07ae&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|locals6]]


Sets up four locals in the N area

```

    ldy #8
