```







!! //LOGLINE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- logline )

[[<<|LINEINFO]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$77b5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;16&nbsp;[[>>|LOGLINE+]]


 Returns the physical line number of the logical line where the
 PET cursor is currently located.  The `logline` value returned
 is the first/top/upper line if the logical line has 80 characters.

 From this position, [[leapfrogging forward|LOGLINE+]] down the
 screen will always return logical line addresses (with
 wraptable bit7 set), never continuation lines.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
logline
    stx z
    ldx TBLX        ; $d8 = Current Cursor Physical Line Number
    inx
logline01
    dex
    ldy LDTB1,x     ; $e0 = 25-byte screen wrap table
    bpl logline01
    txa
    ldx z
    jmp push0a

```







!! //LOGLINE+//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( logline -- logline+|0 )

[[<<|LOGLINE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$77c5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;23&nbsp;[[>>|EDITCOPY]]



 Return the next logical line number or 0 after bottom of screen

!!!pronounced "log-line-plus"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
loglineplus
    stx z
    lda #0
    ldx tos
loglineplus01
    cpx #24
    beq loglineplus02
    inx
    ldy LDTB1,x
    bpl loglineplus01
    txa
loglineplus02
    ldy #0
    ldx z
    jmp put

```







!! LOOP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( == ) ( -- )

[[<<|?DO]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$743a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|+LOOP]]



Immediate word, compiles runtime code to terminate a loop that
counts up by 1.  The loop index and limit are treated as
unsigned, e.g. `0 0 DO LOOP` will iterate 65536 times.  This
is distinct from [[+LOOP]] which treats the loop index/limit
both as signed integers.

```
' (loop) -3 control loop ]
    ?<resolve ?>resolve ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_loop
    jsr docontrol
    .word ploop
    .byt <(-3)
    .word _qfromresolve
    .word _qtoresolve
    .word exit

```







!! LSB&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( u -- c )

[[<<|MSB]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$197a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|VIDRAM]]


Returns the low byte of a cell


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
lsb
    lda #0
    sta tos+1
    jmp next

```







!! LSR,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|INC,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d8f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|ROL,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a LSR opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
ilsr
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $41
    .word $0d0d

```







!! M*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- d )

[[<<|MAX]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0f78&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;67&nbsp;[[>>|M*/]]



 multiply two signed words, leaving the double product on the stack


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
mstar
    jsr mult
    jmp next
mult
    lda stackl,x
    sta n+4
    lda stackh,x
    sta n+5
    eor tos+1
    php                     ; we only care about the sign bit
    bit tos+1
    bpl mult01
    jsr donegate
mult01
    bit n+5
    bpl mult02
    sec
    lda #0
    sbc n+4
    sta n+4
    lda #0
    sbc n+5
    sta n+5
mult02
    jsr multiply
    lda n+1
    sta stackh,x
    lda n
    sta stackl,x
    lda n+3
    sta tos+1
    lda n+2
    sta tos
    plp
    bpl mult03
    jmp dodnegate
mult03
    rts

```







!! M*/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 n3 -- d )

[[<<|M*]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0fbb&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;0&nbsp;[[>>|*]]



 multiplies n1*n2 giving an intermediate 16-bit value, and divides
 that by n3 yielding a 16-bit quotient.  Remainder is ignored,
 all values are signed.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
mstarslash

```







!! //M/CPU//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|DECODE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7bad&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|BEGIN,]]


Adjusts the addressing mode
determines the instruction
encloses the instruction and 0, 1 or 2 bytes of operand

```
: m/cpu  create c, , does>
    dup 1+ @ 80 and
    if
        10 mode +!
    then
    over
    ff00 and upmode upmode
    if
        mem cr latest id.
        abort" has incorrect address mode"
    then
    c@ mode c@
    index + c@ + c,  mode c@ 7 and
    if
        mode c@
        0f and 7 <
        if
            c,
        else
            ,
        then
    then
    mem ;

: m/cpu  create c, , does>
    2r> >r  decode  instr, ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_domcpu
    jsr enter
    .word _caller
    .word decode
    .word _instrcomma
    .word exit

```







!! MAX&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n )

[[<<|MIN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0f68&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;16&nbsp;[[>>|M*]]






<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_max
    jsr enter
    .word twodup
    .word lt
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(max01-*+1)
    .word swap
max01
    .word drop
    .word exit

```







!! MEM&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|#]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7cd1&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|,X]]


!!!Assembler mode
Memory addressing mode (absolute or zeropage)


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
asmmem
    jsr _doasmmode
    .byt 2

```







!! MEMSIZ&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|DP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$06f9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|SYMTAB]]


!!!User variable
Top of RAM, initialized at COLD from BASIC zero page variable at $34
This variable may be adjusted, e.g. to allocate a contiguous block of
memory at the top of RAM


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
memsiz
    jsr uservar
    .byt usermemsiz-userarea

```







!! //METHOD//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- )

[[<<|+/-PAIRS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$73d5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|CONTROL]]


Execute Forth code beginning at `addr`. Used by [[DOES>]] to return
control to the child word.

In the example below, when [[METHOD]] executes the address following 
`word` will be on the stack               

```
e.g. 
: maker   ( word char -- )
<builds
    , c,
does>
    @+ swap c@+ swap method ;

41 2000 maker foo
    ] + . ;
42 1492 maker bar
    ] - . ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_method
    jsr enter
    .word rdrop
    .word twominus          ; this won't fix $xxFF page boundary bugs
    .word tor
    .word exit

```







!! MIN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n )

[[<<|1-!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0f59&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|MAX]]


Returns the lesser of the two arguments

```
: min   ( n1 n2 -- n )
    2dup >  ?: nip drop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_min
    jsr enter
    .word twodup
    .word gt
    .word pquerycolon
    .word nip
    .word drop
    .word exit

```







!! MKPKTS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- )

[[<<|RLE+]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1699&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;58&nbsp;[[>>|?MKPKTS]]


concatenates `n+1` new packets at the tail of the [[VMBUF]] area

```
: mkpkts   ( n -- )
    begin
        #vmkpkt 1+!  vmbuf @  editing?
        if
            dup>r 5 pkt+ dup on 1+ on vidram r> +!
        else
            2 pkt+ drop
        then
        1- 0<
    until drop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_mkpkts
    jsr enter
mkpkts01
    .word numvmpkt
    .word oneplusstore
    .word vmbuf
    .word fetch
    .word editingq
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(mkpkts02-*+1)
    .word duptor
    .word five
    .word _pktplus
    .word dup
    .word on
    .word oneplus
    .word on
    .word vidram
    .word rfrom
    .word plusstore
    .word branch
    .byt <(mkpkts03-*+1)
mkpkts02
    .word two
    .word _pktplus
    .word drop
mkpkts03
    .word oneminus
    .word dup
    .word zlt
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(mkpkts01-*+1)
    .word drop
    .word exit

```







!! MOD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n3 )

[[<<|/]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0fd8&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|*/MOD]]



 n3 is the remainder after dividing n1 by the
 divisor n2.  n3 has the same sign as n2 or is
 zero.  An error condition results if the
 divisor is zero or if the quotient falls out-
 side the range {32,768...32,768}.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
mod
    jsr doslashmod
    jmp drop

```







!! //MODE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|ASMINDEX]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7b32&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;5&nbsp;[[>>|doasmmode]]


!!!Assembler variable
Current addressing mode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
asmmode
    jsr docreate
    .word 2                 ; variable mode  2 mode !

```







!! MON&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|VIDRAM]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1986&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|XYZZY]]


Restores BASIC zero page and exits to the TIM monitor


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
mon
    jsr aloha      ; restore BASIC zpage
    brk
    jsr aloha      ; restore BASIC zpage

```







!! MOVE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( from to howmany -- )

[[<<|CMOVE>]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0e9f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;21&nbsp;[[>>|+MOVE]]


 Move the `howmany` bytes beginning at `from` to
 `to`.  Designed to prevent clobber if both memory regions
 overlap.

```
: move   ( from to howmany -- )
     >r 2dup u< r> swap
     ?: cmove> cmove ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_move
    jsr enter
    .word tor
    .word twodup
    .word ult
    .word rfrom
    .word swap
    .word pquerycolon
    .word cmovegt
    .word cmove
    .word exit

```







!! MSB&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( u -- c )

[[<<|UPDATE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1973&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|LSB]]


Returns the high byte of a cell


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
msb
    lda tos+1
put0a
    ldy #0
    jmp put

```







!! N&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|IP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7ae5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|TOS]]


!!!Assembler constant
N area, a scratch space for primitives

```
4 cconstant n
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
asmn
    jsr docconst
    .byt <n

```







!! NAME>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- cfa )

[[<<|>NAME]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$69b5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|(SEEK)]]


Returns the Code Field Address (`cfa`) of the provided Name
Field Address (`nfa`)

```
: name>   ( nfa -- cfa )
    2- @ ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
namefrom
    jsr tos2minus
namefrom01
    jmp fetch

```







!! NEGATE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- -n )

[[<<|ABS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0bcf&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;20&nbsp;[[>>|OVER]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
negate
    lda #>(next-1)
    pha
    lda #<(next-1)
    pha
donegate
    sec
neg2
    lda #0
    sbc tos
    sta tos
    lda #0
    sbc tos+1
    sta tos+1
    rts

```







!! NEWDP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|CSP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$685c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|(SOURCE)]]


!!!User variable
Used by REHASH to store the CFA (if invoked by FORGET)
or HERE (if REHASH is invoked standalone).  Determines
which ancestors to reawaken.  Used to set DP after REHASH

!!!pronounced: "new-d-p"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
newdp
    jsr uservar
    .byt usernewdp-userarea

```







!! NEWEST&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|#VOC]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$684c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|REDEFINED]]


!!!User variable
User variable containing the address (NFA) of the most recently
created symbol.  Used by LATEST


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
newest
    jsr uservar
    .byt usernewest-userarea

```







!! NEXT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n )

[[<<|STACKH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7af5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|POP]]


!!!Assembler constant
Address of NEXT routine

```
86 cconstant next
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
asmnext
    jsr docconst
    .byt <next

```







!! NEXT>R&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- R; next-1 )

[[<<|RLDECODE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$15da&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|PKT.SIZE]]


Pushes the address `next-1` to the return stack so invoking
a subroutine afterward will `rts` to `next`.  Effectively
converts a subroutine to a Forth primitive.

pronounced: "next to R""

```
: next>r   ( -- R; next-1 )
    [ 'next 1- ] cliteral r> 2>r ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_nexttor
    jsr enter
    .word clit
    .byt <(next-1)
    .word rfrom
    .word twotor
    .word exit

```







!! //NEXTPAGE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|CFA,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$706a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;25&nbsp;[[>>|PAGEMARGIN]]


Moves [[DP]] to the next page if needed, to preserve page alignment

```
: nextpage   ( -- )
    ['] page here !
    $100 herelsb - dp +! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_nextpage
    jsr enter
    .word plit
    .word page
    .word here
    .word store
    .word plit
    .word $100
    .word herelsb
    .word minus
    .word dp
    .word plusstore
    .word exit

```







!! //NFA+//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- nfa+ )

[[<<|nfaplus01]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$68bd&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|symcomp]]


Chain to the next NFA on the list


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
nfaplus
    jsr nfaplus01
    jmp next

```







!! //NFALEN//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- length )

[[<<|NFALEN01]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$68a9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|nfaplus01]]


Return the length of the name


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
nfalen
    jsr nfalen01
    jmp put

```







!! //NFALEN01//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- nfa )

[[<<|DEFINITIONS]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6898&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|NFALEN]]


!!! Subroutine
Get the length of the symbol at TOS

|<br><i>inputs</i>|<|
|<b>TOS</b>|NFA|
|<br><i>returns</i>|<|
|<b>TOS</b>|unchanged|
|<b>N6</b>|flags/length byte|
|<b>A</b>|name length (without vocabid)|
|<b>Y</b>|always <b>0</b>|
|^<b>N</b>|<b>0</b> not smudged<br/><b>1</b> smudged|
|^<b>V</b>|<b>0</b> Forth<br/><b>1</b> Vocabulary|
|^<b>Z</b>|<b>0</b> not last<br/><b>1</b> end of list|
|^<b>C</b>|<b>0</b> Forth<br/><b>1</b> Vocabulary|


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
nfalen01
    ldy #0                      ;[2]
    lda (tos),y                 ;[5]
nfalen02
    sta n+12                    ;[3]
    and #$1f                    ;[2]
    sta n+13                    ;[3]
    bit n+12                    ;[3]
    clc                         ;[2]
    bvc nfalen03                ;[2/3]
    sec                         ;[2]
nfalen03
    rts                         ;[6]

```







!! //nfaplus01//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- nfa+ )

[[<<|NFALEN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$68af&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|NFA+]]


!!! Subroutine
Chain to the next NFA on the list

|<br><i>inputs</i>|<|
|<b>TOS</b>|NFA|
|<br><i>returns</i>|<|
|<b>TOS</b>|next NFA|
|<b>N6</b>|flags/length byte|
|<b>Y</b>|always <b>0</b>|
|<b>Z</b>|always <b>0</b>|


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
nfaplus01
    jsr nfalen01
    adc #3              ; +cfa +flags/length +vocid
    ;clc
    adc tos
    sta tos
    bcc nfaplus02
    inc tos+1
nfaplus02
    rts

```







!! NIP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n2 )

[[<<|-ROT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c21&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|?DUP]]


Remove the second item from the stack


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
nip
    inx
qdup01
    jmp next

```

inop

    .byt $ea

!! NOT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|REPEAT,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7c56&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|CS]]


```
: not   20 + ;  ( reverse assembly test )
```

```
_asmnot
    jsr enter
    .word bl
    .word plus
    .word exit

```







!! NUMBER&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- d )

[[<<|HOLD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1380&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;142&nbsp;[[>>|<#]]



 Convert the counted string at addr, to a signed
 32-bit integer, using the value of BASE .  If numeric
 conversion is not possible, an error condition exists.  The
 string may contain a preceding minus sign.

```
 \ There is a string that is probably a number stored from addrlow..addrhigh
 \ convert a counted string to a signed double, keeping track of the decimal
: number  ( addr -- d )
  ( addr )
     0 0 rot count
  ( 0 0 addr+1 len )
     over c@ [ ascii - ] literal  =
  ( 0 0 addr+1 len negative? )
     dup>r
  ( 0 0 addr+1 len negative? ) ( R; -- negative? )
     +
  ( 0 0 addr+1 lenadj ; adjust length for sign char )
     over + r@ -
  ( 0 0 addr+1 addrhigh+1 )
     swap  r@ -
  ( 0 0 addrhigh+1 addrlow )
     dpl on
     ?do
  ( d )
         base @ >r
  ( d ) ( R; base negative? )
         i c@  r@  digit
  ( -- d currdigit~?~ flag )
         if
             swap r@ um*
             drop rot
             r@ um* d+
             dpl @ 1+  0= negate dpl +!
         else
             i c@ [ ascii . ] literal  =
             dpl @ 0<  and
             if
                 dpl off
             else
                 3 fail ( abort" not found" )
             then
         then
         r> drop
  ( R; negative? ; discard base )
     loop
     r>  if  dnegate  then ;

```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_number
    jsr enter
    .word zero
    .word zero
    .word rot
    .word count
    .word over
    .word cfetch
    .word clit
    .byt '-'
    .word eq
    .word duptor
    .word plus
    .word over
    .word plus
    .word rfetch
    .word minus
    .word swap
    .word rfetch
    .word minus
    .word dpl
    .word on
#include "page3.i65"
    .word pqdo
    .byt <(number05-*+1)
number01
    .word base
    .word fetch
    .word tor
    .word i
    .word cfetch
    .word rfetch
    .word digit
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(number02-*+1)
    .word swap
    .word rfetch
    .word umstar
    .word drop
    .word rot
    .word rfetch
    .word umstar
    .word dplus
    .word dpl
    .word fetch
    .word zlt
    .word oneplus
    .word dpl
    .word plusstore
    .word branch
    .byt <(number04-*+1)
number02
    .word i
    .word cfetch
    .word clit
    .byt '.'
    .word eq
    .word dpl
    .word fetch
    .word zlt
    .word andx
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(number03-*+1)
    .word dpl
    .word off
    .word branch
    .byt <(number04-*+1)
number03
    .word three
    .word _fail
number04            ; then then
    .word rfrom
    .word drop
    .word ploop
    .byt <(number01-*+1)
number05
    .word rfrom
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(number07-*+1)
    .word dnegate
number07
    .word exit

```







!![[Dick Pountain paper on objects in Forth|www.forth.com/archive/jfar/vol3/no3/article3.pdf]]

!''class'' //%someclass//
!!an instance of //class//
||field||<|h
|00..02|^''CFA''|''jsr doclass''|<|
|^03..04|^''methods''|^for0 cfa of a method|method 0 always returns the address of this object's fields|
|05..06|~|for1 cfa|walkto|
|07..08|~|for2 cfa|flip|
|09..0a|~|for3 cfa|front|
|^0b<br/>.<br/>.<br/>.<br/>n|^''fields''|^variable length<br/>class fields<br/>|<|
!''//%someclass//'' //anobject//
!! an instance of //someclass//
||field||<|e.g.|h
|00..02|^''CFA''|''jsr'' //someclass//|<||
|^03<br/>.<br/>.<br/>.<br/>n|^''fields''|^variable length<br/>instance fields<br/>starting at `CFA`+3|<|^type<br/>beverage<br/>plan<br/>facing<br/>location|







!! OFF&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- )

[[<<|ON]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0bae&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|+]]


Store 0 word at `addr`


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
off
    ldy #1
off00
    lda #$00
off01
    sta (tos),y
    dey
    bpl off01
    jmp drop

```







!! ON&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr -- )

[[<<|COFF]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0ba8&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|OFF]]


Store -1 at `addr`


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
on
    ldy #1
    lda #$ff
    bne off01

```







!! OR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n1|n2 )

[[<<|AND]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0b43&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|XOR]]




<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
orx
    lda tos+1
    ora stackh,x
    tay
    lda tos
    ora stackl,x
    inx
    jmp put

```







!! ORA,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|LDA,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d6b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|SBC,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a ORA opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
iora
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $00
    .word $1c6e

```







!! OVER&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n1 n2 -- n1 n2 n1 )

[[<<|NEGATE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0be3&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|SWAP]]





<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
over
    ldy stackh,x
    lda stackl,x
    jmp pushya

```







!! P&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|N]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7acc&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|ASSEMBLER]]


List the specified screen and set [[SCR]]


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_p
    jsr enter
    .word scr
    .word oneminusstore
    .word exit
```







!! PAD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|HERE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0ede&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|S>D]]



 The lower address of a scratch area used to hold data for
 intermediate processing.  The address or contents of PAD may
 change and the data lost if the address of the next
 available dictionary location is changed.  The minimum
 capacity of PAD is 84 characters.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pad
    jsr enter
    .word here
    .word clit
    .byt 80
    .word plus
    .word exit

```







!! //padjust//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|(.")]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$085f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;22&nbsp;[[>>|(DOES)]]


!!!Subroutine
Called by primitives to adjust `IP` and properly cross a
page boundary.  This routine exists so words like [[."]] and [[?:]]
can function outside the normal [[pad|DOPAGE]]/[[page|DOPAGE]] routines.

|IP+A lo|IP lo|IP hi|
| C set| IP+A| +1|
||||
| < FD| IP+A| IP+A|
| FD| FE| +1|
| FE| FE| +1|
| FF| FE| +1|

There is probably a worst-case scenario where it is possible to
cross two page boundaries, e.g. with [[(.")]] printing a 255-byte
string, where the [[(.")]] was compiled at the very top of the page.

|$42FC-$42FD| [[(.")]] cfa |
|$42FE| $FF(length) |
|$42FF-$43FE| the string |
|$43FF| `NOP` |

In this worst-case scenarios, `IP` would be set after `padjust` to
$44FE and the next execution of [[NEXT|Zero page buffer and NEXT routine]]
would use $4400 as the address of the following instruction.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
padjust
    sec                     ; pass A = offset to be added to IP
    adc ip
    bcc padjust01
    inc ip+1                ; cross the page
padjust01
    cmp #$fd
    bcc padjust02
    inc ip+1                ; cross the page
    cmp #$ff
    beq padjust02
    lda #$fe
padjust02
    sta ip
    rts

```







!! //PAGEALIGN//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|PAGEMARGIN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7091&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;17&nbsp;[[>>|XT,]]


Inserts a NOP instruction (if necessary) to align a JSR ENTER with a page
boundary


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pagealign
    lda uarea+userdp-userarea
    cmp #$fd
    bne pagemargin01
    jsr slip
    ;lda #$00           ; not necessary because C, ignores high byte
    ;sta tos+1
    lda #$ea
    sta tos
    jmp _ccomma

```







!! //PAGEMARGIN//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|NEXTPAGE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7083&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|PAGEALIGN]]


Moves [[DP]] to the next page if it is past the margin, to
work around the NMOS jmp ($xxFF) bug.  The value of `margin`
is the highest usable address within a page, which is `$xxFC`
by default.  The `margin` is located in the code immediately 
following the call to `PAGEMARGIN`.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pagemargin
    ldy #1
    inc ip              ; unsafe, but only used in pettil-compiler
    lda uarea+userdp-userarea
    cmp (ip),y
    bcs _nextpage
pagemargin01
    jmp next

```







!! //PAIRS//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( flag -- )

[[<<|!CSP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7396&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|0PAIRS]]


Counters used by the compiler to match up conditional control words

|Pair ID|Open|Test|Close|h |^1|^BEGIN|^WHILE|^REPEAT<br/>UNTIL<br/>AGAIN|
|^2|^IF|^ELSE|^THEN| |^3|^DO<br/>?DO|^LEAVE<br/>?LEAVE|^LOOP<br/>+LOOP|


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pairs
    jsr docreate
pairs
    .dsb 3,0            ; storage for counters

```







!! //PASS1//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( from to -- )

[[<<|YIN16]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6bab&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;92&nbsp;[[>>|YANG16]]


Copying from [[SYMTAB]] down to [[PAD]], this passes over every
available name length resulting in all names sorted by ascending
size at [[PAD]].

Filtering occurs on this pass for forgotten symbols that fall
between [[NEWDP]] and [[TDICT]].


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pass1
    ;ldy #2
    jsr locals2                 ; targ to N0
    brk
    .byt sub | ACC
    .byt st | N2                ; clear "clone" mode
    .byt set | N8
    .word uarea+usernewdp-userarea
    .byt ldd | N8
    .byt st | N7                ; NEWDP
    .byt ldd | N8
    .byt st | N8                ; TDICT
    .byt ldd | TOS              ; get the first CFA
    .byt br , <(pass1b-*-2)     ; let's go
pass1a
    .byt ext
    .word nfaplus01
pass1b                          ; for each name in symtab...symtail
    .byt ext
    .word yin16                 ; will it blend?
    .byt bp , <(pass1a-*-2)     ; mismatch length? next!
    .byt bm1 , <(pass1j-*-2)    ; end of list?
    .byt bnc , <(pass1d-*-2)    ; first clone?
    .byt ld | TOS               ; clone mode ON
    .byt st | N1                ; pointer to first clone
    .byt push                   ; mark our place
    .byt dcr | N2               ; turn on "clone" mode
    .byt br , <(pass1d-*-2)
pass1c
    .byt pull                   ; clone mode OFF
    .byt sub | ACC
    .byt st | N2
    .byt br , <(pass1a-*-2)
pass1d
    .byt popd | TOS
    .byt ldd | TOS              ; get the CFA
    .byt cpr | N8
    .byt bc , <(pass1e-*-2)     ; in TDICT? green light
    .byt cpr | N7
    .byt bc , <(pass1a-*-2)    ; in CORE? green light
pass1e
    .byt std | N0
    .byt ext
    .word pearsonhash01
    .byt ld | R11
    .byt sti | N0               ; output the CFA and pearson hash
    .byt ld | N2
    .byt bp , <(pass1f-*-2)
    .byt ld | N0
    .byt st | N3                ; copy this, it might be the last one
    .byt ext
    .word smudgeclone16         ; smudge the original
    .byt ext
    .word symcopy16
    .byt ext
    .word unsmudgeclone16       ; unsmudge the copy
    .byt popd | TOS             ; make this clone uncopyable
    .byt ld | N7
    .byt std | TOS
    .byt br , <(pass1a-*-2)
pass1f
    .byt ext
    .word symcopy16
    .byt br , <(pass1a-*-2)
pass1j
    .byt ld | N2                ; check N2
    .byt bp , <(pass1k-*-2)
    .byt inr | N2               ; turn off clone mode
    .byt ld | N3
    .byt st | TOS
    .byt ext
    .word unsmudgeclone16       ; unsmudge (activate) the last clone
    .byt pull
    .byt br , <(pass1a-*-2)     ; unnest
pass1k
    .byt ld | N0
    .byt st | TOS
    .byt nxt

```







!! //PASS2//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( from to -- )

[[<<|YANG16]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6c38&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;25&nbsp;[[>>|(FORGET)]]


Copying from [[PAD]] back to [[SYMTAB]], this passes over each
Pearson hash value.  Names will be ordered chronologically by
size within each Pearson hashed list at [[SYMTAB]].


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pass2
    ;ldy #2
    jsr locals2                 ; targ to N0
    brk
pass2a                          ; for each name in symtab...symtail
    .byt ldd | TOS              ; get cfa from source
    .byt bz , <(pass2c-*-2)     ; done with this pass?
    .byt ext
    .word yang16                ; compare Pearson hash to 'i'
    .byt bnc , <(pass2b-*-2)    ; Pearson hash <> 'i'?
    .byt std | N0               ; write cfa to target
    .byt ext
    .word symcopy16
pass2b
    .byt ext
    .word nfaplus01
    .byt popd | TOS
    .byt br , <(pass2a-*-2)     ; next!
pass2c
    .byt ld | N0
    .byt st | TOS
    .byt nxt

```







!! //PASSBITS//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|(CREATE)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6b22&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|AUTOMEM]]


32-bit wide Bloom filter for skipping [[REHASH]] passes if there
are no words of a particular length


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
passbits
    jsr docreate
    .word 0,0

```







!! //PASTE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|PWRAP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$771c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;5&nbsp;[[>>|WRAP*]]


Paste buffer pointer, starts at [[PAD]]


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
paste
    jsr docreate
    .word 0

```







!! PAUSE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( flag -- )

[[<<|@SWAP!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$19bb&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;30&nbsp;[[>>|?PAUSE]]


Waits for a keypress from the user before exiting

```
: pause   ( flag -- )
    if
        ." \nPRESS ANY KEY\n"
    then
    key drop ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pause
    jsr enter
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(pause02-*+1)
    .word pdq
    .byt <(pause01-*-1)
    .asc CR,"PRESS ANY KEY",CR
pause01
pause02
    .word key
    .word drop
    .word exit

```







!! //PEARSON#//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- pearsonhash )

[[<<|SYMCOPY16]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6907&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;44&nbsp;[[>>|BLOOM]]


input is NFA or address of a counted string
pearsonhash is the thread index (0..f)

the Pearson hash should return an evenly distributed
value between $00-$0f based on the wordset in the
core dictionary.  In other words, all 16 threads
are initially balanced with the same number of words,
to reduce searches to (on average) 1/16th of the
dictionary.

```
symbol table entry
+---------------+
|    CFA[low]   |  -2      Code field address
|    CFA[high]  |
+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
|     [   len   ]  NFA     Length field
[S]             |          Smudge bit
| [V]           |          Vocabulary bit
|   [I]         |          Immediate bit
+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
|   name[1]     |  +1      Name field
|           ... |
|   name[len]   |  +len
+---------------+
?  vocab ident  ?  +len+1  Vocabulary token (if V bit set)
+---------------+
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pearsonhash
    stx z
    jsr pearsonhash01
    ldx z
    jmp put

pearsonhash01
    jsr nfalen01            ; A=length
    sta 2*R11               ; seed hash1 with length
    tay                     ; count backwards
pearsonhash03
    lda (tos),y                     ;[5]
    and #$07                        ;[2] (size of pearson table - 1)
    tax                             ;[2]
    lda 2*R11                       ;[3]
    eor pearson,x                   ;[4]
    sta 2*R11                       ;[3]
    dey
    bne pearsonhash03
    sty 2*R11+1
    lsr
    lsr                     ; xor the pearson hash byte
    lsr                     ; into a single nybble
    lsr                     ; - - - - [ 7 6 5 4 ]
    eor 2*R11               ; 7 6 5 4 [ 3 2 1 0 ]
    and #$0f                ; - - - - [4bit hash]
    sta 2*R11
    rts

```







!! PETSCII&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- c )

[[<<|REPEAT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$74da&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;14&nbsp;[[>>|.S]]


Converts a quoted character to its numeric value

usage: `PETSCII "X" .` responds `88  OK`

`PETSCII` uses `WORD` so parsing rules are lax.
Here are some anomalies when parsing quotes

```
PETSCII """""""""" .  OK
DEPTH . . 1 32  OK
PETSCII "X"." FOO" . FOO88  OK
PETSCII """""C EMIT  OK
EMIT C OK
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_petscii
    jsr enter
    .word clit
    .byt 34
    .word _word
    .word oneplus
    .word cfetch
    .word exit

```







!!Diagram illustrating storage of data and screen blocks

Forth blocks are 1024 bytes.  At 40x25 characters, the PET screen is a mismatch
for the Forth block, coming up 24 bytes short.  Traditionally, Forth blocks
are edited in screen-sized units, and the PET has (in my opinion) the best 
native editing capabilities of any of the three machines in the [["class of '77"|http://www.computerhistory.org/revolution/personal-computers/17/298]]

My solution was metadata.  Packets have two flags.  The "writable?" flag 
is true if this packet is an editor packet.  Screens are editable (WRITABLE? = true).  Data blocks
are not.  Data blocks will be displayed by the screen editor (except for the
last 24 bytes) but when leaving the screen, the editor will not update the
packet for uneditable blocks. Data blocks can be converted to screens by the 
STOP-CLR editor command

The other flag is "uncompressed?" (usually false) which indicates if this
packet is RLE-encoded or merely stored.  Packets are stored in situations where

* the programmer does not want to [[RLENCODE]] or [[RLDECODE]] them
* the [[encoder|RLENCODE]] detects that "negative compression" would occur
 
Packet data is 0..1024 bytes of data

Packet headers consist of the total packet size ("size") ORed with the
"uncompressed?" and "writable?" flags

---
!!Data packet

* Buffer is initialized with null so trailing nulls need not be stored
| !packet data 0..1024 bytes |<|<|
|''runlength datagram''<br>usually present if 'uncompressed?' is false|^3 bytes<br>(byte, byte, count)|<|
|''byte''|1 byte|<|
| !packet header (2 bytes) |<|<|
||<|mask|
|''//writable?//'' (always FALSE)|1 bit|$8000|
|''//uncompressed?//''|1 bit|$4000|
|''//size//'' (2..1026)|11 bits|$07FF|

---
!!Screen packet

* Buffer is initialized with blanks so trailing blanks need not be stored
| !packet linewrap 3 bytes |<|<|
|''linewrap''|^3 bytes|<|
| !packet data 0..1024 bytes |<|<|
|''runlength datagram''<br>usually present if 'uncompressed?' is false|^3 bytes<br>(byte, byte, count)|<|
|''byte''|1 byte|<|
| !packet header (2 bytes) |<|<|
||<|mask|
|''//writable?//'' (always TRUE)|1 bit|$8000|
|''//uncompressed?//''|1 bit|$4000|
|''//size//'' (5..1005)|11 bits|$07FF|







!!PETTIL system memory map
|!RAM|<|<|
|^[[Zero page|PETTIL Zero page memory map]]|$0000<br>$00FF|^6502 zero page|
|^Stack page|$0100<br>$01FF|^6502 stack page|
|^[[TIB]]|$0200<br>$0250|^input buffer|
|~|$0251<br>$0264|^open file table|
|~|$0270<br>$0279|^keyboard buffer queue|
|~|$027A<br>$0329|^cassette buffer #1|
|~|$033A<br>$03F9|^cassette buffer #2|
|!Program storage area|<|<|
| ''PETTIL core dictionary''<br>starts at BASIC and grows upward |<|<|
|^basic|$0400|^start of BASIC program storage|
|^bootstrap<br>zpbuf<br>sweet16<br><br>[[User Area]]<br><br><br><br>Core dictionary|^$0401<br><br>''$0500<br>$05FF''<br><br><br><br><br><br><br><br>[[HERE]]|^PETTIL core dictionary<br>zero page buffer<br>''Sweet-16 instruction handler page''<br><br>* math words<br>* stack words<br>* memory words<br>* virtual memory<br>* i/o<br>* program control|
|[[PAD]]|floats 80 bytes above [[HERE]]|<|
| !<br><br><br>''^''<br>''|''<br>Unused free memory<br>''|''<br>''v''<br><br><br> |<|<|
| !Virtual memory packet buffer |<|<|
|[[VMBUF]]|bottom of virtual memory packet buffer|<|
| <br>packet buffer area<br>(grows downward)<br><br> |<|<|
|[[BLKBUF]]|1K block buffer, used by BLOCK, etc...|<|
| !Symbol Table  |<|<|
|[[SYMTAB]]|Symbol table pearson thread pointers (32 bytes)|<|
| <br><br>Symbol table [[floats|AUTOMEM]]<br>below Transient dictionary<br>Both grow upward<br><br>`MEMSIZ @  SYMTAB !`<br>This phrase discards transient<br>dictionary and symbol table,<br>releasing upper memory<br><br><br> |<|<|
|^[[SYMTAB]]+32<br>[[SYMNEW]]<br>[[SYMTAIL]]|Symbols sorted by size within pearson hash<br>symbols added since last [[REHASH]]<br>next symbol will be added here|<|
| !Transient dictionary<br> |<|<|
|^[[TDICT]]<br><br><br>Transient dictionary<br><br><br>[[MEMSIZ]]|<|^* Interpreter<br>* Compiler<br>* Assembler<br>* Editor<br>* error messages<br><br>Top of RAM|
|!memory mapped video|<|<|
|^[[VIDRAM]]|^$8000<br>$83E7<br>$83E8<br>$83FF|^visible screen area (40x25)<br><br>hidden area [[VIDRAM]]+1000..1023|
|!ROM|<|<|
||$9000<br>$9FFF|^4K unused ROM|
||$A000<br>$AFFF|^4K unused ROM|
||$B000<br>$BFFF|^BASIC ROM|
||$C000<br>$CFFF|~|
||$D000<br>$DFFF|~|
||$E000<br>$~E7FF|^Editor ROM|
|!memory mapped I/O|<|<|
||$E800<br>&nbsp;E810..E813<br>&nbsp;E820..E823<br>&nbsp;E840..~E84F<br>$~E8FF|^I/O chips (incompletely decoded)<br>PIA1<br>PIA2<br>VIA|
|!Kernel ROM|<|<|
|^FFD2 CHROUT<br>FFCF CHRIN|$F000<br>&nbsp;FFFA<br>&nbsp;FFFC<br>&nbsp;FFFE<br>$FFFF|^Kernel ROM<br>6502 NMI vector<br>6502 RESET vector<br>6502 IRQ vector<br>|







|Sweet16 register|<|description|instruction|h
|ACC|$00|accumulator| |
|EXT|$16|extension address| EXT |
|SP|$18|Stack pointer| BS, RS |
|CPR|$1A|Compare result| CPR |
|ST|$1C|Status||
|PC|$1E|Program counter||


|address|PETTIL|<|Sweet16|<|h
|$00|r0|<|R0|ACC|
|$02|tos|Top of stack|R1|TOS|
|$04|n|^ N<br>scratch<br>area<br>for<br>local<br>variables |R2|N0|
|$06|n+2|~|R3|N1|
|$08|n+4|~|R4|N2|
|$0A|n+6|~|R5|N3|
|$0C|n+8|~|R6|N4|
|$0E|n+10|~|R7|N5|
|$10|n+12|~|R8|N6|
|$12|n+14|~|R9|N7|
|$14|n+16|~|R10|N8|
|$16|n+18|~|R11|EXT|
|$18|n+20*|~|R12|SP|
|$1A|n+22|~|R13|CPR|
|$1C|n+24|~|R14|ST|
|$1E|n+26|~|^R15|^PC|
|$20<br>&nbsp;...<br>$4F |^stackl|^Data stack (low) |<|<|
|$50<br>&nbsp;...<br>$7F |^stackh|^Data stack (high) |<|<|
|$80|zi|[[DO]] loop index|<|IREG|
|$82|zlim|[[DO]] loop limit|<|ILIMIT|
|$84|up|User pointer|<|UP|
|^$86<br>$88<br>$8A<br>$8B<br>$8C|^`INC IP`<br>`INC IP`<br>`JMP`<br>`(xxxx)`|<|<|^next<br><br>nexto<br>ip|
||||||
| everything above is preserved in zpbuf<br>everything below (but storex) is kernel zero page |<|<|<|<|
||||||
|^$8D<br>$8E<br>$8F|^Jiffy clock |<|<|^TIME|
|$90|IRQ vector|<|<|CINV|
|$92|BRK vector|<|<|CBINV|
|$94|NMI vector|<|<|NMINV|
|$95<br>&nbsp;...<br>$FE|^normal kernel usage |<|<||
|$FF|temporary storage of X register|<|<|storex|
|* using R12 voids Sweet16's return stack|c

ipha

    .byt $48

!! PICK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( an ... a3 a2 a1 n -- an ... a3 a2 a1 an )

[[<<|*/]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0ff5&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|ROLL]]




 0 pick = same as dup
 1 pick = same as over


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pick
    txa
    clc
    adc tos
    tay
    lda stackh,y
    sta tos+1
    lda stackl,y
    sta tos
    jmp next

```







!! //PKT.INFO//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( packet -- floor length uncompressed? isscr? )

[[<<|>PKT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1612&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;41&nbsp;[[>>|EDITING?]]


Returns the floor, length and flags from a packet header.  [[SCRPKT]]
is $8000 for screen packets, 0 for data packets.  the `uncompressed?`
value is $4000 for uncompressed packets, 0 for [[RLENCODE]]d packets.
The term `size` also includes the 2 byte packet header, while a
packet's `length` is just the contents (`size-2`)

pronounced: "packet-info"

```
: pkt.info   ( block -- floor length uncompressed? isscr? )
    >pkt dup>r pkt.size 2- dup>r -
    r> r> @ dup>r $4000 and r> vidram and scrpkt ! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
pktinfo
    jsr enter
    .word _topkt
    .word duptor
    .word _pktsize
    .word twominus
    .word duptor
    .word minus
    .word rfrom
    .word rfrom
    .word fetch
    .word duptor
    .word plit
    .word $4000
    .word andx
    .word rfrom
    .word vidram
    .word andx
    .word scrpkt
    .word store
    .word exit

```







!! PKT.SIZE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( packet -- packet size )

[[<<|NEXT>R]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$15e6&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|>PKT]]


Returns the packet length from a packet header.  The term `size` includes the 2
byte packet header, where a packet's `length` is just the contents (`size-2`).  The subroutine mode replaces the packet address at
`tos` with the length.  When called as a Forth word, `PKT.SIZE`
pushes the length to `tos` leaving the packet address unchanged
at `2os`.

pronounced: "packet-size"

```
: pkt.size   ( packet -- packet size )
    dup @ $7ff and ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pktsize
    jsr enter
    .word dup
    .word fetch
    .word plit
    .word $07ff
    .word andx
    .word exit

```







!! //PKT+//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr size -- floor )

[[<<|ISSCR?]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$164d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;39&nbsp;[[>>|RLE+]]


inserts a new packet at address.

```
: pkt+   ( addr size -- floor )
    >r vmbuf @ over 1+
    r@ negate  dup vmbuf +!  +move
    r@ over !
    r> - 2+ ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_pktplus
    jsr enter
    .word tor
    .word vmbuf
    .word fetch
    .word over
    .word oneplus
    .word rfetch
    .word negate
    .word dup
    .word vmbuf
    .word plusstore
    .word _plusmove
    .word rfetch
    .word over
    .word store
    .word rfrom
    .word minus
    .word twoplus
    .word exit

```

86 cconstant next

asmput

!! //PWRAP//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|WRAP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7715&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|PASTE]]


Double variable, stores 25 bits of line wrap info for paste buffer

pwrap
    jsr docreate

!! //QSMUDGE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- nfa )

[[<<|SMUDGE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6977&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|UNSMUDGECLONE16]]


Smudges or unsmudges the byte pointed to by `tos`

|<br><i>inputs</i>|<|
|<b>C</b>|<b>0</b> unsmudge<br/><b>1</b> smudge|
|<b>TOS</b>|NFA address|
|<br><i>returns</i>|<|
|^<b>A</b>|altered byte|
|^<b>Y</b>|<b>0</b>|


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
qsmudge
    php
    ldy #0
    lda (tos),y
    asl
    plp
    ror
    sta (tos),y
    rts

```







!! QUERY&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|INTERPRET]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6feb&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;27&nbsp;[[>>|QUIT]]


Accept a line of input from the user

```
: query   ( -- )
    tib 80 expect
    span @ #tib !
    >in off ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_query
    jsr enter
    .word tib
    .word clit
    .byt 80
    .word expect
    .word span
    .word fetch
    .word numtib
    .word store
    .word toin
    .word off
    .word exit

```







!! QUIT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|QUERY]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7006&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;37&nbsp;[[>>|ABORT]]


This is the infinite outer interpreter loop:
      - resets the return stack (RP!)
      - outputs a carriage return (CR)
      - waits for a line of input (QUERY)
      - interprets that line

```
: quit
    [ rp!
    blk off  source!
    begin
        cr
        query interpret
        state @ 0=
        if
            ." OK"
        then
    again ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_quit
    jsr enter
    .word _lbracket             ; STATE OFF
    .word rpstore
    .word blk
    .word off
    .word _sourcestore          ; set input source
quit01                          ; BEGIN
    .word cr
    .word _query
    .word _interpret
    .word state
    .word fetch
    .word zeq
    .word qbranch           ; IF
    .byt <(quit03-*+1)
    .word pdq
    .byt (quit02-*-1)
    .asc    " OK"
quit02
quit03                                  ; THEN AGAIN
    .word branch
    .byt <(quit01-*+1)
;    .word exit

```







!! R@&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n ) ( R; n -- n )

[[<<|DO2CONST]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0a16&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;0&nbsp;[[>>|J]]


Copy the top of the return stack to the data stack

!!! pronounced: "r-fetch"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
rfetch
                                ; you can call me rfetch, or you can call me j,
                                ; but you doesn't have to call me johnson
```







!! R>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- n ) ( R; n -- )

[[<<|ROLL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1023&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;12&nbsp;[[>>|R2D2]]


Remove the top value from the return stack and leave it on the
        computation stack. See >R and R@

!!! pronounced: "r-from"



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
rfrom
    jsr slip
rput
    pla
    sta tos
    pla
    sta tos+1
    jmp next

```







!! R2D2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( an ... a3 a2 a1 n -- an-1 ... a3 a2 a1 an )

[[<<|R>]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$102f&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;34&nbsp;[[>>|DEPTH]]




 remove the nth stack element (excluding n itself) to TOS, dropping n

 2 roll = rot
 1 roll = swap
 0 roll has no effect



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
r2d2
    stx z
    txa
    clc
    adc tos
    tax
    lda stackh,x
    sta tos+1
    lda stackl,x
    sta tos
r2d201
    cpx z
    beq r2d202
    lda stackh-1,x
    sta stackh,x
    lda stackl-1,x
    sta stackl,x
    dex
    bne r2d201
r2d202
    inx
    jmp next

```







!! RANDMASK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- mask )

[[<<|JIFFIES]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1a13&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;20&nbsp;[[>>|RNDMAX]]


returns the next power of 2 mask >= n

```
: randmask   ( n -- mask )
    1
    begin
        2* 2dup u<
    until nip ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_randmask
    jsr enter
    .word one
randmask01
    .word twostar
    .word twodup
    .word ult
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(randmask01-*+1)
    .word oneminus
    .word nip
    .word exit

```







!! RANDOM&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- a )

[[<<|RND]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0f30&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|1+!]]



 Returns the address of the 6-byte random number buffer



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
random
    jsr docreate
randbuff
    .byt $08,$12,$b3,$16,$29,$62        ; random number seed

```







!! RANDU&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- r )

[[<<|SGN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0f05&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;33&nbsp;[[>>|RND]]



 return a random byte in the range 0..255
 from the [[First Book of KIM-1|http://users.telenet.be/kim1-6502/6502/fbok.html]]. Also see [[RND]] and [[RANDOM]]



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
randuc
    ldy #0
    beq randu2

randu
    stx z
    sec
    lda randbuff+1
    adc randbuff+4
    adc randbuff+5
    sta randbuff
    ldx #4
rpl
    lda randbuff,x
    sta randbuff+1,x
    dex
    bpl rpl
    ldx z
    rts

```







!! RDROP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- ) ( R; a -- )

[[<<|RSWAP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0b8c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;5&nbsp;[[>>|0>]]


Drop the top item on the return stack

!!! pronounced: "r-drop"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
rdrop
    pla
    pla
    jmp next

```







!! REDEFINED&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|NEWEST]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6850&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|STATE]]


!!!User variable
Makes something like `: DUP DUP ;` possible.  A little kludgy.  Hints to improve
this are welcome.

contents:

* 0 means we are not in a colon definition and/or not redefining anything
* nonzero means the current : definition is a redefinition



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
redefined
    jsr uservar
    .byt userredefined-userarea

```







!! //REFILL.SCR//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- flag )

[[<<|SOURCE.BLK]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6e1b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;142&nbsp;[[>>|EOL?.SCR]]


Loads the next logical line from the virtual screen buffer into another
80-character buffer, returning a flag indicating if there was a next line

```
: refill.scr   ( -- )
    #lin off
    >in off
    lin dup 1+! @
    25 <
    if
        lin @                   ( lin )
        dup >bit blkbuf + cbit@ ( lin flag )
        swap 24 = or            ( flag )
        if
            forty
        else
            lin 1+! eighty
        then                    ( 40|80 )
        dup    LNMX c!
        3      DFLTN c!
        @lin @ PNT dup dup>r 3c@ >r >r !
        0      PNTR c!          ( 40|80 )
        cas2buf over 2dup expect -trailing
        r> r> r> 3c!            ( restore screen cursor )
        @lin +!
        span @  #lin !
    then ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_refillscr
    jsr enter
    .word numlin
    .word off
    .word toin
    .word off
    .word lin
    .word dup
    .word oneplusstore
    .word fetch
    .word clit
    .byt 25
    .word lt
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(refillscr03-*+1)
    .word lin
    .word fetch
    .word dup
    .word tobit
    .word _blkbuf
    .word plus
    .word cbitfetch
    .word swap
    .word clit
    .byt 24
    .word eq
    .word orx
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(refillscr01-*+1)
    .word forty
    .word branch
    .byt <(refillscr02-*+1)
refillscr01
    .word lin
    .word oneplusstore
    .word eighty
refillscr02
    .word dup
    .word clit
    .byt LNMX
    .word cstore
    .word three
    .word clit
    .byt DFLTN
    .word cstore
    .word atlin
    .word fetch
    .word clit
    .byt PNT
    .word dup
    .word duptor
    .word threecfetch
    .word tor
    .word tor
    .word store
    .word zero
    .word clit
    .byt PNTR
    .word cstore
    .word dup
    .word atlin
    .word plusstore
    .word cas2buf
    .word swap
    .word twodup
    .word expect
    .word dashtrailing
    .word dup
    .word span
    .word store
    .word numlin
    .word store
    .word drop
    .word rfrom
    .word rfrom
    .word rfrom
    .word threecstore
refillscr03
    .word exit

```







!! REHASH&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|(FORGET)]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6ce9&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|FORGET]]


Rebuilds the symbol table in high memory.

```
: rehash  ( -- )
    here (forget) ;   \ effectively a FORGET nil
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_rehash
    jsr enter
    .word here
    .word _pforget
    .word exit

```







!! REPEAT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( )

[[<<|AGAIN]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$74c6&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;20&nbsp;[[>>|PETSCII]]





d;m 0 8f;m 1f0 1ff;m 73a0 73a2;m 1a90 1b2f;z

```
' ?branch 2 control repeat
    ] 2>r swap 2r> ?<resolve drop ?>resolve ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_repeat
    jsr docontrol
    .word branch
    .byt <(-1)
    .word twotor
    .word swap
    .word tworfrom
    .word _qfromresolve
    .word drop
    .word _qtoresolve
    .word exit
```







!! REPEAT,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|WHILE,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7c43&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;19&nbsp;[[>>|NOT]]


```
: repeat,   >r >r 1 ?pairs jmp,
    r> r> 2- [compile] then, ; immediate
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_asmrepeat
    jsr enter
    .word twotor
    .word one
;    .word _qpairs
    .word ijmp
    .word tworfrom
    .word twominus
    .word _compile
    .word _asmthen
    .word exit

```







!! //RESTORE-FORTH//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|STASH-FORTH]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$174a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;8&nbsp;[[>>|DOTAPEIO]]


Restore Forth stack after BASIC system call



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
restoreforth
    jsr aloha2
    ldx n
    jmp exit

```







!! RLDECODE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( from to size -- )

[[<<|RLENCODE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$15b4&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;38&nbsp;[[>>|NEXT>R]]


decode length {srclen} bytes beginning at source address
{srcaddr} to the target address (targaddr).


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
rldecode
    ;ldy #4
    jsr locals4
    brk
    .byt set | N4
    .word $100
rldecode01
    .byt ld | N4
    .byt st | N2        ; set prev to unmatchable value
rldecode02
    .byt ld | TOS
    .byt bz , <(rldecode06-*-2)
    .byt dcr | TOS      ; decrement source counter
    .byt ldi | N0       ; read source stream
    .byt sti | N1       ; write target stream
    .byt cpr | N2
    .byt st | N2
    .byt ld | R13
    .byt bnz , <(rldecode02-*-2)    ; different? go get more
rldecode03
    .byt dcr | TOS      ; decrement source counter
    .byt ldi | N0       ; get the repeat count
    .byt bnz, <(rldecode04-*-2)
    .byt ld | N4
rldecode04
    .byt st | N3
    .byt dcr | N3
    .byt bz , <(rldecode01-*-2)
rldecode05
    .byt dcr | N3
    .byt bz , <(rldecode01-*-2)
    .byt ld | N2
    .byt sti | N1       ; write target stream
    .byt br , <(rldecode05-*-2)
rldecode06
    .byt pull           ; drop srclen
    .byt nxt

```







!! //RLE+//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( pkt -- floor )

[[<<|PKT+]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1674&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;37&nbsp;[[>>|MKPKTS]]


Converts the given packet into a maximum-sized packet so it may be used
as a temporary buffer by [[RLENCODE]]. This is a design-around to avoid
adding a second [[BLKBUF]] block buffer to the system.  Returns the
address of the beginning of the 1K temporary buffer.

```
: rle+   ( pkt -- floor )
    dup>r  b/buf dup 2+ r@ pkt.len
    >r 2- over r> - pkt+ drop
    r> ! - ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_rleplus
    jsr enter
    .word duptor
    .word bperbuf
    .word dup
    .word twoplus
    .word rfetch
    .word _pktsize
    .word tor
    .word twominus
    .word over
    .word rfrom
    .word minus
    .word _pktplus
    .word drop
    .word rfrom
    .word store
    .word minus
    .word exit

```







!! RLENCODE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( from to size -- targend uncompressed? )

[[<<|WRAP^]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$156a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;74&nbsp;[[>>|RLDECODE]]


encode length {srclen} bytes from source address {srcaddr} to
target address {targaddr}.  Return target end address {targend}


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
rlencode
    ; tos   src (pristine)
    ; n0    src (in)
    ; n1    size (in)
    ; n2    targ (out)
    ; n3    size (out)
    ; n4    repeat
    ; n5    prev
    ; n6    $100
    ; n7    targ (pristine)
    ; n8    size (pristine)
    brk
    .byt ld | TOS       ; size
    .byt st | N1        ; size (in)
    .byt st | N3        ; size (out)
    .byt st | N8        ; size (pristine)
    .byt pull           ; to
    .byt st | N2        ; targ (out)
    .byt st | N7        ; targ (pristine)
    .byt pull           ; from -- TOS = src (pristine)
    .byt st | N0        ; src (pristine)
    .byt set | N6       ; constant used to initialize (max repeat counter)
    .word $100
rlencode01
    .byt ld | N6        ; also unfindable character
rlencode02
    .byt st | N5        ; prev character
    .byt ld | N3
    .byt bm , <(rlencode07-*-2)      ; is RL encoding no size benefit?
    .byt ld | N1
    .byt bz , <(rlencode06-*-2)      ; done with input?
    .byt ldi | N0       ; read input stream
    .byt dcr | N1
    .byt sti | N2       ; write output stream
    .byt dcr | N3
    .byt cpr | N5       ; compare to prev
    .byt bnz , <(rlencode02-*-2)    ; different? go get more
    .byt ld | N6
    .byt st | N4        ; count backwards from 256
    .byt dcr | N4       ; count the one already in output stream
rlencode03
    .byt dcr | N4
    .byt bz , <(rlencode04-*-2)     ; overflow?
    .byt ld | N1
    .byt bz , <(rlencode04-*-2)     ; end of input?
    .byt ldi | N0       ; get from input stream
    .byt dcr | N1
    .byt cpr | N5
    .byt bz , <(rlencode03-*-2)     ; same char? loop

    .byt dcr | N0       ; different char?
    .byt inr | N1       ; un-get from input stream
rlencode04              ; overflow/end of input
    .byt ld | N6
    .byt sub | N4
    .byt sti | N2       ; write count to output stream
    .byt dcr | N3
    .byt br , <(rlencode01-*-2)

rlencode06              ; win
    .byt ld | N2        ; targ (out)
    .byt st | TOS
    .byt sub | ACC
    .byt push
    .byt nxt


;    rlencode
;( targend uncompressed? ; floor  pkt )

rlencode07              ; lose - copy
    .byt ld | TOS
    .byt st | N0        ; keep pristine TOS
    .byt ld | N8        ; size
    .byt add | N7       ; +pristine targ
    .byt st | TOS
    .byt set | ACC
    .word $4000
    .byt push
    .byt ld | N0
    .byt push
    .byt ld | N7
    .byt push
    .byt ld | N8
    .byt push
    .byt rtn
    jmp cmove

```







!! RND&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- r )

[[<<|RANDU]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0f26&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|RANDOM]]



 return a random number in the range 0..65535
 from the [[First Book of KIM-1|http://users.telenet.be/kim1-6502/6502/fbok.html]]



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
rnd
    jsr randu
    tay
randu2
    jsr randu
    jmp pushya

```







!! RNDMAX&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( max -- rnd )

[[<<|RANDMASK]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1a27&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;37&nbsp;[[>>|40/MOD]]


generate a random unsigned byte less than `max`

```
: rndmax   ( max -- )
    dup 0= ?exit
    1- dup randmask
    begin
        randu
        3dup and >
    while
        drop
    repeat
    and nip ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_rndmax
    jsr enter
    .word dup
    .word zeq
    .word _qexit
    .word oneminus
    .word dup
    .word _randmask
rndmax01
    .word randuc
    .word _threedup
    .word andx
    .word lt
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(rndmax02-*+1)
    .word drop
    .word branch
    .byt <(rndmax01-*+1)
rndmax02
    .word andx
    .word nip
    .word exit

```







!! ROL,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|LSR,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d95&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|ROR,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a ROL opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
irol
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $21
    .word $0d0d

```







!! ROLL&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( an ... a3 a2 a1 n -- an-1 ... a3 a2 a1 an )

[[<<|PICK]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1007&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;28&nbsp;[[>>|R>]]


Remove the nth stack element (excluding n itself) to TOS, dropping n

 2 roll = rot
 1 roll = swap
 0 roll has no effect



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
roll
    txa
    clc
    adc tos
    tax
    lda stackh,x
    pha
    lda stackl,x
    pha
roll01
    inx
    dec tos
    bmi rput
    dex
    lda stackh-1,x
    sta stackh,x
    lda stackl-1,x
    sta stackl,x
    dex
    bne roll01          ; bra

```







!! ROR,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|ROL,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d9b&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|STX,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a ROR opcode


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
iror
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $61
    .word $0d0d

```







!! ROT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( a b c -- b c a )

[[<<|>]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0d6c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;27&nbsp;[[>>|THIRD]]






<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
rot
    ldy stackh+1,x
    lda stackh,x
    sta stackh+1,x
    lda tos+1
    sta stackh,x
    sty tos+1
    ldy stackl+1,x
    lda stackl,x
    sta stackl+1,x
    lda tos
    sta stackl,x
    sty tos
    jmp next

```







!! RP!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|DECIMAL]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$080a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|(")]]


Ordinarily the 6502 machine stack (aka PETTIL return stack) is
initialized to $01ff by BASIC, but the value stored at RP0 defaults
to $01fe instead.  This is because the PET ROM stores a line of
input at $0200 (where TIB points) and INTERPRET will be storing a
count of the first word on the line at $01ff


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
rpstore
    txa
    ldx uarea+userrp0-userarea
    txs
    tax
rpstore01
    jmp next

```







!! RP0&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|SP0]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$06f1&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|DP]]


[heading]User variable[/heading]
The return stack initialization value ($01FE)


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
rp0
    jsr uservar
    .byt userrp0-userarea

```







!! RSWAP&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- ) ( R; a b -- b a )

[[<<|DUP>R]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0b81&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;11&nbsp;[[>>|RDROP]]


Swap the top two items on the return stack

!!! pronounced: "r-swap"

```
: rswap   ( ; r1 r2 -- ; r2 r1)
   2r> >r >r ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_rswap
    jsr enter
    .word tworfrom
    .word tor
    .word tor
    .word exit

```

!! S>D&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- d )

[[<<|PAD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0eea&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|SGN]]

_stod

!! SA#&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|STARTUP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0709&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|DRV#]]


!!!User variable
User variable that holds the secondary address for [[FILE]]

!!!pronounced: "S-A-num"


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

sanum

!! SAVE-BUFFERS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|CASBUF]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$17dc&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;20&nbsp;[[>>|(LOADVERIFY)]]


Writes the virtual memory area between [[VMBUF]] and [[BLKBUF]] out
to a PRG file on cassette or disk

Also called by STOP-S in the editor

```
: save-buffers   ( -- )
    (prg-file)
    (vmbuf) next-1
    >r 2>r
    [ SETEALSTAL , ]
    (saveprg) ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_savebuffers
    jsr enter
    .word _pprgfile             ; set up z.p. device, secondary, filename
    .word _pvmbuf
    .word clit
    .byt <(next-1)             ; stupid stack tricks
    .word tor
    .word twotor
    .word SETEALSTAL            ; invoke a ROM routine, RTS to NEXT
    .word psaveprg
    .word exit

```







!! SAVE-FORTH&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|LOAD]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7389&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;0&nbsp;[[>>|?CSP]]



 Writes a binary file of the core dictionary to mass storage
 ($0401 to HERE)

 ~ todo



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_saveforth
;    jsr enter
;    .word exit

```







!! SBC,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|ORA,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d71&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;6&nbsp;[[>>|STA,]]


!!!Assembler instruction
compiles a SBC opcode

```
isbc
    jsr _domcpu
    .byt $e0
    .word $1c6e

```







!! //SCAN//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr count char -- addr count )

[[<<|SKIP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6f2c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;27&nbsp;[[>>|'STREAM]]



 addr1 is the starting address in the input stream where up
 to count1 bytes are skipped *UNTIL* they match char.  Returns
 addr2 as the address of the first non-matching character and
 count2 as the remaining number of bytes in the buffer.



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
scan
    brk
    .byt bs, <(skipscan01-*-2)      ; setup
scan01
    .byt bs, <(skipscan02-*-2)      ; next char
    .byt bnz, <(scan01-*-2)
    .byt br, <(skipscan04-*-2)

skipscan01
    .byt ld | TOS   ; char
    .byt st | N1
    .byt pull
    .byt st | N0
    .byt pull       ; addr
    .byt rs
skipscan02
    .byt ldi | TOS
    .byt dcr | N0
    .byt bm1 , <(skipscan03-*-2)    ; leave if count < 0
    .byt sub | N1
    .byt rs
skipscan03
    .byt popd | R12 ; drop the BS return
skipscan04
    .byt dcr | TOS
    .byt inr | N0
    .byt ld | N0
    .byt push
    .byt nxt

```







!! SCR&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|BLK]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0739&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|LIN]]


The address of a user variable containing the
number of the screen most recently LISTed or EDITed


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
scr
    jsr uservar
    .byt userscr-userarea

```







!! //SCR0//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|WRAP!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$1703&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;13&nbsp;[[>>|#VMPKT!]]


Reset [[SCR]] and [[BLK]] to screen/block 0.

```
: scr0   ( -- )
    blk off  scr off ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_scr0
    jsr enter
    .word blk
    .word off
    .word scr
    .word off
    .word exit

```







!! //SCRDEL//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( scr -- packet )

[[<<|EDITDELSCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$796c&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;0&nbsp;[[>>|EDITINSSCR]]


STOP-DEL Delete Screen

Deletes the current screen from the packet buffer.  The edit
screen is replaced by the first available of:

* The next screen in the packet buffer, if it already exists

* The previous screen in the packet buffer

* Screen 0 is blanked and written to the packet buffer

~ this is never called

```
: scrdel   ( scr -- packet )
    >pkt
    dup @
    vmbuf @ 2dup +
    dup
    vmbuf ! rot
    cmove
    #vmpkt 1-! ;
```


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_scrdel
;    jsr enter
;    .word _topkt
;    .word dup
;    .word fetch
;    .word vmbuf
;    .word fetch
;    .word twodup
;    .word plus
;    .word dup
;    .word vmbuf
;    .word store
;    .word rot
;    .word cmove
;    .word numvmpkt
;    .word oneminusstore
;    .word exit

```







!! SCRPKT&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr )

[[<<|#VMPKT]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$071d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|EDITING]]


!!!User variable
PETTIL's editor distinguishes between "data" and "screen" blocks
using a bitflag (metadata) in the packet header.

Data blocks are 1024 bytes and can't be completely displayed on
the PET's 40x25 hardware.  The editor will show the first 1000 bytes
and otherwise treats such blocks as read-only.

Screens (typically source code) are read-write and the editor
will update the virtual memory packet buffer when leaving the screen,
e.g. via the STOP-Q editor command.  Screens also contain 24 bits
of linewrap information (the first three bytes of the block buffer),
and are treated as a collection of 40-character or 80-character
lines by the compiler.  In other words, line terminations are
considered to be whitespace when loading screens, and source lines
can extend all the way to the left and right edges.

The STOP-CLR editor command converts a data block into a screen,
discarding the last (unseen) 24 bytes and initializing the linewrap
to all 40-character lines, or it will reset the linewrap on existing
screens.  Changes aren't saved to the packet buffer until the screen
is exited.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
scrpkt
    jsr uservar
    .byt userscrpkt-userarea

```







Vocabularies are stored at [[VSTACK]] and are searched from left to
right, with the search terminating when `vocabid` 0 [[FORTH]] is 
reached. Consider this example:

```
: FRED  ." YABBA DABBA DOO" ;
VOCABULARY GERMAN
GERMAN DEFINITIONS
: FRED  ." JA JA DABBA DOO" ;
VOCABULARY FRENCH
FRENCH DEFINITIONS
: FRED  ." OOH LA LA DABBA DOO" ;
: FRED  ." OUI OUI" ;
FORTH FORGET FRED
VOCABULARY LATIN
LATIN
: FRED  ." ABBAYAY ABBADAY OODAY" ;
```
* All three `FRED` symbols will be appended sequentially at [[SYMNEW]] 
* [[CURRENT]] defaults to `0`, so the first `FRED` is a member of [[FORTH]]
* [[VOCABULARY]] `GERMAN` creates a new vocabulary in [[FORTH]] having `vocabid` 2
* `GERMAN` sets that vocabulary as the first to search in [[VSTACK]]
* [[DEFINITIONS]] sets [[CURRENT]] to the first vocabulary in [[VSTACK]] (`GERMAN`)
* [[VOCABULARY]] `FRENCH` creates a new vocabulary in [[FORTH]] having `vocabid` 3
** All vocabularies are defined in [[FORTH]] regardless of [[CURRENT]].
* `FRENCH` becomes first, `GERMAN` the second vocabulary in the search order
* [[DEFINITIONS]] next sets [[CURRENT]] to `FRENCH`
* `FRED` is defined as a member of `FRENCH`
* `FRED` is redefined, also as a member of `FRENCH`
** This smudges the earlier `FRED` definition in the `FRENCH` vocabulary
* Invoking [[FORTH]] resets the search order to only [[FORTH]]
* The original `FRED` is found, which has the lowest `CFA`.  All words defined after will be gone after [[FORGET]] finishes
* [[VOCABULARY]] `LATIN` creates a new vocabulary in [[FORTH]] having `vocabid` 4
* The last `FRED` will be a member of the [[FORTH]] vocabulary, because [[FORGET]] resets the search order to [[FORTH]] only

* To find the most recently defined word first, search goes in this order:
# within each vocabulary at [[VSTACK]]
## the unordered list at [[SYMNEW]]
## the ordered list for the word's Pearson hash at [[SYMTAB]]







!! SEC,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|RTS,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d29&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|SED,]]


!!!Assembler instruction

isec

    .byt $38

!! SED,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

[[<<|SEC,]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$7d2d&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;4&nbsp;[[>>|SEI,]]

!! SEI,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- )

!! SGN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- -1|0|1 )

[[<<|S>D]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0ef3&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;18&nbsp;[[>>|RANDU]]



 return the sign of n



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
sgn
    ldy #$ff
    lda tos+1
    bmi sgn01       ; negative
    iny
    ora tos
    beq sgn01       ; zero
    lda #1          ; positive
    .byt $24        ; BIT zp to skip over tya
sgn01
    tya
    jmp put

```







!! SIGN&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- )

[[<<|#>]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$142a&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;15&nbsp;[[>>|(#)]]



 If n is negative, an ASCII "-" (minus sign) is appended to the
 pictured numeric output string.  Typically used between <# and #> .



<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
_sign
    jsr enter
    .word zlt
    .word qbranch
    .byt <(sign01-*+1)
    .word clit
    .byt '-'
    .word _hold
sign01
    .word exit

```







!! //SKIP//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( addr1 size1 char -- addr2 count2 )

[[<<|SOURCE!]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6f23&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;9&nbsp;[[>>|SCAN]]



 addr1 is the starting address in the input stream where up
 to size1 bytes are skipped *WHILE* they match char.  Returns
 addr2 as the address of the first non-matching character and
 count2 as the remaining number of bytes in the buffer.


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
skip
    brk
    .byt bs, <(skipscan01-*-2)      ; setup
skip01
    .byt bs, <(skipscan02-*-2)      ; next char
    .byt bz, <(skip01-*-2)
    .byt br, <(skipscan04-*-2)      ; exit
```







!! //slide//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- )

[[<<|WARNING]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0761&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;30&nbsp;[[>>|Aloha]]


!!!Subroutine
Drop the top stack item

Always clears Z flag on return


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
slide
    lda stackh,x                ; slide something off of the stack
    sta tos+1
    lda stackl,x
    sta tos
    inx                         ; stack pointer is never 0
    rts

```







!! //slip//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( n -- n n )

[[<<|DUP]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$0c31&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;10&nbsp;[[>>|+!]]


Push TOS to the stack (DUP)


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
slip
    dex                         ; slip something onto the stack
    lda tos+1
    sta stackh,x
    lda tos
    sta stackl,x
    rts

```







!! SMUDGE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- )

[[<<|UNSMUDGE]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6970&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;7&nbsp;[[>>|QSMUDGE]]


Turn on the smudge bit.  Smudged names won't be found by FIND.
In PETTIL, the smudge bit does double duty, also marking as
inactive any names that have been [[REDEFINED]].


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
smudge
    sec
    lda #>(drop-1)
    pha
    lda #<(drop-1)
    pha
;    jsr qsmudge
;    jmp drop

```







!! //SMUDGECLONE16//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( nfa -- nfa )

[[<<|UNSMUDGECLONE16]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6985&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|>NAME]]


Unsmudge the last clone


<$button popup="$:/state/codeSlider">code</$button><$reveal type="nomatch" text="" default="" state="$:/state/codeSlider" animate="yes">

```
smudgeclone16
    sec
    bcs qsmudge             ; bra

```







!! //SOURCE//&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;( -- addr size )

[[<<|SOURCE.SCR]]&nbsp;address:&nbsp;$6edc&nbsp;&nbsp;size:&nbsp;3&nbsp;[[>>|SOURCE!]]


Returns the base address of the buffer that [[INTERPRET]] is
reading from, and the buffer size.

source
    jmp (uarea+uservsource-userarea)
